prompt: Some people think that employers should not care about the way their employees dress, because what matters is the quality of their work. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
In the modern society, people’s work clothes have attracted much concern.Some people hold the view that the style of the staff should not be paid attention to by the manager on the grounds that the work productivity is of importance. Personally, I believe the way they dress completely depends on the type of their company or job.
On the one hand, formal clothes are suitable for profesional jobs as well as in disciplined settings. Several certain jobs such as lawyer, doctor, teacher and even sales people require people dress up smartly and courteously which undoutedly boost confidence and work efficiency.For example, when wearing white blouse in the hospital, doctors may be more aware of the value of their work in order to try their best to fulfill their duty. Futhermore, should they wear smart clothes, they will be respectful towards others, which affects social interaction and be enormously significant to those face-to-face jobs, especially marketing or receptionist.
On the other hand, there are remarkable reasons why a multitude of individuals  hold the notion that using formal clothes is unnecessary. First of all, clothings are not reflective of the worker’s own performance or their ability. For instance, technological company like Google and Facebook are well-known for their relaxed dress codes because they aim to create an informal, exciting and creative environment; consequently, they produce sophisticated and convenient products despite casual clothes. Secondly, informal clothes are oustanding choices for not only sedentary work styles but also active employess. Loose clothes help relax their muscles, bring comfort and their actions will not be limited.
In conclusion, although clothing does not reflex one’s ability to work, the style of people should be appropriate for their jobs. While in professional setting formal clothes increase people’s self-confidence together with the work productivity and show respect to other people, casual clothes make the staff relaxed and also be convenient for moving employees.
evaluation:

prompt:
Some people believe that eventually all jobs will be done by artificially inetligent robots.


What is your opinion?
essay:
Robotic technology is relatively new in our life. As we can imagine, this science will be developed more in the future. However, it has already started to replace some people's positions. Is it possible for all jobs will be done by AI robots? In my opinion, lots of professions could be done by them. 

Physical work could be done by robots because they design for human needs. For example, a small engine could help a surgeon to doctor or a strong one could work instead of a human. They don't get tired or sick. In addition, they would protect people from dangerous situations. For instance, harmful weather conditions such as oxygen level or temperature don't bother them, and even if they them affect, they could be repaired.

In the contrast, there are lots of careers that they can not do. Robots don't have emotions or ethical values. They act like how they codded. For example, if you give a couple of pictures to AI and ask for a new one, it would create an art piece but without any inputs, it can not do. It's same for the music or other kinds of art. Moreover, society always needs psychological help or communication. Again robots can not meet these needs, at least not in close future.

To sum up, robots could do some people's jobs. Mostly, robots would serve people and do this job instead of them. However, they can not work in any sector. Many jobs need ethical values and emotions so, they can not replace humans.

prompt: Advertisements are becoming more and more common in everyday life. Is it a positive or negative development?
essay:
Advertisements take up more and more space in daily life. In my opinion, advertisements increasing day by day is a positive development which can lead to improved competition among the companies and to ensure a growing national economy. 

To begin with, there are positive consequences of advertising increasing day by day for companies and customers. Most important development is that this can ensure more competition among the dominant companies in the market. This leads to companies to increase their product diversity and they try to enhance their customer satisfaction. In this way, customers can have a choice of a better product and better purchase. Take some customers, who have some criteria for choosing a product, for example; they can create an attention-grabbing difference in the quality of product as they are picky people. 

Moreover, this can provide positive development for the national economy. Advertisement can encourage the economic growth of businesses in many different sectors.This promotion firstly owns companies' improvement economically that can be through attracting more customers and then it contributes to their industries that more money is in circulation as both production and consumption increase. All of these may lead to economic welfare which can increase employment and can create new job opportunities. In this way, the country's economy has benefited from the positive effect of these.

To conclude, although the increase in advertising may seem bad at first that it becomes more and more popular, it has brought some positive consequences for this to be considered positive development.
evaluation:

prompt:
Some people think that art is an essential subject for children at school while others think it is a waste of time.
Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
Currently, there are raging debates about whether art is an important subject in academy courses and it can be ignored among most students. Hence, I will scrutinize both aspects in further paragraphs in a student’s view and after analysis, an opinion will be provided.


	To embark on, there are many reasons for supporting other subjects in the children’s school curriculum; initially, learning in modern technology becomes a demanding skill of most professions. If students emphasize only studying arts, they will not be able to gain an opportunity to recruit in advanced companies. Besides that, the essential knowledge of other subjects, like Mathematics and Science, is more highly required in every particular field. Another reason is that arts, notwithstanding being highly appreciated, still do not ensure in student’s career path as most of the fields, such as Engineering, Marketing, IT professional and Management studies are also found in bachelor’s and master’s degree courses.


	On the contrary, art is a creative skill that requires wonderful imagination power. Art allows students to express their feelings and ideas through painting without explaining by words. For instance, once I draw a picture I do not need to be strained and merely relax by imagining throughout a fancy world. Additionally, art also brings laurels to each country and ensures that their cultural inheritance will not extinct. Thus, they are highly paid and appreciated and this kind of respect is not less than flourished careers.


To conclude, there are both sides of advantages and drawbacks to whether art or academic subjects are necessary for students. To compare, the main school subjects are significant for students applying to university. Moreover, most major courses are also required for recruiting in advanced enterprises. In contrast, Art is the cultural symbol of the country that can maintain a stable image of the nation. However, in my perspective, selections of school subjects should depend on students because that will increase the student’s attraction to learn and advocate their career path in the appropriate way as well.

prompt: Some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to a successful career, while others believe that it is better to get a job straight after school. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
After completing school life, all teenagers struggle to resolve the problem whether they should enter into a university for a degree or look for a job. Some see more plus points of doing a bachelors degree and start their career life afterwards, while others prefer to start an employment right away without doing further learnings. However, below paragraphs support the first view with reliable supporting ideas as having a degree or same qualification explores a vast range of opportunities for a person.

If an adolescent finds difficult to make a choice between above mentioned options, he or she should pick the option of possessing one or more academic qualifications which are acceptable in the job market. When they own such qualifications, employers ready to offer them amazing salary packages which can never be achieved merely by school leavers. These compensations may consist of vehicle allowances, accommodations, tour packages and so on. As well as, having more academic and professional certificates in someone’s certificate file may open more and more doors into a huge world locally and internationally. This is because, the quality of a job seeker can be measured from qualifications he or she holds based on standards and norms in the job market.

Eventhough enrolling with higher education program is best for the success, all do not get that chance due to various reasons. But, there are number of examples in the world to prove that an academic qualification is not a must to win the life. If someone is interested in becoming expert in some field which experience matters more than the knowledge, he or she can choose that job instead of a degree. Not only that, if they are financially weak to continue learning, they can apply for a job and secure their financial status first.

Then they can start some academic things if required.

Accordingly, entering into a higher education after the school gives more choices in life to succeed rather than just doing a job.

On the one hand, some people believe that there are bad side effects which can bother children , such as physical problems . Studies shows the children who play more video games ar more likely to suffer from backache and eyesight problem because they were staring to monitor for too long during the day . This has caused notoriety for video games.

On the other hand , there are some pros in playing video games that can benefit children. For instance, a veriety of educational video games has been created that kids can learn from them , such as mathgames, english learning games and so on. Thus, This could be helpfull for younger individuals  as their growing up.

In my opinion, although playing video games have disadvantages , advantages of playing video games outweighs . Also, the effectiveness of these games on kids should be used in a way that leads to progress . To sum up , while two ideas how their significance and importance, playing video games by children have more beneficial impacts.

prompt: Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Some people think that adolescent-age children should be encouraged to do unpaid volunteering in their spare time. On the contrary, others believe that doing it for free can be prodigal for them. In this essay, I would present that community work can help teenagers to boost their careers and aid society to have a sustainable environment.

Opponents of free community service by teenage children advocate that it can leave a dip in the children's pockets if they are bearing all their expenses with the small amount of pocket money which they get monthly. For example, many unpaid volunteers use their own money during their work to provide instant help to those who are in need. However, I would argue that this can be overcome by doing a part-time job apart from social welfare services. This would help them to earn some money, as well as, acquire time management skills.

Further, I would argue that volunteering helps adolescents to learn how to work in groups. This would help them to grow professionally when they start working in the corporate world.  For instance, they will learn how to perform in a group with people of different opinions and cultural backgrounds. The more they volunteer , the more it will groom their personality and career. Additionally, they can assist in environmental sustainability by spreading awareness among people about the depletion of natural resources and developing a sense of responsibility for saving them . This could help people to learn, how to utilize the resources judiciously and save them for  future generations. Hence, social work can educate society on how to mitigate  further environmental degradation .

In conclusion, while I acknowledge that unpaid community service can be financially non-profitable for teenagers, I would argue that it can be beneficial in their career growth and can help society in  conserving  natural resources.
evaluation:
## Task Achievement:
- The candidate has addressed the task by providing a clear stance on the topic and presenting arguments for and against the requirement of unpaid community work for teenagers.
- The response is coherent and clearly presented, with a logical flow of ideas.
- The candidate has fully covered all parts of the task and provided appropriate support for their arguments.
- Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 8.0

## Coherence and Cohesion:
- The essay is well-organized and structured, with clear transitions between paragraphs.
- The candidate uses linking devices effectively to connect ideas and paragraphs, creating a cohesive flow of information.
- There is a logical progression of ideas throughout the essay.
- Suggested Band Score (Coherence and Cohesion): 7.5

## Lexical Resource (Vocabulary):
- The candidate demonstrates a good range of vocabulary, using appropriate and varied terms throughout the essay.
- There are a few minor inaccuracies in vocabulary, such as "dip" (decline) and "prodigal" (wasteful).
- **Suggested Vocabulary Modifications:**
    - "dip" -> "decline"
    - "prodigal" -> "unprofitable"
- The vocabulary is generally appropriate for the given context.
- Suggested Band Score (Lexical Resource): 7.0

prompt:
Some people believe that eventually all jobs will be

done by artificially intelligent robots.

What is your opinion?
essay:
Artificial intelligence and its impact on employment is increasingly becoming a hot topic of debate. While a number of people believe that artificially intelligent robots will replace humans to do all jobs in the long term, there are many who have opposing views. This essay will argue that eventually, most jobs will indeed be done by robots powered by artificial intelligence although not all jobs as believed by some.

Around the world, giant strides have been made with regards to the capacity of artificial intelligent robots to carry out complex tasks typically done by humans in industries like manufacturing, shipping and information technology. These robots are consistently demonstrating higher efficiency levels with cheaper overhead costs than their human counterparts, causing many industry leaders to cut down on their human workforce in favour of adopting robotic systems. For example, Tesla, the global leader in electric vehicle manufacturing, recently announced plans to lay off 20% of its workforce as well as plans to build two new factories across North America that will be fully operated using robots powered by artificial intelligence. Many more of such announcements are expected in the coming decades, corroborating the belief that human beings will be made redundant as more artificially intelligent robots replace them at their jobs. 

However, not all occupations can be efficiently done by these robots. Professions such as prostitution, policing, marketing and customer service require human factors such as empathy and emotions to be delivered efficiently. For instance, studies show that many customers prefer to interact with a human customer service agent over the phone to help resolve their problems, rather than interact with a non-human system. To sum it up, artificial intelligence may never be able to replicate the human factors listed and as such cannot perform tasks that require these factors. 

This essay has argued that artificial intelligence robots will eventually be able to do most jobs and also touched on the fact that not all jobs can be done by these robots. In my opinion, a lot of jobs will be done by robots in the long-term but not all jobs.

prompt:
Some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to a successful career, while others believe that it is better to get a job straight after school.  

Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
In recent times, it is believed by some that pursuing academic life is the best approach to a successful job, however, others opine that starting a profession right after school would be a better choice; I take the view with the latter. The following essay will discuss both sides and argue the writer’s  viewpoint.

To begin with, many people probably think that acquiring more knowledge by spending time studying at a university or college is of great significance when it comes to candidates' career success. Take an architect for example, becoming aware of the latest architectural methods and research, during his academic years at university while being educated by leading authorities, this person could manage his breakthroughs and become a successful person in his occupation. 

Despite this view, others might believe becoming highly skilled and earning more money just after leaving school bring more benefits. An electrician ,for instance, could possibly become noticeably skilful and even  make a living; above all, he can also become independent at an early age.

In my opinion, I would take the firm conviction that students should better spend some quality time alleviating their skills in their desired field rather than entering universities straight-forward, due to the fact that it will be still possible for them to sign up for a university after realizing the tips and tricks of their career.

In conclusion, although some might prefer the university entrance of candidates without any gaps, I do believe that by facing the work challenges in the real world, students will be able to stand on their own feet.

prompt: Children find it difficult to concentrate on or pay attention to their studies in school. What are the reasons? How can we solve this problem?
essay:
It is often argued that more and more children facing difficulties to pay attention to their studies in institutions. In this essay, I will explain why the case is so, and give some possible suggestions to eliminate this problem effectively in the following paragraphs.

To begin with, there are many reasons why students are facing difficulties to concentrate on their studies in classrooms. First and foremost, due to enough sleep and lack of nutrition are the one causes of this problem. To illustrate this, nowadays, students are busy solving their assignments, this is because they got more homework from school, and as a result, they have no sufficient time to sleep. In addition, children are more aware to eat fast-food beverages instead of healthy foods for that reason they fall  sick and do not focus on their studies in institutions. For example, fast food like burgers and rolls are more popular food and liked by billion of children but it affects negatively  their health. Also, due to electronic devices students are spending  more time  watching phones and tablets, which is  another reason for this problem.

On the other hand, there are some solutions to eliminate this problem. Firstly, students should take nap properly, which will be helpful for their studies. For example, it is scientifically proven that for better focus on work and study people should sleep at least 8 hours, which helps to relax their mind and grow effectively. Secondly, children should it more healthy foods like apples and oranges which contain more nutrition. Furthermore, teachers should give the minimum amount of homework to their students, which helps children to free and relax their minds and pay better attention during  class periods.

In conclusion, due to lack of sleep and nutrition along with using more electronic devices children are lacking to concentrate on their studies in the classroom. However, taking more healthy food and a proper nap helps them to focus on their studies in school.

prompt: Only government action can solve housing shortages in big cities. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Housing shortages in big cities are a common issue we are facing nowadays. Many folks believe that only the government  is able to solve this problem. However, from the way I am thinking, I do not agree with this idea.

On the one hand, it is undeniable that one of many government responsibilities is to ensure that the residents have houses to live in. I am convinced that all the councils in the world, regardless of the region where the cities are based. I remember a friend of mine once said that in his home country, the executive prepared and constructed buildings to accommodate the citizens. I was blown away when I heard this and imagined if the government in my homeland do the same thing. However, I realize that there are other, arguably more emerging, issues that are faced by the government, that need to be solved first. So waiting for the government to singlehandedly solve the housing issue is not a wise move we can do as a resident, especially if we are not from the richest country on this planet.

On top of the government, I strongly believe that other players also play the same key role in this issue, the private sector for instance. They can contribute to tackling the issue in their own ways. Whereas banks can help its customer  get a friendly loan to buy a house, property companies could provide an easy scheme to pay for the houses. Those are only two of many examples of how private sectors are able to help. What I want to say is that only government  can solve this issue. 

To sum up, I do not agree with people who think that only the executive can break down the problem as I strongly believe either government or non-government can help on their own, as aforementioned explanations.

Due to limited availability of funds foe higher education it is often recommended that financial assistance should be offered to scientific research instead of allocating funds to supplementary subjects.This notion should be accepted as many facts in favour of practical sibjects could be considered.Certainly the major argument in the favour of subsidising science and technology is rooted in the fact that advancement in science and technology not only reflects the prosperity of the  nations but also vouchsafes the other domains .To illustrate it can be said that investments in scientific research  including diagnostic and curative measure ensure the sound health of its people.Secondly it also paves a way towards the holistic development of a country by facilitating innovations and discoveries .

Another compelling reason might  be due to unreservedly salience of science in terms of boosting the economy and living standards of the country.

However one might argue that the importancd of supplementary subjects such as economics and statistics should not be neglected as it assists the nation in policy formation and analysing the currend situation.Thereforce an equal proportion of the financial assistant is required for these areas.

From the analysis of the above discussion one can observe that evidently, government should pour more money im scientific research owing to its pivotal role in comprehensive grow of a state.Nonetheless it is pertinent that others domains should be taken into account while distributing the funds .

prompt: Some people think the technology makes life complex, so we should make the life simpler without using the technology. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
In today's world life has become too compounded. According to some group of people or community thinks that due to technology our life has become too composite. So, we should do something that our life easier without using the technology. Let's discuss this. 

Firstly, Nowadays, technology has become important part of our lives, with the help of a new sort of technology our lives have become too easier and sometimes it makes our life so complex that it can also harm to us. In today’s world, many people of the 21st century are familiar with this kind new technology and it’s very easy for them to access it, but it all depends on then how they are using this new technology in which manner. Like, if they are using technology for their educational purposes or like they are using this technology for their entertainment purpose. Technology has a great influence on us and can help us in many ways and it can also harm us in many things. 

Secondly, there are some people who think that technology has changed our life to compounding. Yes, It has made our life complex and addicted to. For instance, technology has changed our whole mindsets and make us too lazy and also has given too many problems. By seeing this matter, we should make our life too simpler such as we should start avoiding some technology which they are harming us. 

Lastly, according to my opinion technology has made our life too complex, but at a same time it has also changed our life. Well, it depends on person to person in which way they are using these technologies.

prompt: Restoration of old buildings in main cities involves enormous government expenditure. It would be more beneficial to spend this money to build new houses and roads. To what extent do you agree or disagree? Give reasons for your answer and include examples from your own experience.
essay:
In this day and age, people often believe that the government should allocate more funds to the construction of new houses as well as road systems rather than the restoration of old buildings since this activity can waste a large amount of money. In my opinion, old buildings often have a lot of historical and artistic significance, although restoration of these constructions can have high costs and main cities have great issues related to living and housing, I tend to disagree with this statement.

On the one hand, there are buildings that are worth restoring because of their historical or symbolic significance. Their preservation is part of the culture and can serve a great deal for education, getting to know a people's origin, legends, and capabilities. When buildings get to be restored, this legacy is protected. For example, Hanoi Old Quarter is one of the historical sites of Hanoi and is a place where there are a lot of tourists every year, so it needs funds from the government to develop and protect.

On the other hand, in big cities, tax money should be allocated to provide adequate housing and construct more roads to accommodate the increasing population. More and more people from suburban regions migrate to urban areas in search of work. This has caused the population density in certain cities to rise remarkably, bringing in its wake negative outcomes such as traffic congestion and crowded living quarters. Using tax money to build more houses, therefore, provides people with affordable shelters that low-income people could purchase. 

In conclusion, I agree that constructing more houses and roads is important and should generally be prioritized over maintaining old buildings with the exception of historically significant constructions. I believe this should be the approach for most cities.
evaluation:

- The candidate has adequately addressed the task by presenting a clear stance on the topic.
- The essay is well-organized, with ideas presented in a coherent manner.
- The candidate has supported their arguments with relevant examples.

prompt: Some people think the technology makes life complex, so we should make the life simpler without using the technology. To what extent do you agree or disagree
essay:
Certain individuals are of the notion that technology makes things even more laborious ergo,things would be less tasking in its absence. In my opinion, I vehemently disagree with this school of thought because technology since its introduction, has been ameliorating all aspects of life, medicine in particular. 

      To begin with, innovation has improved the health sector greatly. The use of high-tech equipment in medicine has helped improve the accuracy of diagnosis and treatment of diseases while at the same time reducing the stress medical practitioners undergo. Evidence of this can be seen in article released by the Chancellor of School of Medicine, Ukraine who stated that medicine had moved a milestone since the introduction of technology to improve diagnosis by detecting diseases as little as inconspicuous tumors to severe diseases such as kidney stones and has also helped treatment of cancer with the use of  radiology. Additionally, the use of technology in medical work has led to advancement in research works. Scientists have been able to synthesize new and effective cure or vaccines to combat infections. 

      Furthermore, technology has helped in the improvement of education worldwide. Teachers from a distance have been able to successfully impact knowledge to their pupils with the use of devices such as iPads and projectors and these devices were used to teach even in the absence of the teacher. For instance, the online learning approach has been adopted my almost all schools nationwide as a result of the Covid-19 outbreak and this has helped so many schools complete their syllabi and even hold graduation virtually. Furthermore, technology has helped bolster relationships across continents. A lot of people these days are engaging in long distance relationships and this would have been almost impossible without the use of technology. Phones, tablets with strong internet connection has helped these relationships stand the test of time.  

      In conclusion, while other opinions may vary, I strongly disagree the opinion that life would be easier without technology because of its impact in ameliorating every sector of our lives is evidently seen.
evaluation:

- The candidate has addressed the task by presenting their stance and providing supporting arguments.
- The response is clear and coherent, presenting ideas in a logical order.
- The candidate has covered all parts of the task by acknowledging the opposing view and providing evidence for their argument.

prompt:
In some countries, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in. 
What are the reasons for this?
How can people research this?
essay:
History is a subject which sometimes fascinate people with its magnetism. Many are attracted to the background of their living houses, especially those who are residents of antique buildings or very architecturally unique. There are several explanations that arise the curiosity of them which can be researched through several resources.  

The first important factor which force people to discover more about their house is the age of the structure. To elaborate, old buildings particularly those which left from world wars  witnessed 

the citizens ’ups and downs. for example, those buildings may have survived from bombing or had been seen mass murders. Another reason that can stimulate interest to uncover secrets about his place of living is due to its distinctive architecture. When one captivates by exceptional features of a structure, he would inevitably search for the roots of beauty and charisma laid behind it. 

There are some sources people can initially begin to seek the history of their homes. In the first step, google engine is the best option available to almost everyone. All information can appear on his phone in a less than a minute. Sometimes these sources are reliable and he can obtain what he was looking for. Secondly, realtors and neighbours are another trusted sources. However, they occasionally exaggerate and expand their stories to make them more appealing. Overall, these two origins mentioned above are the most accessible ones. 

To summarize, every building has its own history which can absorb some people’s s attention to hunt for deeper knowledge in regards to it. The two reasons age and uniqueness are considered as reasons for curiosity. Besides, two main factors namely the google web engine and neighbours can be seen as research sources.

prompt: Some people think news has no connection to people’s lives. So then it is a waste of time to read the newspaper and watch television news programs. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
In this present world, news are more and more popular on social media or newspaper. Some people believe that such information are not connected to their lives, therefore they don’t want spend to much time for it. It is disagreed that news is not essential for our live. Analysing the importance of news from governance, as well as the updating of weather forecast  will prove this.

First, people could found important information that governace would like to inform to them through breaking news on current affairs programmes or on newspaper. For instance, Vietnamese people want to look for the location that grant for them the identity cards, they will have to search for concerned news or video that Governance published on many social media. This wil support them following to the right direction and finish their documents. So, this makes it clear that people cound not live without news.

Secondly, weather forecast is one kind of news that cannot be lacked in our daily routines. For example, if people are going to host an event outside, they often update weather conditon on planing dates in order to deal with unexpectable weather could be happen. This is one of necessarry step in preparation process to ensure the event would be sucessful. Thus, it become apprarent that news is useful with us.

To summarise, there are many kind of news which are neccessary concered to our daily lives. Thus, it is clear that the idea that people waste time when reading news on multimedia cannot be supported. After analysis on this subject, it is predicted that news are more and more booming in the our world and become an essetial part of our lives.

prompt: Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well. To what extent do you agree or disagree
essay:
Several reports in  top-rated newspapers around the globe have confirmed and encouraged young generations to have the opportunity to learn from their community on the weekends or after school hours. According to some people’s opinion, youth should spend their free time on non-remunerated jobs to increase their social and future job skills.  In this essay, I will summarize it would benefit the community.

Firstly, many people can say that if teenagers  do  community work, they will avoid any negative actions against their own community. Working for the community increases the value of helping others as well as the sense of belonging and makes them stop reacting negatively forward with what they have built. For instance, in New York, there is extra work  implemented after school where aggressive kids grow their own plants in the community garden to keep them calm, show them how to give to the community and value their work and effort. 

Secondly, non-paid community work should allow the youth to learn some social abilities to relate deeply to society that they have never been taught in school. People gain a wider range of experiences once they start their adult life. This may lead to new ideas for cohesion in  society or a greater feeling of individual fulfilment after the work done in the community. As a result, collectivity is created as a benefit of all these activities. For example, a few studies centres in Europe have as an extracurricular subject at school where people get together in a range of nonprofit activities focused on helping many people in need.

To sum up, young adults would benefit from social activities that make them avoid negative behaviour toward their own neighbourhood. Also, learning useful skills to improve the relationship with others and gathering to support each other.  From my point of view, I completely agree with the idea of young generations spending free time helping other people in exchange for life lessons and foment higher connection with a society which reduces any kind of attacks on the community and the number of problems in  society.
evaluation:

- The candidate has adequately addressed the task by presenting both sides of the argument and providing examples to support their stance.

prompt: Many students find it difficult to focus or pay attention at school nowadays. What are the reasons for this? What can be done to solve this problem?
essay:
Nowadays numerous problems are increasing in children which adversely affects to pay their full attention in schools. According to several surveys conducted by educational departments clearly showing the reasons which hampering students focus. The following paragraphs evaluating such issues related to students and finding ways how to solve them for the benefit of their future life. 

The number of students who are joining schools is escalating during this period. In addition to this, the tutors lose control over the students, affecting children to get attention. Although there are online materials and video lectures, some toddlers are facing troubles in academic learning. Moreover, indulging in lousy peer relationships leads to a lack of concentration in studies. For instance, some students bring mobiles to classrooms and engaged in social media take away the attention of other children. As a result, students lose their concentration in studies because of bad friendships and usage of mobiles in the classroom. 

To solve these practical issues, parents have to visit the school and ensure that their child gets a good atmosphere for learning. Teachers getting ready for an open conversation with their students will be a better suggestion to understand their pressure on learning things. Furthermore, parents and teachers must be aware of students' behaviour and their peer relationships inside school and house. It will improve children's attitudes, and it improves their mental balance in learning. 

In conclusion, students issues related to their academic knowledge are rising. Parents and teachers together pay attention and creating a friendly atmosphere with them which helps to solve the issues

prompt: More and more people are seriously overweight. Some people suggest the solution to this problem is to increase the price of fattening foods. To what extent do you agree or disagree?i
essay:
Many people are consuming junk food which leads then them to gain extra weight. It is often argued that increasing the price of oily food might tackle this situation. I completely agree with this and therefore, in this essay, i will discuss and provide a worthy conclusion.

The trend of consuming unhealthy food is increasing day by day. To mitigate this issue, raising the prices of junk food will make it less pocket friendly for people to consume it on daily basis. As most of the people are earning that much that they have to make a budget for everything thus  if prices are increased they will start eating in fewer quantities. To support this reason, if companies increase the prices of their packaged and junk food thrice the cost as they used to be people will buy less quantity. This is to say that  more the price lower will be the consumption capacity.

Another point, in this case,this case is that, when the cost of unhealthy food goes up, companies will reduce the production capacity. As the prices go up , consumers will cut down their buying capacity, companies will suffer losses and hence they will have to stop releasing processed food. This will encourage them to make healthy snacks. By doing this it will also encourage their customers to buy healthy food and decrease the chances of getting obese.

In conclusion, increasing prices of fattening foods will decrease the feasibility of having to access them. I entirely agree that making unhealthy snacks unaffordable will encourage companies to launch healthy and affordable snacks.

prompt: Some people think that one of the best ways to solve environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles.
essay:
Nowadays, environmental pollution is increasing day by day, and this is of great concern in these communities. Thence, some people contemplate that increasing the price of fuels such as coal, gas, gasoline for cars and other vehicles is one of the best solution. In my opinion, it may be  the right way, however, this is not the only solution to tackle this problem. 

To begin with, increasing the pay of crude oil can help to some degree, but there is more disadvantage. In the other words, if the union raises the fee of fossil fuel unreasonably, the cost increase will cause more problems. For example, when the price of fuel is increased unreasonably, other sectors that run gasoline face more  and more problems, and the prices rise sharply. As a result, poor and middle class families encounter many difficulties, and protest among the people will intensify against the state. Moreover, the increase in the cost of gasoline will not stop air pollution.

On the other hand, the power should be developed in renewable energy source such as, wind, solar and tide rather than non renewable resource like coal and petrol. For example, today, many countries are using renewable resources. The government encourages people to use public transportation by improving public transportation and reducing the cost of travelling. As a result, emissions of harmful gases are reduced into the atmosphere, and  non renewable energy resources are saved.

To conclude, I strongly believe that the use in the renewable energy sources is  one of the best solution to this problem. So, every country should use a renewable resource.

prompt:
Some people think that all teenagers should be required to do unpaid work in their free time to help the local community. They believe this would benefit both the individual teenager and society as a whole.
Do you agree or disagree?
essay:
It is often argued that forcing young children to do voluntary work during their leisure time would not only have a positive impact on themselves but also on their societies. In my opinion, I completely disagree with this statement because it distorts and demolishes the inner essence of volunteer.  

Some would claim that asking teenagers to volunteer in projects during their free time would provide this category a well-round perspective about the importance of helping others without expecting any monetary return from this work. This is because they tend to waste their time in doing useless activities, such as playing video games and chatting with their friends online, which diverts their attention from focusing on allocating time for giving back to their community. For that reason, it would open their mind to the virtues of contributing to their societies.

Although this way might teach teenagers about the advantages of doing unpaid work to themselves as well as their communities, it would not help them to effectively embrace the concept of volunteering. This is because if they are forced to volunteer, it would become more challenging for them to understand the moral value of offering aid to others, and therefore they are more likely to find excuses to avoid giving back to their communities and start thinking of what benefit themselves only. A typical example of this is that when a school ask young students to participate in charities campaigns such as cleaning parks, and taking care of elderly after school, a high proportion of them never shows up or expresses their dissatisfaction as they believe that they are still having the freedom to choose how to spend their time. 

As a result, teenagers could form wrong opinions and ideas about volunteering. 

To sum up, requiring youngers to perform voluntary work whenever they have time would help them to understand how this work could contribute to their personality and societies. However, I would disagree with this point of view because it might push them to discard the valuable lesson they could get from this job.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement:**
The candidate addresses the prompt by expressing a clear stance of disagreement. The essay covers all parts of the task, presenting arguments against the mandatory requirement of unpaid work for teenagers. prompt: Some people say that increasing business and cultural contacts between countries is a positive development, while others think that many countries will lose their national identities as a result. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
The world is witnessing an increase in interdependence amongst countries in terms of business and cultural contacts. Some people assume that this trend is a positive development while others think it will create risks to survival of national identities. In this essay, I will discuss both views and indicate my opinion.
It is undeniable that widening international exchange brings a range of opportunities for countries to grow their economies. In other words, organizations may take advantage of this trend to gain more revenues from expanding their markets and approaching a large number of potential customers all over the world.  For example, without globalization, Apple Inc only sells their products in the domestic market, this may prevent them from gaining incredible growth and a good reputation as one of the most well-known technology companies nowadays. In the matter of cultural contacts, promoting cultural exchanges betweens nations also contributes to increasing global coverage of a country’s culture to world friends. The more convenient developing mutual relationship between countries means international tourism, exhibitions and fairs, TV programmes and films, etc. where people may enjoy the achievements of other cultures across the globe become more ubiquitous. As a result, they not only enrich inhabitants’ lives but also lay a foundation to preserve and develop cultural  quintessences including cuisine, costume and festivals. 
In contrast to the benefits mentioned above, this trend also brings many threats to a national identity. To be more specific, the fact that the world gradually becomes a giant village makes its inhabitants tend to use a common language like English as an inevitable trend. As a result, there are a variety of minor languages on the verge of extinction and the world is getting less linguistically diverse because of the lack of emphasis on mother tongue. Another noticeable phenomenon is that traditional values in a country fall into a state of neglect as introductions of foreign cultures. Considering the situation of the young generation in Vietnam as an example, they are in favor of  songs, films produced by Korean compared to traditional folk songs and domestic films. 
From my point of view, two arguments truly reflect the possible consequence of an increasing economic and cultural interaction among nations. It boosts economic integration and enhances modernization but also creates tensions between global culture and a country’s national identity. However, participating in the process of globalization depends on the willingness of each nation, they have the right not to participate if they feel that national benefits are threatened.
evaluation:

- The candidate has adequately addressed the prompt by discussing both views on the impact of increasing business and cultural contacts between countries on national identities.

prompt:
Some people think that competitive sports have a positive effect on the education of teenagers while others argue that the effect is negative.
Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.
essay:
Sports play an essential role in the child’s positive mindset. Some people believe that competition in sports is beneficial for teenagers,however others are of the view that it imparts negativity among young kids. It is essential to examine both sides of the argument diligently. 

On the one hand, competitive sports inculcate lots of positive effects on a child’s mind. To begin with, a child learns the value of teamwork when they play as a team. The teamwork is invariably the most important characteristic, that comes in handy at the time when a person starts working. Secondly, a healthy competition enables an adolescent to go the extra mile just to win the game. The importance of losing and winning is clearly understood. This results in pushing their boundaries and doing the same in education as well.

On the other hand, there are some unavoidable byproducts of  sports events. The most critical effect of these competitions is the loss of motivation. A teenager becomes low on confidence and is always in need of motivation. Therefore, this impact greatly in further health issues. For instance, panic attacks or nervous breakdown. Moreover, sometimes feud or a sense of hatred inevitably arise when competing with someone. That is another crucial reason for consideration.

In conclusion, playing sports with the goal of winning against someone has both positive and negative impacts on adolescents. Although, a child being underconfident and generating hatred are enormous consequences, yet I believe it is necessary for a child to possess competitiveness to succeed in life.
evaluation:

prompt:
Consumers are faced with increasing numbers of advertisements from competing companies.
To what extent do you think consumers are influenced by advertisements? 


What measures can be taken to protect them?
essay:
In today’s world, the fierce rivalry among business entities has given rise to a proliferating number of advertisements broadcast on almost every means of media. While this phenomenon is not without positive influence, its adverse implications are more significant. Therefore, there will be some solutions proposed in this essay to  diminish its negative effects on consumers.

 

Needless to say, a rise in the number of advertisements has allowed viewers to be more well-informed of the newly-launched products. Given the unprecedented rate of technological advancement in recent years, without these means of marketing, consumers may fall behind the most innovative features introduced to the market, which may impede them from making  sensible purchasing decisions. However, such surge in adverts may bring about some underlying effects on purchasing behavior. Since consumers are constantly bombarded with advertising in various manifestations, they are more prompted to make a purchase without thorough consideration. It stands to the reason  that promotional campaigns are designed to prey on humans’ insecurities such as their inferiorities in physical appearance or their desire for social inclusion; as a result,  viewers are more liable to fall victim to buying unnecessary items out of spontaneity. Moreover, the competitiveness among companies has led advertisers to resort to dishonest tactics with the sole aim to boost sales. The most widely adopted strategy seems to exaggerate the true values of the advertised products, which induces the consumers to take preference of them and may lead to future purchases.

 

There are some possible solutions to tackle the problems engendered from such a trend. The most prominent responsibility should lie with the government since they are those who grant permission for adverts to be broadcast on mass media. Therefore, there should be a board  of experts whose job is to screen, monitor and cross-reference the advertisement contents and their actual effectiveness. The public should also take actions to protect themselves. It is recommended that before buying an item, one should do some research by either consulting the previous buyers  or taking their needs and affordability into serious consideration. With all of these measures joining forces, consumers are more liable to be well-protected from the invasion of misleading advertising.

 

In short, advertisements, with its  genuine nature , should provide useful information about new products in the market. However, given the tough competition between companies, this marketing tool may  provoke spontaneous purchasing decisions. Therefore, both the government and its citizens should take proactive measures in order to foster a healthy society.

prompt:
In many countries today, parents are able to choose to send their childen to single-sex schools or co-educational schools. Some people think that children going to single-sex schools have disadvantages later in life. 

To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
In contemporary society, every parent has plenty of school options available for providing a bedrock for learning. Some parents incline towards unisex learning institutes. However, a fraction of people believes that  gender-specific colleges can have demerits for  youngsters later in life. I agree with this statement to some extent due to a variety of concerns. This essay will expound on both sides of the argument and will provide a conclusion after discussing the demerits and merits of both types of  schooling.

On the one hand, few parents give priority to single-sex schools due to a number of concerns with the co-education system. One major concern related to mixed education is the safety of female students. For instance, According to a few research surveys, it is proved that the safety of female students is a major concern for their parents due to cases of sexual harassment from male figures. Another big reason for  selecting a gender-specific school is a more comfortable atmosphere in the gender-specific institute. As mostly females feel more comfortable and secure in a girls' campus where they can openly discuss their personal issues such as menstruation cycle and other illnesses, which can not be discussed openly in a co-learning system.

On the other hand, few people insist on giving priority to the co-education system due to various factors. Firstly, one of the big factors is a lack of confidence in most of the students who belong to gender-specific institutions. These students don't have enough confidence to express their views with other genders. Most of them can not hold a conversation and can not get attention in front of a large audience. Moreover, students who learn in a co-education system have more confidence and interpersonal skills which make them more successful in later stages of life.

In conclusion,  I vehemently oppose the idea of single-sex educational institutions. In my opinion, the co-education system provides more learning opportunities for youngsters. Consequently, the co-education system should be supported by parental figures to provide a better future for the young generation.
evaluation:

- The candidate has addressed the task by evaluating the advantages and disadvantages of single-sex schools.

prompt: Some employers believe that job applicants’ social skills are more important than their academic qualifications. Do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
essay:
There has been much discussion revolving around the issue of whether job applicants’ social skills are more important than their academic qualifications. In this essay, I will explain why social skills are more vital, compared with academic qualifications.

The merits of outstanding social skills are apparent. Firstly, communication is the key to career success in this day and age. This is mainly due to the fact that the 21st century is best characterised by constant interaction with different people, no matter the communication happens in person or online. Secondly, the ability to sell products or services is of paramount significance in any business – this requires strong social skills. For example, an employee with excellent social skills is able to have an impact in front of customers or clients; as a result, products or services can be perceived as high-value. Furthermore, employees with better social skills are generally more easy-going, which is very important to the workplace, including the employer. After all, as the saying goes, “Who you work with is as important as what you do.” – An enjoyable work environment needs socially skilful employees.

In contrast, some others may claim that academic qualifications are the pre-requisite of employment. Apparently, many positions require certain qualifications. However, in modern-day society, more and more employers have realised that whether employees can get the results that the business wants is the key to a business’ success. It can be seen that qualifications do not play a key role in this regard.

Having considered both views, I think employees’ social skills are of overriding importance for an organisation. Also, I would suggest employers consider job applicants’ social skills first, which I believe is soundly based on the above reasoning I have presented.
evaluation:
### Task Achievement:
- The candidate has addressed the given task effectively by presenting a clear stance on the importance of social skills over academic qualifications.
- The essay presents ideas in a logical and coherent manner, supporting each point with specific examples.
- All parts of the task have been addressed, and arguments are adequately supported.

- Transitions between paragraphs are logical and help maintain the coherence of the essay.
- Suggested Band Score (Coherence and Cohesion): 8.0

### Lexical Resource (Vocabulary):
- The candidate demonstrates a good range of vocabulary, using appropriate and varied words to convey ideas.
- However, there are a few instances where word choice could be improved:
  - **Use "essential" instead of "paramount significance"**: "The ability to sell products or services is essential in any business."

- Suggested Band Score (Lexical Resource): 7.5

### Grammatical Range and Accuracy:
- The candidate demonstrates a good level of grammatical accuracy and variety in sentence structure.
- However, there are a few minor grammatical errors:

  - **Replace "getting the results that the business wants" with "achieving the desired outcomes"**: This alternative phrase is more precise and formal.

prompt:
some countries more and more people are becoming interested in finding out bout the history of the house or building they live in. 

What are the reasons for this? How can people research
essay: More and more people from all around the world are willing to find out about the history behind the house or building they live in. There are many reasons given to explain this strange wish. Firstly, learning about the history of their house teaches people to appreciate the place they live in. When people truly understand the true meanings or intentions of a place, they will learn to love that place not just for the beautiful scenery or modern faculties, but for the actual sentimental value that it holds. That is what brings people peace and joy. Secondly, people may find items or things that could be financially beneficial. When you dig deep into a house's history, there is a percentage that your house is associated with a historical event and there could be hidden items remaining from that time that could bring you a fortune. For example, there was a YouTube video of people who were researching their house's history and they found out that there was a piece of actual Jerusalem in the middle of the house. They later tried to sell the house and plenty of agencies offered them millions of US dollars. Lastly, being able to learn about your own house's story could be something to be proud of. Researching the history of an unknown place is not easy so people should be proud of themselves if they were able to. The story of the family who owns the house with Jerusalem in it impressed people from all around the world and inspired them to find out about their own house's history as well. The easiest way for people to know the background of their house is to ask the previous owners of that place because they might know a thing or two about it. Alternatively, people can research by themselves on the internet to try to understand the historical meanings behind their homes.

prompt: 1.Some school leavers travel or work for a period of time instead of going directly to university. What are the advantages and disadvantages for their studies?
essay:
It has been observed that teenagers tend to discontinue their studies after completing them, instead of getting accepted into college. This scenario has several advantages and disadvantages, all of which will be discussed in detail.

Discussing the benefits of the above, the main advantage is that young people can learn about different cultures. What I mean by that is that when students travel the world during breaks, they learn about different traditions, languages and social skills. So, their lifestyle changes, and they become multilingual. In addition, students gain practical experience while working part-time. In other words, students learn how to manage their finances effectively, expand their understanding of business concepts, and explore opportunities for continued education. For example, a survey conducted by the University of Pennsylvania's admissions department showed that possessing all of these abilities enables students to outperform others academically.

Despite the benefits of this situation, it also has some implications. The most important reason is that students lose motivation. To account for this, the information in their head disappears within a year of graduating from high school. As a result, learners will struggle to acquire knowledge from new courses while pursuing their degree education. Moreover, gaps necessitate meticulous preparation. In detail, during this time, if they cannot find projects or jobs, he/she may experience serious problems such as anxiety. This could lead him/her to engage in illegal activities like theft and drug use.

In summary, it can be said that every situation has both advantages and disadvantages. It is a fair idea to take a break and find your major before choosing a university course; however, without executing a perfect plan, learners lose focus on their studies and work.
evaluation:

prompt: Research indicates that nowadays some consumers are much less influenced by advertising than in the past. What do you think are the reasons for this? Do you think this is a positive or negative development?
essay:
Currently, there are some studies finding that advertisement is less likely to impact some people than before. Several factors may relate to this phenomenon which I believe is a positive development.  

   

The advent of this trend is complex, possibly involving many factors. Firstly, advances in network technology allow people to get access to the products information easier, making the advertisement less attraction than before. For example, details of many products can be accessed by consumers through their official websites rather than watching their advertisement. Another reason is that more and more offline stores have been established and they are important channels for people to learn the goods. The advantages are obvious, because these physic stores fulfill people's curious while avoiding them to spend a lot to buy the expensive goods. Besides, people can get information from some product launches as many large companies like Apple and Google, will introduce their new products before they are provided to the market.  

   

I think this is a positive trend which means that people are more reasonable to choose their interested goods. Only a few product details that the producers want customers to see can be transmitted by advertisement, which may mislead some people to buy. The availability of various approaches for people to acquire product data facilitate them selecting the truly helpful items that they really need, without spending some unnecessary fees.   

   

Overall, many reasons may lead to less influences of advertisement on some consumers, and in my view, there are more positive effects than the negative.

prompt:
Nowadays celebrities are more famous for their glamour and wealth than for their acheivements, and this sets a bad example to young people.

To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
It is true that there is a tendency to be well-known because of the luxurious life conditions, whereas people maintaining achievements and reaching their goals remain unknown. Personally, I completely agree that this sets a bad example to the younger generation because I believe that only those who succeed in life and work to boost specific fields of society can actually inspire them. 

First and foremost, famous people are pursued by youngsters and teenagers. This means that younger generations are being grown up by celebrities, namely bloggers in social media. Following successful people, who get fame thanks to their abilities and skills such as Elon Musk, is more beneficial for teenagers to get motivation together with incentives to strive to study and have a purpose to attain achievements rather than giving preference to effortless and mesmerizing lifestyles of wealthy ones. Secondly, there is a danger to the personality traits of youngsters because of pursuing bloggers who provide unhealthy diets and curse words in their speeches. Thus, it is advantageous to follow scientists or influencers who are making breakthroughs in technology or science. 

Let us take a look at the mental conditions of followers. Nowadays, it is a crucial issue to have a low interest in life and be under a lot of strain because of seeing others' lifestyles and desire to have it. For instance, pursuing others’ life may lead to dissatisfaction and criticism of their life because of not having the ability to afford an astonishing lifestyle. In conclusion, following wealthy and rich celebrities provide more drawbacks than positive outcomes. 

To conclude, I strongly believe that for everyone it would be beneficial to pursue celebrities who reached goals and success in their life because it may be a source of motivation to attain their own achievements.

prompt: Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
It is a common belief among certain individuals that teenagers should be mandated to contribute to their community with free service. This essay completely agrees with this statement and explains how both young adults and residents are benefited from such an arrangement.

Firstly, selfless community service allows young students to be prepared and excel in their adult years because it builds their personality to be altruistic. This is because sacrificing your own time and making significant efforts for others are two of the most important qualities demanded by a leadership position. For example, one study conducted by Forbes magazine concluded that about 80 percent of CEOs have served at least 160 hours for the betterment of society. Thus, helping the needy in early childhood benefits young people by enhancing their leadership traits.

Secondly, locals are benefitted due to the amazing contributions of a vibrant and dynamic workforce and free help. Since teens are physically more active, they can better take care of physically demanding tasks such as lifting weights, enduring long hours of work, and helping the elderly to walk around. Moreover, some local institutions, which can not afford to hire more people, can take advantage of these energetic individuals because of the unpaid job that they are doing. For instance, my local elderly care home has 90% of teenagers, who are studying in nearby schools, as employees. 

In conclusion, some people think that extracurricular volunteering activities should be compulsory for teenagers. In my opinion, it should be mandatory as it not only benefits teenagers' persona but also provides society with an incomparable and very economical workforce.

prompt: Nowadays families move to different countries for work. Some people think it has a negative effect on children, while others disagree. Discuss both views and give your own opinion
essay:
There is no arcane that the world has been revolutionized with a trend like self reliance. These days, the autonomy is at its zenith. In the modern world, this practice has increased with alacrity. 
There is no dilemma, these days more novice people prefer to be independent after high school. This practice is common in developed countries rather than third world countries.
No doubt, there are a plethora of benefits of being independent. Such as, “The fortune favours the brave” the autonomous person have an edge over others because they are ready to take effective risks. If we focus on successful nations, we will notice that its young people are comparatively hardworking. Also, CBN news survey, provided that independent people are lauded to broaden their horizons and lead an appeasing life. As they become more responsible by efficiently taking care of their household and daily life tasks. Instead of pestering their parents, they earn and chase their dreams in a lithe manner. To meet their needs, they become goal-oriented and do part time jobs. Which also gives a rapid-dramatic boom in the country’s economy. As wise people constitute wise nations. It also proves to be an ample tool in controlling the crime rate of the country. As a result, the childish and wanton activities are decried effectively. 
On the contrary, such people lack family time. As they become cynical and self centred. There is a family gap between parents and children. The direct consequence of belonging to such group is psychic issues e-g such people are in the jaws of loneliness and stress problems. Another grave and critical issue of standing on its own is management issues. For instance, “no man is an island” every person need someone to some extent. And such people pay the piper in practical life because they don’t have any guidelines and someone to learn the experiences of. Such as the footsteps of their father and a father is mostly the first role model in one’s life. Moreover, the darker side of this practice is that young people often get spoiled. For example, some grow dangerous and harmful habits like drugs, gambling and other social evils. 
To recapitulate, in my candid opinion the independence should only be to some extent. It is evident that “an apple never fall far from tree”, the parents play a vital role in character building as they cajole their children on the right path.

prompt: Some people believe  that eventually all jobs will be done by artificially intelligence Roberts.What is your opinion?
essay:
Artificially intelligent robots will take over the human workforce in the future. Although, all the easy skill jobs will be done by robots, but still some skillfull work will require human contacts. This essay will discuss why some jobs will still be undertaken manually. 

Robots may be replaced to carry forward the jobs that are not too complex and can easily perform without much involvement by humans.As it will be beneficial for multinational companies and industries to gain profits through artificial intellect instead of spending highly on hiring, training and employing the human. For instance, in may metropolitan cities the traffic personnel are replaced by an automatic traffic control system which is far more cost effective. In addition, this system works around the clock and require no holiday.

For these reasons computers and robots will be involved in human lives more frequently in the upcoming future.

Conversely, there are some skillfull jobs that are interdependent on human relations and emotions, and that this job cannot be handled by automated robots. Likewise, the jobs where the human mind, soul and his own natural brilliance is more crucial rather than only the profit conquered by the artificial brilliance. These jobs include psychology, education, medicines and some social jobs needed for the betterment of the society. All in all, robots cannot perceive human nature that has performed this social evolution since hundred and thousands of years ago. 

To sum up, a significant number of jobs will be control of the artificial intellect in the future. Despite the fact that advanced technologies will take over the market; however I still believe that some sophisticated jobs will require human agility. Ultimately, skillfull jobs that require people excellence cannot be effectively carried out by artificial intelligence.

prompt:
In some countries, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in. 

What are the reasons for this?

How can people research this?
essay:
There is an increaing tendency amongst the pubic in some nations who want to know more about the history of the house or building they live in. This trend could be out of curiosity or related to some economic issues. This essay will explore the reasons for  this trend especially in Korea and the United Kingdom and how to investigate the helpful information. 

To begin in Korea, people usually look into info about a house or building when they have an opportunity to buy it. In terms of individual assets, real estate is the most important and the biggest one, therefore people should be well aware of the information about the property when they try to make contracts. In Korea, brand-new apartments are more expensive. In other words, that’s the reason that the society has tons of interests in redevelopment. Where a cluster of old houses exists, there are always lots of attempts to develop the area and make some money there. When it comes to the investment, it is crucial for investors to be acquainted with the practical data like the initial construction date, the original purpose of the house and so on. Since this can be the key in order to succeed in the business regarding reconstruction and the investment also.

In the United Kingdom, on the other hand, it is quite the opposite. The older the building is, the more valuable. This makes sense since houses are not only capable of making a warm and cosy environment but also bear invaluable events from the past in their concrete walls and structures. In other words, residences with some special  stories make them more attractive and naturally the prices of those would be higher than others. Some are just curious about the stories laid under the old villas that have gotten through tons of historical events, yet others wants to know about it since they can presume the value of the dwellings from that messages. 

Turning to the research, there are various ways to collect the relevant information. The simplest way is to ask to the previous owners or real estate agencies. In addition, visiting local libraries are another good option. In regard to practical data, we can gather useful reports from the website of the city council. 

To sum up, this trend in Korea and the UK is due to curiosity as well as economic reasons. Whatever the reasons are, necessary info can be found by simply asking to the ex-owners or agencies, searching for the website of the city council and local libraries nearby.

prompt: Some People Think That The Teenagers Should Be Required To Do Unpaid Work In Their Free Time To Help The Local Community. They Believe This Would Benefit Both The Teenagers And Society As A Whole.
essay:
Youngsters are the building blocks of the nation and they play an important role in serving  society because at this age they are full of energy not only mentally but physically also. some people think that youth should do some voluntary work for the society in their free time and it would be beneficial for both of them. I agree with the statement. it has numerous benefits which will be discussed in the upcoming paragraphs.

To begin with, they could do a lot of activities and make their spare time fruitful. first of all, they can teach children living in slum areas because they are unable to afford education in schools or colleges. as a result, they will become civilized individuals and do not indulge in antisocial activities. by doing this they could gain a lot of experience and becomes responsible towards the society. it would be beneficial in their future perspective.

In addition to this, they learn a sense of cooperation and sharing with other persons of the society. for instance, they could grow plants and trees at public places and this would be helpful not only to make the surrounding clean and green but reduce the pollution also to great extent. moreover, they could arrange awareness programmes in society and set an example among the natives of the state. this will make the social bonding strong between the individuals and this will also enhance their social skills.

In conclusion, they can “kill two birds with one stone” because it has a great advantage both for the society and for the adolescents. both the parents, as well as teachers, should encourage the teens to take part in the activities of serving the community in their free time.
