There are two primary reason why people wasted. Firslty is the lack of accessible food rescue and recycling services. Similarly, not all restaurants, grocery stores, and other food services and retailers have access to composting systems or food donation services. Secondly, consumers expect their fruits and veggies in the perfect shape, size, and color and refusing to buy ugly food, they think that the quality of these food is not good.

There are several actions that goverment could take to solve those problem. We must strengthen food rescue systems. That means making donation services more accessible, having food and retail businesses partner with donation centers. The second solution would be setting up systems to donate unwanted fruits and veggies to organizations that help feed the hungry and food insecure because a piece of produce looks funky doesn’t mean it’s bad.

prompt: Some people think that one of the best ways to solve environmental problems and traffic jams is to increase the cost of fuels for cars and other vehicles. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement.
essay:
Never have the topics concerning the public’s daily lives failed to attract people’s attention. And when it comes to raising the expenditure on petrol to surmount environmental issues and traffic congestion, I agree that it is an effective way to deal with the current conditions, but not the best solution. 

It is undeniable that this step can mitigate environmental contamination and severe traffic jams. To begin with, increasing the petrol price can help to reduce environmental contamination. It is conducive to diminishing the excessive emission of carbon dioxide, which is the culprit of the greenhouse effect. All of the current conditions can be largely attributed to the large proliferation of private cars. On condition that we increase gasoline fees, the exhaust gas and haze would be largely reduced. Therefore, such a measure will possibly alleviate air pollution. Additionally, an increased price of petrol can decrease the number of cars on the roads. People will choose public transportation rather than driving cars when the petrol price is unaffordable. In that case, the number of vehicles on the street will decline and the traffic congestion is inclined to be mitigated.

However, many other methods can be done to solve those issues, which are as effective as increasing the cost of petrol. For instance, cutting-edge technologies can cure environmental problems fundamentally. A number of advanced technologies have been applied to integrate traditional energies with alternative energies to design hybrid cars, which are expected to achieve zero emissions and zero pollution, thus reducing air pollution. Apart from that, the government has the ability and responsibility to allocate more money to improve the infrastructure construction, such as the subways, trains, etc. Provided that the public service can be developed, the masses can be evacuated from the overcrowdedness of the streets.

In conclusion, even though the rise in fuel price can contribute to solving those thorny problems, I am against the opinion that it is the best solution, but contend that other methods can exert some positive effects to the same extent.

prompt:
Some believe that people should make efforts to fight climate change while others think it is better to learn to live with it.


Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
It goes without saying that mother earth has nurtured miscellaneous life forms since the alleged big bang and is expected to continue doing so. There are two contradicting views about the recent concern of environmental alteration on the planet, the first of which claims that humans need to go as far as they can to preserve the earth while the other refers to these efforts as unnecessary. From my perspective, although the former notion can be supported with a decent argument, the other one holds more ground.

As for the advocation of the first belief, it is, by and large, believed that life, as in its current form, tremendously depends on the climate and environment. In other words, if the condition degrades, residents of the plant are quite likely to encounter detrimental repercussions. As all life forms are in crucial need of natural resources to survive, this could be deemed substantially vital. To illustrate, the water level changes, which are due to the melting of glaciers, impact the ecosystem marine creatures live in and to some extent the humans who feed on or consume them in other ways. Similarly, the loss of natural habitats for some species could have negative effects on them and consequently mankind. Therefore, it is deemed an alarming problem to deal with.

On the contrary, the aforementioned adversity is considered insoluble to some others. One of the stepping stones of this argument is that the problem is far too gargantuan and widespread to be sufficiently tackled or mitigated. Although some short term solutions have proven slightly practical and promising, the big picture remains quite perplexing since it requires the cooperation of nations and citizens across the board, not all of whom have shown the enthusiasm for embarking on the challenge. Furthermore, the planet we are living on has gone through more severe hassles and difficulties before, and it has managed to adapt time and time again. For instance, several species used to roam this planet, most of which have gone extinct, not influencing the course of  nature significantly. Thus, the earth itself has the capacity and history of getting to grips with these changes and coming to peace terms with them.

In conclusion, having contemplated over all provided reasons, I tend to opine that adhering to the conservative way of environment present profound aspects for future of the world, progressing with this disaster should not be neglected.

prompt: In some cites and towns all over the world ,the high volume of traffic is a problem.what are the causes of this and what actions can be taken to solve this problem?
essay:
There is no denying the fact that the high volume of traffic is considered a problem in some cities and towns all over the world. The traffic congestion problem is the trending problem nowadays, therefore, this essay will demonstrate the causes and the solution to this problem. 

There are many factors that unfortunately increase the high volume of traffic. Recently, the industry of cars has been significantly improving and it has motivated people to buy cars more. For instance, electric cars have been popularly introduced to us which led to having more cars running on our streets. Equally important is the percentage of rider capacity, it is the percentage of how many persons are in one vehicle for each trip, and it is approximately 1.1 riders per vehicle. This percentage is a result of people wanting their privacy during their trips, and fewer people using public transportation. 

Traffic congestion can luckily be improved. many studies have proven that with control measures and sharing awareness, traffic congestion can be improved. As revealed, making public transportation more comfortable and fixed headways can be one of the most effective ways to ensure that people are using the bus more. In addition, Carpooling concept can be shared through the people, where people can ride along with each other if they were going on the same route. Moreover, a solution to this problem can be constructing a new road for bicycles to motivate people that they can go to work using their bikes. 

On the whole, the traffic congestion problem is man-made, hence, it can be solved easily by taking some measures and having the willingness to accept new ways and methods. In the meantime, more studies should be conducted to analyze the operational performance of roads.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement:**

- The candidate has adequately addressed the task by identifying the causes and actions to solve the problem of high traffic volume in cities and towns.
- The essay presents ideas clearly and coherently, supporting arguments with relevant examples.
- All parts of the task have been covered, including identifying causes and suggesting solutions.
- Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 7

- The essay is well-organized, with a logical flow of information.
- Linking devices are used effectively to connect ideas and paragraphs.

prompt: Some people think that the best way to solve global environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuel. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
It is a well-documented thought that the growth of fuel’s price is the best way to address worldwide issues related to the environment. From my perspective, I wholly disagree with the statement. This essay will analyze how unwise it is to use fuel’s expensiveness as a means to tackle pollution before pointing out the merits of other remedies which are more efficient.

On the one hand, it is understandable for the governments or leaders of some nations to raise the cost of fuel in order to reduce pollution. Obviously, the general public may consider more thoroughly on the usage of this unalterable source of energy, which is likely to result in the decline in daily fuel’s waste. However, it is undeniable that people will face troubles in controlling their finances and some even can not travel around because of their inability to afford fuel. Consequently, the action of boosting fuel’s cost may negatively affect a majority of a nation in the case of transportation rather than help them with raising their awareness in conserving the environment.  In brief, I would contend that it is flawed to take advantage of fuel’s availability to solve environmental problems.

On the other hand, it is better to involve people in planting trees campaigns. First and foremost, trees’ plantations contribute directly to the protection of the environment. The key rationale is that unlike rising fuel’s price which have foreseen shortcomings, numerous trees will dramatically ease the continuous rise of the Earth’s temperature. As a result, most issues associated with the environment such as climate change, which is a worldwide concern nowadays will be addressed as soon as possible. 

In conclusion, while there may be some justifications for attaching costly fuel to tackle pollution, I believe that the plantation of trees plays a more pivotal role in solving the aforementioned issue because of its direct effectiveness.
evaluation:

prompt: Some people think that newspapers are the best way to learn news. However, others believe that they can learn news better through other media. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
Nowadays, the public keep up with the latest news through different media. While, some people believe that newspapers are the best sources of news, others, myself included, think that people can be informed about news via other mass media.

Those, who claim that news can be learnt best by newspapers, believe that they provide the most reliable news, since their sources are known. Having many publishers and editors, which has been verified by official organizations, explains this credibility. Whereas, there might be no safeguards against some fake news published in other media, such as the Internet and some radio channels. However, I believe not all newspapers contain the original information. For example, some tabloid newspapers possess stories, that was manipulated in order to make the stories more pleasant to the reader.

On the other hand, there are other sorts of media, which are much more convenient than the mainstream media, like newspapers and magazines. Internet, for instance, is always available at any times, providing this opportunity to receive and check the news once they have been published. That is because, it only needs the readers to open their cellphones or laptops and google the name of the news website. Furthermore, if the general public seek the news online, they would not pay for anything, whereas they should buy newspapers, magazines or journals.

Last, but not least, we are living at the age of technology, where every facility is getting improved. I do not see any point at not using different websites, YouTube and Instagram channels, when they enable us to comment on the news or share them with friends. Newspapers do not offer these features to users.

In conclusion, I believe that the Internet is a better source of news than newspapers, as it provides the reader not only a faster access to updated news, but also it is cheaper and suggest many facilities, which newspapers lack.

While some citizens believe that art is a waste of time, I believe that art is crucial class for pupils to improve their self-esteem.

     On the one hand, many people think that teaching art at school is wasting time because this is not an academic subject for students. Firstly, some parents dislike schools that  teach art to their children because they are not gaining a higher educational levelon subjects such English or math. Also, the class is perceived as a waste of time because this class is not consider as an academic subjects. For instance, according to the last study in Mexico in 2019 that stays that  art is a subject considered for private schools because this class requieres specific materials, and this is consider an expensive and innecessary subjetc to teach. However, I believe this class should be included in the school program to develop skills for drawing or playing an instrument at early age.

    On the other hand, more tutors who take more serious their children's education believe that art is a crucial class for young students to improve their self-esteem by learning art. To begin with, many parents support that music stimulates children's brain and this might help them to become smarter, and self-confident. Also, parents value art as an essential skill for children to help them know about music or drawing. To illustrate, in The United States, most of the public schools teach art as academic subject in which children have the opportunity to learn how to play a musical instrument with the help of a professional musichian. I believe this is a preferable thinking to help our young generation to learn and develop more skills to help them to succed in life.

   To conclude, although many parents are not agree on the believe that art is essential, most of the society strongly think that this class is vital for children to learn at school because they can learn skills that help them to impove their self-esteem and succeed in life.

prompt: Some people think that museums should be enjoyable places to entertain people, while others believe that the purpose of museums is to educate. Discuss both views and give you own opinion
essay: People have different views about the role and function of museums. In my opinion,  museums can and should be both entertaining and educational.  On the one hand, it can be argued that the main role of a museum is to entertain. Museums are tourist attractions, and their objects that many people will want to see. The average visitor may become bored if he or she has to read or listen to too much educational content, so museums often put more of an emphasis on enjoyment rather designed to be visually spectacular, and may have interactive activities or even games as part of its exhibitions.  On the other hand, some people argue that museums should focus on education. The  aim of any exhibition should be to teach visitors something that they did not previously know. Usually this means that the history behind the museum’s exhibits needs to be explained, and this can be done in various ways. Some museums employ professional guides to talk to their  visitors can listen to detailed commentary about the exhibition. In this way, museums  can play an important role in teaching people about history, culture, science and many  other aspects of life.  In conclusion, it seems to me that a good museum should be able to offer an  interesting, enjoyable and educational experience so that people can have fun and  learn something at the same time.

prompt: In some countries, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in. What are the reasons for this? How can people research this?
essay:
In the era of globalization, a numerous number of inhabitants have been becoming more curious about their current accommodation. The objective of this essay is to investigate some causes of people trying to explore the past of building they live in, suggest possible solutions that residents can provide and evaluate them. 

One of the major causes of having passion for exploring the history of the building has been arising with its historical value. In other words, the overwhelming majority of local organization exerts oneself to the utmost extent to share information about significant historical events via social media. For instance, government announces pictures of buildings of ancient times in order to catch individuals’ attention. Consequently, new generation, who did not live in those times, identify their homes as well as be inspired to investigate the history of local architecture. Solution for this might be researching previous possessors and the house itself, as it might have some unique differences compared to other buildings. This solution is more possible due to the fact that it is effortless to find former owners in contemporary world owing to the Internet. 

Another crucial cause of keening on knowing more about the past of the place that they live in is profit that owners can make putting up the building for sale. In other quarters, businessmen want to acquire historical houses as early as possible, since its price might soar substantially year by year, being a prominent investment. As an example, houses in Western Europe where dukes used to live cost a fortune on the international market. Therefore, in recent times residents are paying more attention to homes that they are living at the moment. Learning house’s past and its maintenance could be believed as a solution. This solution is more feasible as everyone can find any data in the net.  

To sum up, all aforementioned points illustrate that by learning backward of the home they live, inhabitants can make benefits from it. As far as I am concerned, the residents could certainly implement a range of measurements to research historical buildings.

prompt:
Some people believe that eventually all jobs will be done by artificially intelligent robots. What is your opinion? 
Give reasons for your answer.
essay:
Artificially intelligent robots are steadily taking off the positions of individuals at their place of work. Even though, there is every tendency for most simple positions to be taken over in the future, it is most unlikely that occupations that deal with human beings to be completely taken over . This essay will discuss why some jobs will still be done by people and not replaced by robots .

In future , computerized devices will substitute all menial jobs that are unskilled in nature. Most employers will shift more towards the use of artificial intelligence because it is cost-effective compared to employing humans. For example , in Nigeria, accounting software is now being used for auditing and balancing accounts in various finance firms replacing the jobs of some financial analysts and auditors. In addition, this software work around the clock and requires no remunerations, performing better, faster and efficiently. For these reasons, machines will substitute posts that requires fewer human skills.

Conversely, there are some human jobs that cannot be replaced because robots will never achieve the capacity to do them. These jobs include psychiatrists, software developers, project managers and graphic designers, to name but a few. Computerized devices will never be able to replace some jobs because certain human beings are needed to perform those tasks.

In summary, computers and machines will most likely , in the long run gradually take up a significant number of activities. The menial professions will eventually be controlled by robots,  nevertheless, work that requires highly intelligent human skills will still be available. Ultimately, in a progressively automated workplace, limited human jobs will be safe.
evaluation:

- The essay presents a clear stance that some jobs will still be done by humans, with reasons provided.

prompt: Some people believe that younger family members should be legally responsible for supporting older family members when they become physically, mentally and financially unable to look after themselves. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Humans are destined to age and tend to become generally unable to cater for themselves. It has been argued that younger relatives should be held responsible for the upkeep and care of the elderly in their family and that this should be enforceable with the backing of the law, others have however expressed their contrary beliefs on this issue. I strongly agree with the former school of thought.

Despite the fact that it is well known that as we age, we become quite reliant on younger people for strength, mental health and for finance, young people often have little or no time to do this hence the need for making the policy a law. Who do we rely upon if not our immediate family members who are more vibrant and full of vitality and this is known by the government of each country. Moreover, it is trite that the warmth of close relations brings succour to aged people. For example, it has been established that elders who are tended to by their grandchildren or offsprings fiar better than their counterparts who are in old peoples' homes this perhaps can be attributed to the strong emotional ties that bind them together. Therefore, it has become desirable that young people be mandated not to neglect their old relatives as it is currently the case in Japan.

Another thing to bear in mind is the fact that peculiar and remarkable interactions have been made between the persons concerned over time and that memories have been created within the clan that the old and young reminisce upon fondly. Although there are trained care givers nowadays, the joy that comes with family time cannot be jettisoned. Also, when I consider the benefit of preservation of history and knowledge which benefits individuals and the entire country, through oral tales and reditions by the elderly to their younger generation, I cannot but agree that the care of the old be left with their younger generation with a legal enforcement. For instance, recipies have been passed down from generation to generation during interactions between the two sects and traditions have been preserved this way.

To sum up, I support that the younger generation of each family be held liable for the care of their aged as this benefits not only the old but also the young and the entire nation.
evaluation:

- The candidate has addressed the given task by discussing the extent to which they agree that younger family members should be legally responsible for supporting older family members.

prompt: Some people think the governments should increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles in order to solve the environments problems. to what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
It is irrefutable that massive usage of fossil fuels exacerbates the environmental issues. Hence, many people believe if price of fuel is raised then it would solve all the biohazards. I do not agree that just focussing on one specific area which is tiny part of this humongous problem is the solution; this essay will discuss why.


Taking such measure does more damage compared to the benefit. Because of increase in fuel rates, there could be conflicts amongst the common man and the administration. Having taken such step of hiking prices would fill public with rage lead to curfews and sloganeering, for instance, hence, disrupting balance in the society. Moreover, despite the fact that traffic might decrease due to this step, motor companies will suffer and it would affect the national economy directly. However, if more effective ways like using electricity produced by solar energy or other renewable energy sources are used to power the motor vehicles then above stated issues can be governed.


On the other hand, major air pollutants are the gases and and residues from the industrial waste. Carbon emission from vehicles doesnt affect the ecosystem much as compared to toxic waste generated by industries. All kinds of greenhouse gases like nitrogen, methane, carbon monooxide etc. are discharged by manufacturing companies without treating them, this in turn leads to spike in temprature which directly impacts the climate in detrimental way. Therefore, having appropriate waste management facilities to treat 
contaminated and toxic waste before releasing into environment would help and expidite the process of saving our ecosystem.


In the nutshell, this essay discussed the reasons why raising fuel price is not a effective answer to environmental problems including decline in nation's economy due hit in motor companies and industrial waste is teh major catalyst to the biohazard. Hence, rather than increasing fuel price having proper waste management facilities should be the focus. In my opnion, I disagree that just fuel price hike is not the answer to solve environmental problems.
evaluation:

- The candidate has addressed the task by presenting a clear stance and providing reasons for their disagreement.

prompt: Many people argue that in order to improve educational quality, high school students should encouraged to question and offer criticisms on their teachers. Others think this will lead to loss of respect and discipline in the classroom. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
Education plays a very pivotal role in everyone's life and asking questions about the course is common among children. However, some people feel for the betterment of the education system it would be great if students argue with teachers about the topic while others opposed to it and think that it will affect the respect of teachers to a great extent as children will not have that discipline in them. This essay will take into consideration both the points and at last will state a personal opinion on how we can deal with this issue?

On one hand, discussions in the classrooms are always beneficial as it helps to maintain a teacher-student bond. In other words, when a child clarifies certain queries with a teacher, it helps them to understand each other well. Moreover, frequent debating makes children confident in their future pursuits. For example, while doing group discussions in the office people feel confident to argue about anything because of their strong foundation. Furthermore, this will leads to criticising teachers when they do not have the knowledge about the context.

On the other hand, others strongly opposed it. They think that it will lead to misbehavioural issues in the class as children will lose respect for their teachers. For instance, pupils in the United Kingdom mistreat their teachers during class because of fewer rules and regulations. Due to this, teachers will never feel inclined toward the children and will not have an understandable relationship with their students. This will affect their school life as they will never be able to respect others in future.

To sum up, it is inevitable to say discussions are an integral part of every classroom as they not only boost children's confidence but also enhance the relationship between teacher and students. Therefore, in my opinion, it would be great if children should know their limits and always maintain the decorum of the classroom by respecting their teachers.
evaluation:

- The essay addresses the given task effectively, discussing both views on whether students should be encouraged to question teachers and providing a personal opinion.
- The ideas are presented clearly and coherently, with each paragraph covering a different aspect of the topic.

prompt: 21.Nowadays, more and more jobs and tasks which involve hard physical work are done by machines. Do the positive effects of this trend outweigh the negative effects?
essay:
Indeed, the modern world is moving in a direction where more routine tasks are performed by machines. While this trend is welcomed by many, I would say that we should not be overly optimistic about it, given its detrimental effects on individuals and society.

On the surface, the trend toward automation seems to be benefiting the world in every way. On a personal level, this trend frees many people from mundane tasks and allows them to do something more meaningful. For example, when mechanized farming frees farmers from tasks such as planting and ploughing, they can spend more time and energy focusing on market prices and sales. Additionally, entrepreneurs care most about the increase in productivity and efficiency brought about by the wide application of machines. However, in my opinion, these benefits mentioned above should be considered from the opposite perspective. Firstly, the era of mechanization not only failed to liberate people from secular labour but also witnessed the demise of many handicrafts and traditional skills.

Even further, as handcrafted items are replaced by faceless uniform products on the assembly line, it is even more frustrating to us that there is a lack of diversity and richness in national identities and cultures worldwide. This is because a nation's culture, customs, and spirit are inextricably linked to its traditional handicrafts. Another problem that cannot be ignored is the ensuing unemployment problem. While the manufacturing industry is enjoying the dividends of robots replacing labour, millions of workers are unemployed. This is unacceptable for any government.

In conclusion, I would say that industrialization should not come at the expense of traditional skills or unemployment.
evaluation:
### Task Achievement:
- The candidate has effectively addressed the given task by discussing both the positive and negative effects of machines replacing human labor.
- The response is clear and coherent, presenting ideas in a logical order.
- The candidate has fully covered all parts of the task and provided relevant examples to support arguments.
- Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 7

prompt:
Detailed describtion of crimes on newspaper and TV can have bad consequences on society, so this kind of information should be banned in the media.

To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Nowadays, societies all across the globe are susceptible to mass-media-related delinquency more than ever before. Therefore, some experts have proposed the prohibition of in-depth showcases of crime scenes from media platforms. This essay will explain why I agree that society might turn into a frightening place although this information can raise public awareness.

Admittedly, there are a plethora of explicit crime scenes and the media often makes headlines with them. Newspapers, TV channels and radio are mainly focused on propagating criminal acts with vivid descriptions to impress  readers and viewers. Even the most violent personals such as  Nikko Jenkinson, who is an American serial killer, are covered by media reporters in an ordinary, unworried tone of voice. This inevitably makes the general public who watches it become careless about the nature and seriousness of crimes committed. This type of explicit showcase of unpity behaviour upon committing a crime may create the successors of Nikko Jenkinson in other societies.

However, from a viewer's standpoint, comprehensive descriptions of criminal offences may actually help people to prevent such cases in their own lives. In other words, they can self-educate through this, which could assist them in avoiding criminal traps. For example, when news about unknown gangs killing housewives who opened the door to intruders breaks out, this may be a lesson to learn for other women of similar habits. Moreover, a scenic appearance of a taxi driver accused of abusing and robbing rich passengers can open many people's eyes and make them extra alert. In short, reading and watching criminal reviews on media can help other people to stay out of trouble.

In conclusion, while it is true that prohibiting the explicit media coverage of crimes can keep  society in a safe zone, I do also believe that this sort of information has a role to play in our day-to-day lives.
evaluation:

prompt: Some people think watching TV is bad for children in every way. Other think TV has positive effects on children, as they develop to grow up. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
Many individuals believe that watching TV is not good for  young adults in every way, while others would argue that TV provides a good impact on  teenagers, as they get older.Although, watching TV enhances a child's curiosity as well as knowledge, I believe that watching TV is bad for their health.

On the one hand, many individuals believe that watching television is beneficial for heir during their growth stages because  that offspring get different knowledge and it enhances their curiosity about various aspects of the World. Television contains different genera of  shows and programs where children learn new social skills as well as  get knowledge about different cultures and traditions from  society. For instance, there are various programs such as Science of Stupid on National geography, Minecraft, best from Waste and many more, from these types of shows they develop new skills.

Many people opine that watching TV is harmful to young children because it is cause various health problems. It is observed that many children suffer from serious health issues regarding their eyes where they have low vision problems or blindness  as well as  suffer from mental illness due to overconsumption of television. Moreover, it is seen that many adults have anger issues because of their addiction to  TV. For example, in India, children watch around 6 to 7 hours of continuous TV which is seriously affected  their eyes and health due to this behaviour around 35% of children suffer from low vision problems in their early life stages.Therefore, I believe that watching TV is not good for children.

In conclusion, I reiterate my view that TV is on the whole advantageous for children, ,,however the effects of television viewing depend on the program, genre, and the time limit allocated to TV viewing.

prompt: Most high level jobs are done by men. Should the government encourage a certain percentage of these jobs to be reserved for women?
essay:
It is a common scenario that maximum time men get an opportunity to perform the high-profile job. Nowadays, women have proved their ability in various types of field. If the Government keeps reserve the high ranking job for women then the scope to work will increase for them. However, some problems will be arising. In my opinion, man or woman whoever, everyone should get job on the basis of merit and qualification.
It is true that women always stay busy with household chores and child rearing. Although getting higher education they are not be able to utilize their knowledge in proper way because of the opinion of maximum people that women should be given priority in the work of home. Since, half of the population of our country are women, so if they get a chance to implement their education and talent in different fields then they can play an important role in the development of the country. Furthermore, most of the parents are prefer to make their daughter skilled in household work rather than study. If the Government give the privilege to women’s job, then these parents will encourage their girls for doing study.
Secondly, if women get a higher job opportunity they can be financially well-off. As a consequent, they will be able to take the responsibility of their families. For example, in many families, after father’s death, a daughter has to bear all expenses because they have no son or the son is too young to manage the expenses of the family.

On the contrary, it is seen that men always manage all the expenses of the family. If high level jobs are kept isolated for women then there will be a dearth of job for men. As an effect, they will select an illegal way to fulfill their needs which will bad impact to the society. Apart from this an ineligible woman will get benefits rather than an eligible man.

prompt: Nowadays more and more people want to get things done instantly (services, information, tasks). Why is this? Do you think it is a positive or negative development?
essay:
These days, the communities urge to have an instant result to things, such as services, information, and tasks. I think that there is one factor to this condition. Furthermore, I have a strong agreement that this situation is a positive development for us.

The reason for this instant habit is the development of the information technology and service businesses that made everything provided in less than a minute. We can get any information in a second by scrolling our phones, like the updates of the USA presidency. Moreover, there is an excessive number of services so that we do not have to be bothered by doing a complex task. For example, the Writing9.com website helps us in doing IELTS writing exam practices by scoring our essay with artificial intelligence. 

I suggest that this is a positive phenomenon because it increases our work efficiency. The fast rate of information will push our works to be done quickly. For instance, a project manager is able to create a project charter in a short time because the person can download a template from the internet. Additionally, we are able to finish big activities by collaborating with external parties. To illustrate, in developing our company's staff, the human resource department can hire professional coaches to put awareness about working diligently in the staffs' minds.

Second, it may develop the country's economic condition as it opens more opportunities to service transactions. The engagement of people happens. Consequently, more individuals or groups need external services. In the case of home service, if someone that owns an apartment is lazy to clean the room, he/she may order a cleaning service. Thus, this can help more humans to have a job.

In short, the instant state of mind happens because of the development of our technologies. Even though some individuals may see this case with a negative mindset, I have to agree that this situation is good for us.

prompt: Films and computer games containing violence are popular. Some people say they have negative effect on society and should be banned. Others say they are just harmless relaxation. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
The Media and video games, which project violence, is being considered the best source of entertainment, while others argue that it leaves a bad effect on people's health and mind. Both these arguments are topical in nature and hence a thorough discussion is needed before framing a logical conclusion.

To commence with, Films and games, those content based on violence, increase the crime rate in society and that's why these types of movies must be banned by the government. For instance, people who watch these, may results more aggressive behaviour and show disrespect towards others. In addition to it, adults who are spending maximum time on these activities may  inresult health issues. For example, anxiety, depression, and many more. Hence, there is a demand in the community to stop creating violent content. 

Nevertheless, others consider the objective of computer games and films to entertain and relax the public from a daily routine. Although Movies and games that contain violence  give  life learning lessons at the end. The human mind is good enough to differentiate the positive and negative outcomes from these features. Moreover, these recreational activities help to reduce  stress and increase concentration towards listening. 

Having concluded, after analyzing both views in detail, as far as today's generation is capable to distinguish between real and virtual life, violence in movies and games is least likely to make any social problems. In other words, as long as films and games are only used for entertainment purposes will not create any problem in the country.

prompt:
In some countries, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in.

What are the reasons for this?

How can people research this?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay:
Nowadays, more and more people are becoming keen on figuring out the history of where they live in.There are some reasons for this phenomenon and also solutions to it. 

This issue stems from a few factors.The first reason is that people are curious all the time about everything. For instance , when an apple fell down on Newton's head , he did not complain about why is he so unlucky.Curiosity drives us to have a strong desire to know what contributes to Newton’s discovery of gravitation. The issue also results apply that the history of their house or building can help them find out more cultural value and economic value that's why there are so many historic buildings in the world. For example , Shikumen is a residential building with Chinese characteristics but few remain today due to the war.But nowadays ,there are still apply a part of people staying in Shikumen where is their grandparents lived. They are very proud of the house or building they live in because it's full of historical stories.At the same time ,Shikumen is the most expensive house in Shanghai. If the people who live there want to sell the house，the more history they knew , the more money they can sell it for. 

Regarding these factors , the phenomenon could be tackled by some means.Firstly, they can ask for their parents or their grandparents, who lived there longer and knew more past about the house than they. In addition, every country has their own museum which tells the history of land changes，people can go to there to find the answers. 

In conclusion, the phenomenon that more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in is due to the reasons above, and the means will help people research this.

prompt: Some people think that museums should be enjoyable places to entertain people, while others believe that the purpose of museums is to educate.  Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
People have various views about whether tourists truly enjoy visiting museums, or they just tend to acquire academic knowledge from museums. In my opinion, I would argue that visitors could be educated in museums.

On the one hand, for several reasons, museums is an attractive place for people to spend their spare time. Firstly, visitors could escape from work pressure and have a relax at museums. Nowadays, our daily lives are fulfilled with  endless work tasks or trivial stuff. When people visit museums, they would focus on the exhibition, and they could calm down in a quiet environment. This might give a temporary rest to workers. Secondly, with the technical development, we might enjoy exhibitions in a much more comprehensive way. For example, some museums provide a variety of videos and audio materials for visitors. Apart from experiencing the art visually, we are likely to be entertained in different ways.

On the other hand, some people argue that museums should concentrate on education. I would agree that teenagers would be beneficial from visiting museums. Museums is the most popular place for school trips. Students could gain real experience and learn practical skills when they visit museums. For example, young people would learn history knowledge, when they go to the local history museums. Children would acquire knowledge in favour of reading books through a more vivid way.

In conclusion, some people always discuss whether the public could learn something from the exhibitions in museums, while I do believe there are some benefits to education.

In many countries today, parents are able to choose to send their children to single-sex schools or co-educational schools. Some people think that children to single-sex schools have disadvantages later in life.

Nowadays, pupils are acquiring a knowledge in the single-sex schools which were selected by their parents, and it is claimed that it will has drawbacks in their future life. I partially agree with this notion. In the following paragraphs I shall put forth my argument to support my point of view.
          Firstly, due to less communication with the opposite gender anyone will sense a discomfort and also one’s professional life affected badly. In other words, pupils, who went to only single-gender schools grew up shy and weak. For instance, personality who wants to get a job should pass a conversation in which checks ability to capable of performing under cruel circumstances. Hence, if this is a graduate of the single-sex school, the individual does not  have a challenging work. Whereas people who have attended mixed-gender institute have proven to perform excellently under any critical situation.
          On the other hand, co-educational institutions have a badly discipline issue, which interfere of their studies with allowing various  contradictions. However, separated gender schools can avoid from these problems and as a result, everyone would completely focus on their lessons. To put it simply, it is proved that almost all of the graduates who gain an education in single-sex high schools have more ability to concentrate comparing with conventional institutes. Therefore, this type of schools does not waste special time and improves attention skills.
          To sum up, I believe that young generations who were not attending co-ed schools are not able to successfully and develop professionally.

Sports, nowadays have become an integral part of the young generation. The society has been discussing about the consequences of competitive sports in schools for youngers. This essay will discuss why I strongly believe that all kinds of sports should be teach at school. 

First of all, the main idea behind the sports is that they maintain the body moving. As a result of it, sports make us healthier and happier. Second of all, especially for children these kinds of practice are really necessary to develop theirs muscles, bones, and even mind. For example, if they practiced regular activities more often, such as, soccer, basketball or volley, their health will be improved a lot, also they could live more and more years.

Moreover, working as a team, some young people develop the ability to understand how the world works, while some are the first, others could be the last. For instance, when I was a child, I used to play soccer with my friends during the high school, and it was an amazing experience for all of us, because sometimes we won, and others we lost, but we never gave up. Consequently, this period taught us an important lesson for entire life, that is "no matter the final result, always give your best".

In conclusion, I totally agree with it that there are more pros than cons of teaching competitive sports for children, they could rise mature and being better people, facing challenges no matter how big they could be.

prompt: Some believe that people should make efforts to fight climate change while others think it is better to learn to live with it. Discuss both views and give your own opinions.
essay:
In a hundred years recently, mankind has been on a quest for countermeasures against climate change which he is to be responsible for. However, some criticize these additional actions to be costly with no remarkable improvements, and eventually suggests that we should accept environmental issues as they are. This essay believes that efforts to climate change should be strengthened rather than giving in due to the reasons below.

First, it is the responsibility of humankind to mitigate the impacts of human activities on the environment, and education has a crucial role to play. The increase in temperature and rising sea level has been intensified since the beginning of the industrial revolution until now. Many activities common nowadays did not exist before that, for example the burning of fossil fuel to create electricity, lighting, and mobility needs. With a population reaching 8 billions, the amount of fuel for daily activities is huge. Meanwhile, the burning process is known for releasing CO2 which directly caused an increase in temperature. What is worse, cooling refrigerants, which are essential chemicals for fridges and air-conditioners to function, are made up of global warming gases such as CFCs and HFCs. The fact is that from furniture to devices and even lifestyles, human activities is the main source of global warming even though we may not be aware of it. Education about potentially harmful human activities and corresponding solutions are important to increase the diffusion rate of new environmental-friendly technologies, which will contribute to the final bottom lines of reserving impacts of climate change.

On the other hand, some individuals claim that the adoption of environmental-friendly technologies and procedures increases costs for companies and consumers. They also argue that the debate for conservation has been a common topic, but actually the results to be felt is negligible. What is more, it is easier following conventional methods than making changes. Besides that, current lifestyle which relies on fossil fuel energy resources and plastic is more convenient than readily available compared to efforts in looking for alternatives which strive to serve the same ends.

However, climate change seems inevitable because we as human being has not done enough on our parts. Government should take initiative in funding researches into low greenhouse emission materials and technologies, especially those with versatile application potentials. Corporates should make efforts to switch to environmental-friendly alternative products and operations where possible. End users and households should deliberate choose green products and solutions over traditional ones. 

In a nutshell, resolving environmental issues is the task of the collective and should be included in daily activities for each of us. Unless everybody fulfils their roles, the impact will be exacerbated from abnormal to extreme weather conditions, from local to global. We should not trade off short-term convenience and the cheaper costs for a sustainable future because consequences will accumulate and our suffering days will be near.
evaluation:
## Task Achievement:
- The candidate has adequately addressed the task by discussing both views on climate change and providing their own opinion.

- The candidate has fully covered all parts of the task and supported arguments appropriately.

prompt: More and more people are seriously overweight. Some people suggest the solution to this problem is to increase the price of fattening foods. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
The recent increase in cases of obesity amongst humans is a cause for concern. It is often argued that this issue can be tackled by hiking the cost of foods that cause this problem. I completely agree with this point of view and therefore, in this essay, I will examine the reasons to support my opinion and provide a suitable conclusion.

Firstly, raising the price of unhealthy eatables makes it less affordable to the vast majority of the general public. This is because, since most people have a fixed budget to spend on food, they are less likely to splurge on costly snacks and thus they will consume it in very low quantities. For example, if a packet of potato chips cost thrice as much as it used to, by default an average person will look to buy only one instead of multiple packs. This is to say that the higher the price, lower will be the consumption.

Secondly, when the cost of commodities goes up, manufacturers will be forced to reduce production or even halt it. That is why when buyers cut down on buying their products, the company will suffer losses and hence they will be forced to stop releasing unhealthy edibles and maybe it can even encourage them to venture into making healthy snacks. 

In conclusion,  changing the price of snacks that are bad for health will result in lower cases of obesity. I strongly believe making snacks unaffordable and forcing companies to stop producing foods that are harmful to health is the best solution to this problem.

prompt:
Consumers are faced with increasing numbers of advertisements from competing companies.
To what extent do you think are consumers influenced by advertisements?
What measures can be taken to protect them?
essay:
The effect that advertising has on our society may be subtle, and most of us remain unaware of how it moulds us to meet the needs of competing companies. Actually, a large number of advertisements may be harmful to consumers and therefore should be better controlled in the mass media.

The negative influences of advertising from competing companies on consumers are beyond doubt. It is easy to change people’s needs into greed. In fact, advertisements from different companies constantly encourage people to want diverse things. Thus, surrounded by the advertisement, people are too unwise to perform a balanced act between income and expenditure. In other words, many consumers are convinced to overdraw the money they do not have. As a result, what seems to be good for the economy begins to backfire because advertising from competing companies may mislead consumers deeply into credit card debts which they could not afford to pay before the deadline.

Accordingly, some proactive methods are suggested to be applied. Firstly, the government should take serious action to counteract the negative effects of  advertisements from competing companies. One effective approach is to establish and impose strict censorship aiming to advertise on mass media. Also, the local TV station and Internet website should increase the costs of these advertisements to be shown or published through the public media. In this way, the current enormous qualities can be reduced and minimize their negative impacts.

In summary, the drawbacks of advertising to customers may motivate people’s greed and add huge financial burdens. Consequently, various actions should be taken by the government, TV stations and website managers to reduce these negative impacts and protect the rights of consumers.

prompt: Some people believe that eventually all jobs will be done by artificially intelligent robots. what is your opinion on this?
essay:
Some individuals think that artificially intelligent robots will take over the occupations that currently require human workforce in the future. Although, it’s possible that all menial jobs will eventually be replaced by robots, I believe that it’s unlikely to replace jobs where human judgements and talents are necessary. 

This essay will discuss why eventually only very few jobs will be carried out by people. 

Robots may eventually replace all human labour that does not require specific and complex human skills. Many companies will turn to artificial intelligence because it is far less expensive than hiring, training and employing a human. In supermarkets in Australia, for example, many cashiers have been replaced by automated stations that cost far less than employees. In addition, these automated stations work around the clock and require no holidays or holiday pay. For these reasons, jobs that can be replaced by robotic intelligence will be replaced.  

Conversely, there are some human jobs that cannot be replaced because robots will never achieve the capacity to do them. Put simply, some jobs require a 'human touch'. These jobs include psychology, education, medicine and social work to name but a few. Robots will never be able to achieve what has taken social evolution hundreds of thousands of years to achieve. 

In conclusion, it is increasingly likely that robots will end most human employment. Unskilled labour will eventually be done entirely by robots ; however, sophisticated jobs that require human-specific skills will always exist. Ultimately, very few jobs will be safe in an increasingly artificially intelligent workforce.
evaluation:

Every province has different traditions & cultures and that would aid child to grow & evolve in a discreet individual. Some folks suggest that, if a ménage migrates to territory with their children, it’s a remunerative act for their fate while others argue that, it will create an uncertain situation for them and detrimental to their curriculum. 

To begin with, people move from one to another region, they have to face up some adverse effects. For instance, when students attend their varsity in another state or country, they feel discrimination between them and fellow students. They might have a problem linguistically and this approach might end up with a disappointing behaviour and homesickness. In addition, their different tradition might not usually as them. Their folks may not as helpful as in their province. For example, many families choose to move in developed territory for their growth on a monetary basis, but, they feel humiliation from the natives and irritate with their adamant state of mind. With these bizarre events, they do not choose to move from one to another.

Secondly, choosing another country for further curriculum activities or for own purposes is a reasonable reason for moving into a foreign area. It’s a remunerative way to learn discrete cultures and traditions. In terms of comparison, developed countries have adequate tract to lure the individuals via their fascinating schemes and their per capita income ratio.

Finally, as per the views, I believe in the opinion of, when people relocate their residents in other provinces, it’s quite an arduous effect on children, but overall, it’s beneficial for both child and their household members to move for better & prosperous fate.

prompt: Some people think that in order to continue improving the quality of high school education, students should be encouraged to evaluate and criticize their teachers. Others, however, believe that this would result in the loss of discipline for teachers. Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.
essay:
In recent decades, it has been argued that teenagers in educational institutions ought to have opportunities to evaluate and criticize to improve the quality of school education. Although some people claim that students could be less disciplined than teachers in school classes because of the evaluation system I strongly believe that youngsters should become critics to enhance learning processes.

To begin with, it is a fact that students are likely to make the degree of the educational system of high school improved by providing criticism or judgement since they are the learners who are directly connected with the educators. For example, as the education department allows youngsters to examine learning processes and provides suggestions about teachers in high schools in South Korea, their satisfaction level as well as the quality of high school education have been enormously enhanced in school classes. Thus, it is significantly essential for teenagers to provide feedback about teachers in order to contribute to improving educational systems in high schools.

On the other hand, it cannot be denied that students could abuse this feedback system negatively.

For instance, because most of the surveys of feedback systems in high schools are anonymous, there are some students who utilize the feedback system in a bad way. Furthermore, it is comparatively difficult to figure out whether the evaluation and criticism of teachers are the truth or not. Due to these facts, educators will be taking an action against students carefully and this circumstance will result in the loss of discipline for teachers. Thus, feedback programs for educators should be progressed prudently.

In conclusion, In my opinion, even though there are some disadvantages to the evaluation system, I strongly suggest that the acquisition of students' feedback will be the most effective way to obtain direct criticism about teachers to enhance the quality of high school education.

prompt: Consumers are faced with increasing numbers of advertisements from competing companies. To what extent do you think consumers are influenced by advertisements? What measures can be taken to protect them?
essay:
Nowadays a plethora of consumers are facing the problem of an increasing number of advertisements from rival companies. This essay will discuss the  cause and solution of this issue which affects  everyone around the globe.

To begin with, the advertisement has already brought tremendous change in all walks of human life. Companies create these advertisements to spread awareness of their products among their customers. Moreover, day by day numerous companies sell the same product with various offers to consumers which led to confusion and distraction among the customer. For instance, a student while browsing on the internet to get information related to their assignment gets distracted by pop-up advertisements which attract them to look into the products and is unwilling to force them to buy those products. According to a survey conducted by Nepal Economic Forum they came to know that consumers are frustrated with the increasing number of advertisements which are shown on T.V and on the Internet.

In the contrast, it is a widespread concern around the globe through  consumer gets distracted from these unwanted advertisements which appear in between their work. In order to avoid this kind of activities consumer should use an alternative browser such as brave which will automatically block advertisements on a plethora of websites. Furthermore, the government should investigate the product that is displayed on websites, on TV and the billboard, regarding their quality. For example,  baby milk powder  contains harmful chemicals and thus led to food poison in babies.

To conclude, showing advertisements is beneficial to consumers as they spread awareness among the customer for their new products but it should be done in a way that does not affect  people. Moreover, there should be government regulatory bodies which will look to inspect the advertisement of the companies.

prompt: Some people believe that the government should continuously support the development of arts. Others believe that the money can be well spent on scientific research. Discuss both and give your own opinion.
essay:
Arts and sciences both contribute significantly to a country’s prosperity in the modern world, but which one is worth more funds still remains controversial. While some people believe that the government should spend continuously on arts, I would argue that the government’s budget should be planned more carefully and in some cases, scientific research definitely needs more money.
 
Some people think that arts should be funded in a continuous way because this can enrich people’s cultural life and possibly they can have better moods every day. If the spending on the film industry increases, film-makers will be able to produce films of higher quality to entertain the viewers, and after watching an entertaining film, these people will definitely be happier. In addition, some musical instruments can also be installed in public places with sufficient budget, and people who want to play them can feel free to do that. Both the players and the listeners will benefit from this.
 
On the other hand, scientific research is also indispensable as with higher technology, people can have a better quality of life, especially in some deprived countries. The investment in genetic engineering can increase the yields in agriculture by inventing new hybrid crops, and people naturally will not suffer from hunger any more. Finally, the research in the areas of communications technology such as the Internet can reshape people’s lives, as they will be able to get richer resources faster and many new technologies will also appear as a result of it.
 
In my view, the government’s expenditure on arts is not likely to improve people’s living standards significantly and for countries whose citizens are still struggle with a basic standard of living, the investment in scientific research should be considered first, as this is more practical and can solve some urgent problems about people’s daily life domestically.

prompt: Some people think technology makes life complex, so we should make life simpler without using technology. Do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Some people consider that technology has made people's life difficult so it is better to not to use it. I strongly disagree with this statement because it has made life easy and united people which helps to ease the life of people.

Firstly, technology has made life easy by reducing physical efforts at difficult jobs. Labours had to carry heavy loads at construction work. Automated machines that carry heavy weights had made such work easy. Further, housewives used to wash clothes with their hands but now they can easily wash these in washing-machines. For instance, in warehouses automated machines load heavy products earlier men used to perform this. Hence, technology has made difficult jobs easy and made the life of people easy because they do not need to preform difficult work with huge physical efforts.

Secondly, technology has connected people through social media. Now they can share thoughts and ideas with their closed ones. They can stay in touch with relatives and friends. This all is feasible due to technology. This has become a medium to exchange thoughts. Humans need to be social to feel relax and better. Social media platform helps them to stay interacted. For instance, a recent research stated that social websites help people to fight against the sense of loneliness. Therefore, people can share their thoughts and feel better which make their life less complicated. 

In conclusion, technology has made life easy not complex. I disagree with this statement that this should not be used because this made difficult jobs easy and connected people globally.

While it is considered by some that getting a job after graduation is the best route to a successful job, others argue that studying at university is the best way to do so. This essay will explain both views and my argument with the latter argument.

To begin with, some people believe that having a job straight after secondary school as they able to save more money from working due to quickly starting a job than others. This is because their opinion about success probably would be having the most money in their entire life.

However, some opponents claim that it should be continued to study in university or college, and that would be the best successful career path. This is probably because they will earn more knowledges and connections during their study in college, and they can apply these benefits to their career. 

Personally, I believe that it should be studying in tertiary education for gaining their knowledge after studying high school. In today's ,world many companies solely accept people who are graduates of university or college because those people guaranteed that they have efficient information for organizations.

In conclusion, although some people believe that a successful career path is getting a job straight after school, I am of opinion that one should be continued to study in tertiary education after graduation from secondary school.

prompt: Some people believe that one of the best ways to solve environmental problem is to increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
There is no doubt that the problem of pollution has a huge impact not only on the environment but on humanity health as well. And the question of whether to raise up the value on cars fuel or not is extremely topical today. I tend to feel that it is a quite reasonable idea and i will give some reasons for it.

To start with the price changes, we have a big probability percentage that people will put up with this and it wil not work, but on the other hand if the government suggests environmentally friendly kinds of transportation or other alternatives such as comfortable public transport, more bike paths around the city and not only on the downtown area. Another great example of replacement fuel vehicle is electro cars. But it is quite clear that such cars need special charging stations, which are rare in small cities all the more so in the countryside.

Furthermore, I believe that the biggest influence on  ecology have manufacturing companies. It is well known that the effects of their exhaust emissions are much bigger than traffic fumes. Finally, we should remember that bigger factories with  great capital should be held responsible for the consequences but not the common people.

To conclude, I do understand the opposing view, which is that gas should not be pricey because it is no surprise that society got used to it. Nevertheless, I suggest that the pushy method is the quickest and easiest way to preserve our planet. Notably, though, I think that it needs to be a gradual process, based on careful support rather than sudden demanding law by the strict government.

For instance, provision of adequate facilities, sporting equipments, instructors and various scholarship opportunities youngsters will be motivated and preoccupied with relevant activities resulting in less chance of committing a crime. This is clear that financially investing on adolescent with the purpose of getting them involved in sports reduces unprofitable activities among them.

Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free times. This can benefit teenagers and benefit the community as well.
To what extend do you agree or disagree.

Young people have had a dynamic role in supporting community  and a few people opine that unpaid charity work should be a part of their daily free activities. I completely agree with this trend and it would be beneficial for both individuals and community in terms of work skills and dynamic labour force.
To begin with, the main reason why youth should engage themselves in community services is that it fosters them with working skills. That is to say, such type of activities tend to provide necessary skill, which is required to adopt a certain professional field. This would enable the individuals to gain enough working experience and would help them seek jobs. Take for example, old age homes, by serving in such institutions individuls can lend a helping hand to the old debalitated ones. Hence, by doing community work individuals can certainly shape up their commuting skills.
Moreover, such types of  virtuos deeds tend to be beneficial for the community, when people become a part of dynamic labour force. This could provide them a chance to help serving the community in the times of natural disasters. This has been shown to the world by the young medical students of Indonesia who actively participated at the time, when earth quake hit their land by providing ambulatory services to the people. Therefore, teenagers tend to play a pivotal role in performing community work.
Admittedly, unmonetized work, may it be a job or a community service, can sometimes become a source of financial setback for the individulas as they have to meet their educational expenditures. Despite this, the advantage of gaining working skills and serving community over money makes it an uninspired aspiration.
To conclude, it is imperative for students to do free community work for personal  as well as for community gains, otherwise they cannot retain enough working skills and promote their community. The onus lies on teens to effectively utilize their free time by helping out the community.

prompt:
Some people believe that the government should take care of old people and provide financial support after they retire. Others say individuals should save during their working years to fund their own retirement. 

What is your opinion?
essay:
People have different opinions when it comes to providing financial support and attention to elderly people after retirement. While some people believe governments are accountable for assisting these individuals, others argue that individuals should plan their retirement ahead of time. However, in my opinion, governments could provide better support to the senior citizens of their country.

In the past, most families supported their parents and grandparents during their old age, which is a fact that is changing in today's world. Now, more and more people try to avoid giving any support to their elders and this trend has been growing day by day. In this case, governments should make some effort to subsidize the cost of living for these old aged people, who could not earn money because of their higher age; furthermore, housing for the aged can be built at the cost of tax money, which could at least provide a comfortable shelter to these people. Consequently, senior citizens will not suffer due to poverty or homelessness.

Undoubtedly, it is a good idea that people should also plan their retirement ahead of time to avoid suffering at a later age. However, it would be extremely difficult for people who earn a lesser income every month to save some money for their future. Even though a large sum of money could be saved for this purpose, no amount of money could assure a sustainable life. Governments could play an important role here to implement some saving systems which could make life easier for elderly people. Consequently, this will benefit senior citizens to live a happy life.

Especially the tasks which donot involve much logical and analytical thinking and are repetitive in nature. Engineers are working flat out on this development and soon more than 50 percent of man power will be replaced by the machines. It will increase the productivity as robots can work 24 by 7 without nay breaks.

Explaining further another school of thought belongs to the side effects that robots will have on the human society. Although, the efficiency and productivity will increase but it will decrease the number of workers working in the factories resulting in loss of jobs. Furthermore, automaton works only on the basis of the built in systems they would not be able to gauge the success rate of the work being done. People usually use artificial intelligence to make their lives easier and excessive use of the same will have detrimental effects onthe human health.

In conclusion, robots will ease the man work by performing tasks which are simple and  recurring while, excessive use may have adverse affects on the human body and over dependency on the machine may also result in unemployment.

Firstly, it will the nations to make the eco. Providing free learning helps to increase the literacy rate of the country. Nonetheless, it will help the economy in long run. For instance, a survey conducted by a media firm states that 80 per cent of  pupils take schooling seriously and go for further studies. Moreover, in many countries like India, governments are giving free food, books and uniforms to the students and stats suggest that it has helped the country in an economic way.

Secondly, primary learning helps children to develop several skills and abilities. In other words, education will help individuals to grow because they will obtain a better understanding of life and get more knowledge and skills . therefore , pupils  will gain financial stability  in the future because they may have the possibility to land a good job and a high-paying salary.

In conclusion , I strongly believe that making elementary free of charge can offer a long-term solution to the country's economy because it may reduce the problem of abandoning schools   and  helps  children to develop  skills and abilities .

prompt: as transport and accommodation problems are increasing in many cities, some governments are encouraging business to move to rural areas. do you think the advantages outweigh disadvantages?
essay:
It is true that the world's largest companies are located in large cities. In the city many people expect to find better employment opportunities, often with bigger, secure companies. as cities become overcrowded, problems relating to housing and transport arise, because of which some people suggest that the larger companies should relocate to the countryside. while this may have some advantages, i firmly believe that the disadvantages would be far more than the advantages. 

It is reasonable to think that moving thousands of employees from large companies out to remote areas would have a positive impact on the overcrowding of some cities. there would be less traffic because of less strain on the services offered by the city-bank, public transportation, restaurants and the like. This would mean a reduction in queues and faster customer service. To add to it, housing would also become affordable. It is generally seen that because of too many people wanting to live in the city, land prices and event rents of houses start touching the sky.

the problem however would be that a dramatic reduction in numbers of people in the cities would mean that many businesses would go broke. Restaurants, cafes and other service areas would suffer tremendously. What would happen is that overcrowding would occur where the new, large organizations relocate. More and more people offering services would spring up- restaurants, shopping centers and other businesses would be needed to serve the increasingly larger numbers of people who moved to the area. in addition, the rural area may not be able to provide the enormous quantities of housing, electricity and raw materials required to run a huge company. 

Furthermore, relocating businesses to rural areas may upset many households. Children also may have to change schools. so It would not be practical to do so. Transport and accommodation problems in cities need to be sorted out by connecting the villages and cities by very efficient public transport, so that people come to work in cities and live in rural areas. Newer businesses should be encouraged to open in the suburbs; the already existing ones should continue to be where they already are. 

To sum up, relocating the companies would assist with the overcrowding problem in some cities. However, a new set of problems would surface, which would be far more than the benefits. Therefore, I reiterate my point that the idea of moving larger corporations out to rural areas would not be beneficial.
evaluation:
