prompt:
In some countries, more and more are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in.
What are the reasons for this?
How can people research this?
essay:
It is often argued that individuals are inquisitive about the historical background of the houses they reside in. In this essay, I will discuss reasons why and also how folks can go about their research.

Firstly, people in some nations make historical enquiries of their residing houses and the reason is to understand the environment. Some individuals prefer to ask questions about a place before or after they move into a home in an environment to get a clear picture of what it entails to live there. In addition, there are some myths about some houses that an individual might want to know before they decide whether to take it or forfeit the apartment. For example, while growing up there was a story about a haunted apartment in my area. Consequently, people who wanted the place after hearing the story would forfeit it.

Secondly, individuals make research on the history of the apartment they stay in and this can be done through questioning. The researcher could go to the immediate surrounding where the flat is and ask some questions. This will enable the individual to get more knowledge and understanding of the house he lives in. For instance, before moving into my current flat, I asked both the tenants and people living around, thereby, getting a better insight into the place before settling in. 

In conclusion, in some nations, I believe that people do much more research on the house or building they stay in because they want to understand the environment and this can be done by asking questions in the immediate surrounding.

prompt:
The shortage of housing in big cities can cause severe consequences. Only government action can solve this problem.
To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
The population growth in major cities and demand for houses has increased in parallel, which brings detrimental problems. It is said that just government can help to omit this issue which I believe is the same for these issues.

People would not expand their families unless their city could support all the family members' housing. As long as people could not find a city with large numbers of apartments or flats for their children to live in, they may not convince to bring their offspring. Consequently, governments should construct buildings to decrease public worries. Urban areas that are deprived of enough houses would not be enlarged in population; as a result, that country contains old society, and many economic problems would occur as well.

In addition, if people do not find any place to live in their city, they might immigrate to other cities or even other countries. People employed in a new job, young adults, in particular, want to live in a suitable house; if they have faced not having a home, they will resign or change their living areas. As a result, that town lost its workers, so in my opinion, governments should make architecters to design a place that can include many residents; moreover, develop the suburb to encourage people to live there to reduce problems. 

In conclusion, a shortage of living places stop families from bringing children and drops the number of jobs demanding, which hits the country's economic growth. From my point of view, governments must take actions to overcome this issue.

prompt:
In some countries, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in.

What are the reasons for this?

How can people research this?
essay:
Nowadays, the practice of researching the background of accommodations has gained popularity. One possible reason is for long-term maintenance purposes. Another is to uncover valuable stories associated with their assets. This essay will explore the reasons behind this trend and explain how to find relevant information.

Maintenance methods serve as a significant reason why some residents want to fully understand their living places. It not only includes the places' historical use but also the materials used for building them. This knowledge can be instrumental in effectively repairing and maintaining these properties in the long run. For instance, in certain parts of Thailand, it is crucial to know whether the house or the nearby area has a history of flooding, as this could lead to future mold issues. Understanding such risks helps owners prepare for possible problems.

Furthermore, in some areas, people believe that uncovering interesting information about their assets could increase their value significantly. Some houses may have had a famous resident in the past, while certain buildings might have been the site of important historical events. Consequently, these properties could potentially be transformed into museums or sold to individuals willing to pay a premium.

There are various channels through which people can discover facts and inside information about their accommodations. The easiest way is to ask their neighbors or older individuals living nearby. Additionally, they can visit community libraries or explore local websites that gather comprehensive information about the town.

In conclusion, there are many straightforward ways to investigate the background of properties, and doing so can be advantageous for the owner. A thorough understanding of accommodations will help us manage our assets appropriately and may even lead to financial benefits.

The essay addresses the prompt adequately, providing reasons for the growing interest in researching the history of residences and explaining methods of conducting such research. The candidate thoroughly covers all parts of the task, supporting arguments with relevant examples.

Therefore, there are priceless elements in the world and fuel is an essential example that has demands on it in all life areas. Public transport such as trains or buses, if the fuel becomes unavailable to owner own car or individuals there is a likelihood to increase the passengers inside them. That will lead to new stations costing billions.

 

To summarise and briefly from my perspective I found the point in the topic unrealistic, so I completely disagree. Environment request protection  from all other injurious elements such as plastic waste as an instance.

prompt:
In some countries celebrities complain about way about the way media publicize their private lives. Some people say that they should accept it as part of their fame.
Do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Celebrities are known and popular figure in society and it is seen on many occasions that media disclosed their private life to attract the viewers. However, I believe celebrity chooses name and fame and always want to be in limelight, but every individual has the right to protect his or her personal life.
To begin with, indeed, it’s true that the key aim of bigwig is to attract the attention of the public and be the centre of discussion. Popularity is directly linked to their monetary benefit and it decides their impact on society or country. It is observed in many instances that big guns are engaged in doing abnormal activities like posting sultry images on social media, making derogatory remarks against political leaders and revealing ill stuff from their wardrobe and they put all these efforts just to be in public eye. Media houses are also given priority to such flaming news and they keep on showing to their viewers as a headline which in turn increase their rating and add more revenue to their business.
However, every human wants to put a barrier in their special life and no one wants to make it public. Many celebrities are well known because their jobs put them in the spotlight like singer, actor, actress, sportsmen and many more. They should be allowed to relax, sit and enjoy with their loving ones. Being followed by paparazzi can be sometimes scary or deadly if heavy weight gets chased in their car. Take an example of Lady Diana, there was a speculation about her death that she died because she was stalked by media personnel and in the process of running away from them, her car met fatal accident.

To conclude, every entity wants some sort of personal space and it shall be respected. Broadcasting companies must evaluate the news from all corners before making it public.

prompt: Some people think news has no connection to people’s lives. So, then it is a waste of time to read the newspaper and watch television news programs. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
In this period of technology, many individuals argue that news has no connection to people’s lives. In my opinion, I strongly disagree with this notion, and my opinion will be discussed in further paragraphs. After which I will lead to a logical conclusion.

Supporting my disagreement to the given statement, I firmly believe that digital newspaper or traditional newspaper play an important role in people’ live nowadays. In the light of the fact that this can help people get more information happened in that day around the earth. To cite an example, if we do not read a newspaper we cannot know about the war between Russia and Ukraine. In addition, watch television news programs like BBC or CNN can help individual gain more knowledge about rules or policy. For instance, in Viet Nam there is a news channel called VTV1 starts at 19:00 every day, this channel contains overall information in Viet Nam and around the world in general to convey back to Vietnamese people.

Explaining some of the another supporting points in against this statement, it is true that watching news on televisions every day or read newspaper can help global citizen can know what happened around the world or in their country. As a consequence, people who live far away from their motherland can see special events via a TV or read the digital newspaper. Thus, that can make them feel less homesick when they are far away.

To sum up, reading the newspaper or watching televisions news programs do not waste people’s time, they make individuals gain more knowledge. I believe that aforementioned points are strongly supporting my view of points

prompt: Some people argue that we should do research into their family history. Others, agree with the view that we should focus on the present and future generations. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
There are controversial perspectives heating up a debate whether it is crucial to do research into family background or concentrating the present and next generations is necessary. While each has its own merits, I would contend that it is optimal to combine both mentioned factors.

Without a shadow of a doubt, it is essential to investigate family trees in order to enhance people's understanding of their ancestors' cultures. To be specific, understanding traditional habits enables people to have a good understanding of their own identity and pass it down through generations. In Vietnam, for example, when the Lunar New Year arrives, a steady stream of adults take their toddlers to churches near their homes to offer incense and provide children with family history. Hence, having a good understanding of the family history is of paramount significant. 

While the importance of studying the history of family is widely acknowledged, it is unfair if focusing on the younger generations is ignored. To be particular, the offspring are the ones who will follow in the footsteps of their ancestors in the future. In Vietnam, for example, there are numerous families who own a private corporation and prolific businesses. As a result, their descendants will be able to carry on the family's traditional vocation. As a result, focusing on the younger generations is also critical, as they will carry the entire family's career in the future.

To sum up, although looking back to family background plays a paramount significant role in providing cultural tradition for everyone, laying stress on the young is of essence as they will carry the future career of a family.
evaluation:
## Task Achievement:
- The candidate has adequately addressed the given task by discussing both the views and providing their own opinion.
- The response is clear and coherent in presenting ideas, although there could be improvements in transitions between paragraphs.
- The candidate has covered all parts of the task and supported arguments with specific examples.
- Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 7

## Coherence and Cohesion:
- The essay has a logical flow of information, with clear transitions between paragraphs.
- Linking devices are used effectively to connect ideas within and between paragraphs.
- The overall organization and structure of the essay are good.
- Suggested Band Score (Coherence and Cohesion): 7

## Lexical Resource (Vocabulary):
- The candidate uses a variety of vocabulary, although some words are repeated excessively (e.g., "essential," "significant").
- There are a few minor inaccuracies in vocabulary, such as "steady stream" (instead of "stream of adults") and "trace down" (instead of "pass down").
- The vocabulary is generally appropriate for the context.
- Suggested Band Score (Lexical Resource): 6.5

## Grammatical Range and Accuracy:
- The candidate demonstrates a good range of sentence structures, including complex and compound sentences.
- There are a few grammatical errors, such as "While the importance of studying the history of family is widely acknowledged, it is unfair if focusing on the younger generations is ignored" (should be "While the importance of studying family history is widely acknowledged, it would be unfair to ignore the focus on younger generations").
- Punctuation and sentence formation are generally accurate.

prompt:
In some countries, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in. 

What are the reasons for this?
How can people research this?
essay:
Nowadays many people are trying to discover the past of their house. There might be a lot of reasons to do this. I suppose, there are two reasons which have a significant role in this. One is curiosity and the other is the antique value of the house and the durability of the house. They can learn through the internet or from their elder neighbours. 

To begin with, people can search the past of their living space out of curiosity. An old house typically looks different from a new house. Consequently, people may get curious to learn about their houses. They might want to know more about the story behind the construction of the building. Such as, how was it looked before, what kinds of people used to live there, and who was the architect of the residence! Moreover, some may try to connect themselves through the archaeology of the building. Thus, people may get interested to explore more about their living space out of mere interest.

Secondly, some people may try to find out the history of their house due to safety concerns. They try to be assured whether the house is safe for living in or not. In other words, the time of making a house may help them to understand when they might have to renovate the residence. Furthermore, old buildings have antique value. For example, the media industry rents this kind of house for movies or TVCs at a high price. Thereby, things like safety concerns or antique value could be another reason for people to get interested in the past of their mansion.

There are many ways one can research their apartment or building. For instance, the internet and the elderly neighbours are the best sources to research the past of the building. In recent years, the internet has the data of old houses. Hence, one can collect information online. Additionally, elderly neighbours could play a significant role in this regard. They might have much detailed information which cannot be found on the web. 

To sum up, knowing the history of their own building makes people feel confident and special about their house. If people know about the time when it was built they can take the proper cautious approach. They can talk to local people and use internet platforms concerning facts.
evaluation:
### Task Achievement:
- The candidate has adequately addressed the given task by discussing the reasons why people are increasingly interested in discovering the history of their homes and providing methods for researching this.
- The response is generally clear and coherent, with a logical progression of ideas.
- However, the candidate has not fully covered all parts of the task. While they discuss the reasons for this interest, they do not provide specific examples or evidence to support their points. Additionally, they do not address how the internet and elderly neighbors can help people research the history of their homes in detail.

prompt:
Nations should spend more money on skills and vocational training for practical work, rather than on university education.

To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Many today feel that countries should prioritise vocational training over higher education due to changes in the labour market. In my opinion, though there are strong economic reasons to support this idea, university education holds greater value.

Those in favour of more practical skills training point out the financial benefits. Most university graduates are burdened with student debt and face uncertain job prospects. In contrast, training schools are cheap, fast, and ease students into steady employment immediately. The jobs they train for are also most likely recession-proof and durable, including positions as cooks, hotel managers, and skilled technicians. Someone who is firmly established in such a job in their early 20s does not have to deal with the pressure associated with university life and its incumbent debts. Instead, they can begin to set aside money for a house or start a family.

Nonetheless, lacking a university degree limit one's options. The jobs available will pay well initially and be secure, but offer narrow scope for advancement and virtually no opportunity to switch the career paths. An individual with a university degree, on the other hand, might begin from a lower position, but has a higher ceiling on future earnings. It is also possible for them to explore a variety of fields. Most good jobs require at least a bachelor’s degree even for simple internship vacancies. Lacking such a degree, means restricting oneself to manual labour or service industry jobs. The actual learning that takes place at university, particularly for those with multi skills majors or studying at liberal art schools, also encourages students to consider a wide range of possible career options.

In conclusion, increasing funding for vocational training is an attractive yet short sighted approach that curbs possibilities. Governments ought to continue to support higher education even in dark economic times in order to reap future rewards.
evaluation:
### Task Achievement:
- The candidate has directly addressed the prompt and provided a clear stance on the issue.
- The essay presents a coherent argument with supporting points and examples.

(should be "ease students into steady employment immediately") and the missing comma in "Lacking a university degree, on the other hand, might begin from a lower position, but has a higher ceiling on future earnings."

prompt: People think that government should increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles to solve environmental problems. Give your opinion.
essay: It is widely believed that one solution to environmental problems would be for governments to  raise the price of petrol. While I consider that this might be an effective measure, I would argue  that other measures might have an even greater impact.  If national authorities raised taxes on petrol, this would address two environmental issues. Firstly,  in terms of private cars, motorists would limit the number and length of their journeys to  compensate for the extra expense. Governments would then be forced to upgrade and expand  public transport provision, as people would still need to travel to work, to school or to travel to  shops and hospitals, for example. Secondly, from the perspective of freight services, more  goods would have to be transported by rail rather than by truck. Both these measures would cut  down on emissions from vehicles and help to reduce the greenhouse effect.  On the other hand, while this rise in fuel prices might be a useful stopgap measure, governments  could adopt transport policies which would be more effective in the long term. The local  authorities in London, for instance, introduced a congestion charge on all vehicles visiting the  city centre. They use the money raised to subsidize the cost of fares and to invest in transport  infrastructure. In turn, this has improved the air quality in the city, as a result of the reduction in  exhaust fumes. Another policy would be to introduce free bus and train passes, as the increased  use of public transport would reduce pollution from private cars and help in the effort to combat  global warming.  In conclusion, a sharp rise in petrol prices would be a useful environmentally-friendly transport  measure, although in the longer term other steps would be more effective.
evaluation:

- The response is well-organized and coherent, with a logical flow of ideas.

- The vocabulary is generally appropriate for the context of the essay.
- Suggested Band Score (Lexical Resource): 7

## Grammatical Range and Accuracy:

- There are some minor grammatical errors, such as "if national authorities raised taxes on petrol" (should be "if national authorities were to raise taxes on petrol") and "Governments would then be forced to upgrade and expand public transport provision" (could be improved by adding a comma after "Governments").
- The use of punctuation is generally accurate, and the sentences are well-formed.

prompt: It is important for all towns and cities to have large outdoor public spaces such as squared and parks. Do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay:
There is no denying the fact that  public spaces in towns and cities can be an arguable subject. While it is a commonly held belief that some individuals believe that outdoor public spaces it is important for towns and cities. there is also an argument that opposes it. In my opinion, I consider that  public spaces it is crucial because they can be used as venues for cultural events, and festivals.

To begin with, parks and squares can help  prompt community interaction like social hubs. In other words, it serves as a space where individuals from different backgrounds can interact, fostering a sense of community and belonging. In addition, it can assist in elevating the levels of health and well-being. For example,  it provides environments that encourage physical activity and relaxation, which are essential for maintaining mental and physical health.

Another point to consider, outdoor public spaces have an environmental benefit. It is also possible to say that, it helps  reduce urban heat islands, improve air quality, and provide habitats for local wildlife. Moreover, it can be used as a landmark for economic advantages. For instance, Well-maintained public spaces can boost local economies by attracting tourists and increasing the value of surrounding properties.

In conclusion, despite people having different views, I believe that I tend to believe that public spaces such as squared and parks it actually important for all towns and cities because they will help boost the economy and increase community interaction, I suggest that the government make programs that help in building beautiful public spaces.

In my opinion, children should learn paint and draw at an early age. Although some people believe that is important to study main subjects in school. And receiving creative thinking by knowledge in different fields that can be really an advantage in the future development of the children.

prompt: Restoration of old building in main cities involves enormous government expenditure. It would be more beneficial to spend this money to build new houses and roads. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Nowadays, the pressing need to provide shelter for the community is a mainstream issue being addressed by the government. However, the capital invested into construction renovation is huge compared with the cost of original housing development. I couldn’t have agreed more that this amount should rather be used for modern expansion alongside transportation routes. Analyzing the need for urbanization and the effect of construction retrofitting will justify it.

Firstly, more than half of the society's population lacks a home in developing countries thereby encouraging human habitation in slums, where they have always been exposed to environmental disasters such as floods, outbreaks of diseases, and insecurities. For instance, urban cities across the world have been experiencing congestion due to overcrowding. Hence, erecting lodges in areas that are yet to be developed will be more advantageous to society.

Secondly, of,course the approach of retrofitting as an alternative to building construction may be cheaper, particularly in the case of smaller projects. Yet, the risk attached to the processes involved could incur more costs. For example, the demolition of structural elements of the existing buildings, if not handled by experts could lead to vehement loss and even death, contrary to the budget. Thus restructuring of housing should best be considered as the last result of expanding housing.

In a nutshell, the government's record of a large amount for developing readymade houses as against contemporary homes and access roads, calls for the need to consider the option of investment with respect to project size and expertise.

Nowadays , youths are becoming more interested in finding about history has been a trend. Firstly , it gives them a curiosity to learn about the past house and building they live in. for instance, if they are living in a house , which is a heritage property of their descendants. Moreover , the old houses or buildings are not like the modern houses are like nowadays. To illustrate, old houses architectiol design and infrastructure is totally different from now generation. Secondly , to further study about how it has been built. For example , the stones and bricks used to make this house , where it has come from and who built this and duration to build this so on.

On the other hand , folks can find or research about this by asking from someone. For example, asking from grand parents or from their parents or especially could ask from their oldest neighbours. However , nowadays the technology has been developed , they could search in google about it as well. Moreover , past people they will have written about their history in a document or they have a ancient property such as written on a frame or in a stone , where the people have been storing it carefully. 

As I mentioned , people are becoming interested in finding history is a good habit and it will help them in forthcoming as well.

prompt: Some people think that one of the best ways to solve environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuels for cars and other vehicles. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement.
essay:
These days,there has been a heated argument about environmental pollutions from car exhaust.Some people believe that increase the fees on oils can solve this issue while there are others who do not think that. From my own point of view, I think it will help to sort out this problem.

   On the one hand, the fuels is one of the most reason lead to environmental problems and global warming , but the same time considered the main vital material all over the world.To clarify, without fuels the economic and the productivity for any countries will be very low . For example , Saudi Arabia of of the rich countries because they are used this in effective way , which are impact the most of our life .

  On the other hand, this does not mean that the negative side should be neglected.Firstly, the more vehicles in the street the more air pollution will be especially in the capital city .Take India as an instance, the last studies that conducted by the university of India have been shown that the cities with high population rate and traffic congestion more like to have these problems.As a result , there are a lot of neagative impact on the environment and on each individual ,such as global warming and some respiratory health disease.  

  

 

  To sum up , after analysing both sides of the argument it is not hard to see that the proper management and increase the fuels cost can declined the pollution and use other renewal alternatives such as bicycle and public transportation can helped.

prompt: Consumers are faced with increasing number of advertisements from competing companies. To what extent do you think consumers are influenced by advertisements? What measures can be taken to protect them?
essay:
The world is becoming a competitive place. Hence, to survive the competition, businesses come up with innovative advertisements. Although it should focus on the utility of the product, nowadays it contains harmful facts. This essay will discuss that how consumer behaviour is influenced by them as well as will also discuss possible ways out to overcome this that are mainly enablement of stricter acts and educating the people.

Firstly, the advertisements have an enormous impact on the way customer behaves. The colourful digital content frequently portrays beneficial usage of the product. Thus, without much ,knowledge humans believe them. For example, although the food of KFC is labelled as unhealthy by various countries, buyers do not pay much attention to such alerts. This is mainly due to the attractive story that their advertisement communicates. Henceforth, I believe that the public receives an erroneous message from them which influence their purchasing habits.

However, the introduction of proper regulatory laws, as well as spreading awareness in  society can solve the long-term problem. The government should set up a regulatory body that will monitor all of them before they are released for the citizens, as well as they should also check the content of it. Besides that, a mass education camp about numerous daily use commodities should be launched. These events should focus on educating the commoners on the utility of commonly used things. For instance,  paracetamol tablets, are available in the market with numerous brandings. Although the work of it is same, some of them are expensive. As we are not aware of the generic names; thus, we trust the advertisements and buy the costly ones. Moreover, if we watch the TV commercials of such companies, they are misleading. Henceforth, the authorities should investigate such cases, and ensure that the fallacious facts are not getting communicated through the mass media.

To conclude, in my opinion, humans are mesmerized by things that they see visually every day. Therefore, such visuals play a vital role in their shopping patterns. Hence, it is the responsibility of the governing bodies to administer advertisement and to protect the habitats of a country by teaching them, so that they do not fall into misleading traps.
evaluation:
## Task Achievement:
- The candidate has addressed the prompt by discussing the influence of advertisements on consumer behavior and proposing measures to protect consumers.
- The response is clear and coherent, presenting ideas in a logical order.
- The candidate has fully covered all parts of the task, providing relevant examples and support for their arguments.
- Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 8

- The vocabulary used is generally appropriate for the context.

prompt: Many people believe that the current system of both teachers and students in the classroom will no longer exist by the year 2050. To what extent do you agree with this opinion?
essay:
The current education system consists students, a teacher and a classroom. Many believe, that this system may not exist in future. The current idea of a teacher giving lectures to many student in a classroom may become obsolete. First of all we must understand the current education system we are talking about and why this system may face extinction. I do agree that we will see a lots of changes in education system in near future. However, I do not think that the entire system will be replaced by a new one. 
By the year 2050, there will be lots of inclusion in the field of technology. Due to these new inventions, our life will be easier. Technological advancement will also affect our education system. We may see digital classrooms in future, where physical presence of a teacher is no longer required. Instead of attending a lecture in a classroom, students can also study from home in front of their computers. In my opinion, future education system will not be location dependent. Nonetheless, the key members like students and teacher will be there. 
In conclusion, I think there will be a lots of changes in education system by the year 2050. I think those changes will bring a lot of positive aspects in the field of education.
evaluation:

prompt:
Some people believe that eventually all jobs will be done by artificially intelligent robots.

What is your opinion?
essay:
In today’s time, some people are of the opinion that almost all occupation will be replaced by artificial intelligent robots.  I am of the opinion that the profession which required no or less skills would be replaced by robots, but highly skilled jobs will still be done by humans.   

The work which are less skilled work will certainly be carried out by the robots.  Hiring a person for a menial job like security guard, parking ticket checker etc requires a lot of money for an employer.  So, it is highly likely they will deploy robots instead of humans which are cheaper and need less maintenance, due to this, the company profit will go up.  For example, in a manufacturing factory, there used to be a lot of workers and now all the work has been replaced by machines that was only one time investment.  As a result, the employers are making huge amount of profits.  
For this reason, unskilled jobs will be replaced by artificial intelligence.  

On the other hand, jobs that require professional expertise and special skills can never be replaced by artificial intelligence. For example, psychologists, teachers and doctors are profession which require human interaction, and expertise  cannot be replaced.  Those profession have taken hundreds of years to develop, hence are highly unlikely be replaced by the machines. Moreover, robots can do a work which is of repetitive nature, a task which requires logical thinking and application of knowledge will not be affected by them.  

In conclusion, in my opinion, the jobs which require special training cannot be replaced, on the other hand, laborious or low skilled work will eventually be done by the robots in the future.
evaluation:
## Task Achievement:
- The candidate has adequately addressed the given task by presenting an opinion on the topic of AI replacing jobs.
- The response is clear and coherent, with arguments presented in a logical order.
- The candidate has covered all parts of the task and provided relevant supporting points.
- Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 7

prompt:
Nowadays people use social media to keep in touch with others and be aware of news.
Do the advantages of this outweigh the disadvantages ?
essay:
Nowadays, there are numerous platforms available for social networking and to update themselves with the happenings around the world. In my opinion, they should use social sites to connect with different communities around them, but with caution. Further in my essay, I will pen down a few benefits of using social applications, followed by their disadvantages.

To begin with, the primary advantage of using social media is eliminating the communication barrier caused due to distance. Moreover, one can update himself with the latest news that has been trending around the world. Also, getting to know different people globally proves beneficial in exchanging knowledge and different thought process, which assists in widening the perspective. For instance, one of the employment-oriented online services helps connect people with similar interests and gives an insight into various skillsets used across the firms. This can bring like-minded groups closer.

On the contrary, the over abuse of social platforms can lead to loss of valuable time, which otherwise could have been used for productive work. Furthermore, lately, the cybercrime rate has increased tremendously in the past few years. For example, recently, a woman was robbed by a fake profile who claimed to be a bank official. Since the practice of such platforms does not come with identity verification, which means there are high chances of confronting fake profiles.

I believe that the advantages of using social media are more than its disadvantages because it helps exchange knowledge, and the only downside is its uncautious use.

In conclusion, if used cautiously, social media can help find like-minded people. Conversely, it can lead to a severe loss of time and money with continuous irrational use.
evaluation:
## Task Achievement:
- The candidate has adequately addressed the given task by discussing both the advantages and disadvantages of using social media.
- The response is clear and coherent, presenting ideas in a logical manner.
- However, the essay does not fully cover all parts of the task as it does not provide a clear conclusion summarizing the overall advantages and disadvantages.
- Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 6.5

## Coherence and Cohesion:
- The essay is well-organized, with clear paragraphs and topic sentences.
- Linking devices are used effectively to connect ideas and paragraphs, creating a smooth flow of information.
- The overall organization and structure of the essay are logical and easy to follow.
- Suggested Band Score (Coherence and Cohesion): 7.0

## Lexical Resource (Vocabulary):
- The candidate uses a range of vocabulary appropriate for the context.
- **However, there are a few inaccuracies or overuse of certain words:**
    - "eliminating the communication barrier" could be replaced with "bridging the communication gap"
    - "getting to know different people globally" could be replaced with "connecting with people from diverse cultures"
    - "proves beneficial in exchanging knowledge and different thought process" could be replaced with "facilitates knowledge sharing and cross-cultural understanding"
- Suggested Band Score (Lexical Resource): 6.5

## Grammatical Range and Accuracy:

- **There are a few grammatical errors:**
    - "Also, getting to know different people globally proves beneficial..." could be corrected to "Moreover, connecting with people from diverse cultures can be beneficial..."
    - "For instance, one of the employment-oriented online services helps connect people..." could be corrected to "For example, LinkedIn, an employment-oriented online platform, connects people..."

prompt: Parents should encourage children spend less time in studying and more in doing physical activities. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Some folk believe that parents should encourage children to do more physical exercise, even though this possibly means less time spent on studies. Considering the declining health of many students, I agree with this opinion.

This is because a formal legal degree requires students to pay a certain degree of era and energy to participate in various courses and pass various examinations. These are the embodiment of a student's abilities such as patience, persistence, knowledge, problem-solving ability, etc. Employers prefer to be more willing to employ employees by adopting the standardized means of "adopt discipline", or even offer promotion. In this case, people with academic qualifications are more likely to succeed in their careers.

But it does not automatically mean that academic qualifications can contribute to success in life every time. Education often means that a student can answer some questions, review lessons, and so on, but when it comes to problems in soul or problems between people, education can do nothing to be less functional in social interaction. Other people if he wants to succeed in a career, it's not enough to have a job.

 Most of the time, the friendship between family needs sincere integrity to maintain; Children's success needs a person's good quality, such as equality, justice, and politics, which are not directly related to education but can make people achieve success in different aspects of life.

Overall, doing physical activities is important to children’s health and if arranged properly, it can also facilitate children’s study.

- The response lacks clarity and coherence in presenting ideas, as it shifts from discussing the importance of education to the importance of physical activities without a clear transition.

prompt:
In some countries, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in.
What are the reasons for this?
How can people research this?
essay:
In some nations, the number of people interested in discovering related to the origins of the house or building they live in are becoming increased. There are two main causes, building safety and the value of building. possible means for researching are providing information from city planners and neighbors.

Perhaps the major factor is that they tend to know whether the building is safe or not. Simply put, if a long time has passed since a house was built, it is possible that the materials used in the house are outdated. Therefore, not only is this building unsafe but it also costs extra to renovation. Additionally, the more a building is old, the more has value. Thus, when purchasing an old building, people can acquire profit when selling it. 

Providing information from City planners and neighbors might be the most important way for people. Since information related to every building has been registered ۹ they live in because of they tend to have safe house and valuable building. City planners and neighbors are able to provide the information about the history of building.

In conclusion, people are reluctant about the origins of the building they live in because of they tend to have safe house and valuable building. City planners and neighbors are able to provide the information about the history of building.

prompt: studies show that many criminals have a low level of education. For this reason, some people believe that the best way to reduce crime is to educate people in prison so they could get a good job once they are released. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay:
A section of people holds a belief that the effective method to lessen the crime is to provide theeducation to the folks in prison, hence, it will be ultilitarian for them to get a job later. I completely agree that it is better that prisoners receive the education rather than letting them unemployed once they are out of prison.

Firstly, it is vital to the people in jail to receive a better education as they deserve to seize a second chance in the life. Therefore, this opportunity will give them a new hope to redeem their dark past in order to be more succesful people, as well as to mend some low minded society that people cannot be succeed provided that they have a criminal record. For instace, with proper exposure learning, these kinds of people may get a suitable job that suit with them, as some occupations still require their workforces.

Secondly, the provided education will ease the the prisoners to get a job placement. It is undeniale that is not easy employers to employ people who have criminal record, nontheless, with all the knowledges that they seize from that education are less likely able to open people eyes to hire them as a employee. Thus, this is a prominent parameter in assisting people to get a job that the authorities need to consider.

In conclusion, it is no doubt that employement rate can be mitigated among the ex-convicts. As a result, the benefits of providing education to the prisnoners outweight its drawbacks.

prompt: Some people think that museums should be enjoyable places to entertain people, while others believe that the purpose of museums is to educate. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
Museums are seen as a place with different functions, some people take it to be an entertainment option, while others believe museums are meant to be a schooling method. In my opinion, I do believe museums are places to educate oneself, with more enjoyable ways of learning comparable to just reading a book. 
However, various things like games, antiques and ancient stories may be found in museums, the main reason why they were invented was more likely to teach people about certain topics or interest according to the museum's content. For instance, teachers at schools may refer to these places for their students or even organise a visit to any of them as part of their classes, because museums can be seen as a significant place full of knowledge.
On the other hand, museums are thought to be an entertainment option many could choose to visit. Because of the variety of information and distinct manners used in the museums to display what they want the people to enjoy such masterpieces, antiques or games related to a historical moment; these places can also be entertained for some people. Therefore, tourists, for example, could decide to go visit a museum of a place they are travelling to, in order to learn more about the city or region in general, which will also be an entertainment option because they decide to do this activity as part of their vacation.
To conclude, personally I think that museums have both purposes: to educate and to entertain people, because there can be seen as a different type of schooling where people of all ages can visit to learn about a specific topic with materials that help completing the understanding and the knowledge learned, while having some fun.

prompt: Some people say that playing computer games is bad for children in every aspect. Others say playing computer games can have positive effects on the way children develop. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
While it is commonly believed that playing on technological devices is disadvantageous for children, other people insist that video games may help the development of children in many ways. In my opinion, I consider that playing computer games would be harmful to children. 

On the one hand, some people think that children who play computer games their characters will change for the worse, and I agree. In other words, most computer games encourage violent tendencies such as aggression, antisocial behaviour and recklessness. Definitely, all these make children get angry very easily with others, even for the most trivial things. This is because of the negative influence of electronic games. More and more playing on technological devices , especially in evil games, children's language tends to be violent. Furthermore, computer games take up much of children’s leisure time. To put it simply, many children have become addicted to electronic games, so they spend a lot of time on the computer uselessly. As a result, they neglect the essential things in their lives, such as study assignments, housework and other basics of life that they have to be keen on. 

On the other hand, it is claimed by some that children can have many educational benefits from computer games. For example, they help children develop problem-solving, motor skills, using muscles and analytical skills such as drawing conclusions, seeking alternatives and making predictions, so many children who have a dread of problems or who do not like to learn all of these concepts outside or in schools, they could learn them from technology programs and games by themselves. Another reason why computer games are useful is that computer games are designed to be entertaining for everyone. That is to say, most computer games offer a multiplayer function, inviting people to share their entertainment, so children of this age love to have a lot of fun, and they prefer this entertainment so as not to feel lonely or depressed. 

To sum up, while people may vary in their opinions, I think that plenty of computer games are harmful to young people. I suppose that we need to encourage children to reduce playing games in their life.

prompt: Some people think that the best way to become successful in life is to get a university education, whereas others say this is no longer true. Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.
essay:
Many people believe that getting a university education is the most essential key to becoming successful in life. However, the counterparts disagree with this idea and reckon it is no longer work at present. From my point of view, I would go with the latter view as I think a university admission is not all that people should give in their lives, but it is the effort in doing something that will lead them to what they want. In the following paragraphs, both of these views will be discussed in detail before the conclusion is reached.

On the one hand, it is true that most people in society prefer to enrol in a university. First of all, other than getting a degree certificate, they believe that a university is the best place for them to gain some skills and wisdom such as communication and management skills, and theoretical knowledge. Furthermore, they think that enrolling in a university would heighten up their educational backgrounds as well as have more opportunities to be hired in a better job position. To exemplify this, there was a piece of news reported that more than 70% of the employees working as managers in different types of companies have completed a bachelor or at least  4 years of university without taking a gap year. It can be said that the qualifications from universities lead to a better spot in society. Hence, they create a pathway to a successful life.

On the other hand, I reckon a university is not everything in humans' lives. It can not determine the values of humans nor the quality of life, especially whether a person will be achieving their life's goals or not. I would say that passion, effort, and experiences are what lead the public to success ,not a degree certificate.  Having a higher educational background does not mean a person will accomplish their goals. For instance, Wownam, one of the richest and successful entrepreneurs in Thailand. She was able to earn 100,000,000 baht from selling her own beauty products within the age of 20. Moreover, she did not attend a university but took those times to gain experiences in getting herself involved in a business until she decided to make her own brand, which is still the talk of the town today. Her brand impressed and at the same time amazed society as she has not taken any university's courses. Thus, having no high qualification from an educational institution does not mean a person will be facing a failure in life.

In conclusion, although there are numerous benefits in achieving academic degrees from universities, I would still say that the most crucial part of being successful is to give all our best in everything we do. This is why I opine that the advantages of having passion and inserting a lot of effort are clearly outweighed the benefits of having a university education.

prompt: Nowadays, more and more people decide to have children later in their life. What do you think are the reasons for this? Do advantages of this trend outweigh disadvantages
essay:
The trend of people deciding to have kids late is increasing. The reason for this surge could be that people want to follow their dreams. I believe that it is not beneficial to have children late as it creates health issues. This essay will discuss the possible reasons for the rise of this trend  and will highlight the negatives of having kids later in life.

Young people nowadays want to be carefree  and would want to enjoy their lives to the fullest. They live by the ideology you live only once, so live your life to the fullest, and they want to chase and achieve their dreams. For instance, a person who dreams to tour all the countries wouldn't want to settle down to have a kid until he achieves his dream. So youngsters want to follow their dreams and they don't want the duties of raising a kid till they accomplish their goals in life.

On the one hand, having babies late in  life can lead to health issues for  mothers and infants. To illustrate, studies show that women above the age of '40s do not have all the essential nutrients at the recommended level compared to women in '20s, for instance, the calcium level in women starts to decrease, and other essential hormones which are responsible for producing milk after the delivery gets affected. As a result, the well-being of the newborn is affected. However, there are some positives to having children late, as it helps parents to settle in life. For example, young parents would get an opportunity to pay off their outstanding loans that they would have taken for education. Although, having a baby later in life has some advantages, but the disadvantages outweigh as it affects the fitness of both parent and the newborn.

To sum up, it is observed that young people nowadays want to follow their dreams and would wanna achieve it before having kids which led to the increase in the trend of people having kids late in life, but having kids late in life has a direct impact on the health of babies and mother. However, there are some pros of having kids late, but the cons are more than the pros.

prompt: Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Certain individuals expect the youngsters to be engaged in more charity work without being paid as it would be constructive to the youth and the society equally. Additionally, recently conducted surveys have suggested aiding the community without expecting any in return has a significant impact over the maturity of the adolescents. Thus, I stand as a strong advocate of this concept, and the benefits of it will be covered in this essay. 

A fundamental reason for this is there is no biological age for lending a hand to others to establish a better neighborhood. Hence, the teenagers can play a vital role in enhancing the concept of an amiable lively hood is the key to united society. If these adolescents keep spending their leisure time cleaning the surrounding of their respective areas, it will send a message to the whole community of the need of a clean environment, which would eventually be engraved in the mind of the people. For example, in many parts of Sri Lanka the youth has established several clubs to serve the community in their spare time which has eventually got the attention of the elders as well.

Furthermore, a major benefit received through the volunteering is the skill the adolescents acquire: time management. One of the vital issues often arise by the employers is the inadequacy of the interviewees, employees to tackle time effectively. When the child is exposed to serve the community at a young age, he/she would learn to manage his/her time efficiently which would indirectly have a pragmatic effect on balance of life while relieving the parents of the burden of worrying of their young children. A survey conducted by a group of undergraduates highlight that the students who were engaged in various community projects have the highest potential of securing a career position even before they graduate. 

Despite being a supporter of this non-paid voluntary work, I strongly recommend incorporation of a mechanism to appreciate these services of the youth would encourage the next in line to be a part of these types of services.

prompt: Many countries spend large amounts of money on preparing competitors in major world sporting events such as the Olympic Games and football World Cup. Instead, this money can be spent on encouraging children to take up sports at a young age. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
In this day and age, several countries invest a huge amount of money in athletes joining sporting events such as the Olympics or World Cup. However, it is believed by some that this amount of money should be diverted to encouraging children to take up sports. It is my firm belief that the government should allocate funds to both.

On the one hand, there are several merits of investing in athletes taking part in sporting events. To begin with, when the performances of the athletes are outstanding, numerous visitors might come to the host country of the event in order to watch those participants. As a result, the host country can earn a large amount of profit thanks to tourism. Moreover, the country’s image can be promoted due to the fame of these accomplished sports players. For example, there are lots of people who know about Korea and Japan because these 2 countries organized the World Cup in 2002, a sports event in which there were many well-known sportspeople. 

On the other hand, I personally believe that it is also practical to spend money on promoting children to practice sports. First, playing a sport may help children to improve their health, both mentally and physically. After spending long hours at school, children might be under a great amount of stress. However, they can opt for a sport as a hobby in order to relax and this might help improve their mental health. Also, by playing a sport for a long time, their health can be significantly enhanced. Second, it can be easier for children to make lots of friends when playing sports. As a result, this may help them to become more outgoing and more confident because they will have several chances to communicate with others. 

In conclusion, although some think that the authorities should invest in encouraging the young generation to take up sports instead of using a large amount of money for athletes, it is my firm belief that the government should spend on both sides.

prompt: Parents should encourage children to spend less time studying and more time doing physical activities. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
It is often argued that parents should urge their offspring to allocate more time for practicing sports rather than studying. In my opinion, I would completely disagree with this statement because physical activities might distract them from their school's homeworks althought it would improve their fitness. 

It is believed that playing sports has significantly contributed to the wellbeing of children. This is because a physical exercise could help students to move their bodies and burn all the colories that were gained from eating fast foods. Playing sport games, such as football, basketball, and swimming could stimulate children to follow more active lifestyle, and therefore it would lower their stress levels coming from school as well as enhancing their motor skills.

However, I would go against this perspective because spending more time in physical practices would negatively affect their academic performance at school. This is because when children get fully immersed in certain type of sports, it would immediately become more difficult for them to concentrate on studying as well as understanding their teacher's explaination. For instance, many football players have failed to finish their education because their parents were supporting them to focus more in practicing rather than successding in their exams. This would result in establishing a successful career or life in the long run as they will not have the necessary skills and education. 

To sum up, although it might seem sensible to motivate children to spend more time in playing sports than compeleting their school assignments because it would heighten their fitness, it would impede their intellectual and cognitive development that are important for their future lifestyle.

prompt: Some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to a successful career, while others believe that it is better to get a job straight after school. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
When they finish academy, teenagers face the dilemma of whether to get a job or continue their education. While there are some benefits to getting a profession straight after school, I would argue that it is better to go to college or university. 

The option to start work straight after university is attractive for several reasons. Many young people want to start earning money as soon as possible. In this way, they can become independent, and they will be able to afford their own house or start a family. In terms of their career, young people who decide to find work, rather than continue their studies, may progress more quickly. They will have the chance to gain real experience and learn practical skills related to their chosen profession. This may lead to promotions and a successful career. 

On the other hand, I believe that it is more beneficial for students to continue their studies. Firstly, academic qualifications are required in many professions. For example, it is impossible to become a doctor, teacher or lawyer without having the relevant degree. As a result, university graduates have access to more and better position opportunities, and they tend to earn higher salaries than those with fewer qualifications. Secondly, the work market is becoming increasingly competitive, and sometimes there are hundreds of applicants for one position in a company. Young people who do not have qualifications from an educational institution or college will not be able to compete. 

For the reasons mentioned above, it seems to me that students are more likely to be successful in their careers if they continue their studies beyond academy level.

prompt:
It is generally observed that almost all high level jobs are done by men.
Does it mean that the government should encourage a certain percentage of these jobs to be reserved for women?
Do you agree or disagree with this proposition?
essay:
In the present world men are doing high level jobs. Women also should be equally empowered to do the same level of high performing jobs. 

The possible reasons preventing the women from doing high performing jobs are lack of motivation, interest, stereotypical society, lack of support from the family and improper education. By considering all these scenarios,some nation's  are trying to lure women into high paying jobs by providing incentives such as free travel, financial support for education, maternity leaves and giving reservation in some sectors exclusively for women. Also, it's the responsibility of the family and society to assist women to empower them. 

One more thing frightens women  for the jobs is harassment at work places. As per the study by the university of Columbia companies where there are stringent laws against gender inequality and sexual harassment,there is more contribution of women in the success of the companies. It's a proven fact that nations whose women is educated and empowered are thriving more than their counterparts. If we provide the workplace a safe place for women then there will be more enrolments of female employees. The Government  should also take precautionary measures such as making awareness in men about the gender equality, free education for girls at least until high level etc. Proper counselling should be provided for the poor women in the society about the opportunities they have and the efforts taken by the government to support women not only in jobs but also in all areas which makes women stand equal to men.

The conclusion is the government  must back the women in getting high paying jobs by giving reservations and also provide a safe work environment.

prompt: Nowadays machines have become more sophisticated due to which more and more jobs and tasks which involve high physical work are being done by machines. What do you think this development has negative or positive effects.
essay:
In these days, machines seem to become more sophisticated by leading an increase in works and assignments, which include high physical work, are being done by automated machines. 

To start with, one implication of the challenge could be pointed out as following remarkable shifts in technology tendencies, the circumstances in which automated machines do specific manual jobs of workers seems to have become more widespread. It considerably increases the free time of workers, so they can have more attention to their private lives. Since the majority of machines in Alaman company have automated, the work time spent by workers in the office is considerably decreased, and as a result, they have more space in life for their family and friends. Thus, hardly anybody can refuse to accept that it is exceptionally challenging to underestimate this.

However, some experts who believe that automated machines have increased the rate of unemployment could consider the situation worrisome. Highlighting the argument, it could be said that the implementation of advanced machines have decreased the amount of manual work, and as a consequence, the rate of job seekers has risen. It has a detrimental effect on the economy of a country. If the government did not act soon, the unemployment rate would cause poverty and economic collapse. Nevertheless, it is essential to weigh all the facets of every particular situation. 

To sum up, the latter judgement is more convincing, since this is backed up by my own experience, for I am an ex-worker who experienced layoff due to the implementation of machines.

prompt: Some people say that economic growth is the only way to end hunger and poverty, while others say that economic growth is damaging the environment so it must be stopped. Discuss both views and give your opinion
essay:
While few individuals have arguably put forward the statement that economic broadening is the only solution to put a halt to hunger and penury. Although, another group suggest that this growth will have a negative impact on the environment. The following essay will decipher both the viewpoints of this argument and outline my opinion.

On one hand, A country's gross domestic product (GDP), since it is linked with the economic widening, if improved, can lead to a decline in famine and poverty. Although a lot of factors contribute to the economic success of a country for example, if a person gets a quality education, it will lead to the self-advancement of that individual which in turn can be aligned towards the developing the economy by creating value through productivity like manufacturing and sale goods, services, etc. As a result ,this  will lead to a better standard of living for an individual and increased purchasing power which in turn saves he/her from sufferings like poverty.

On the other Flank, adverse effects can be reflected by economic development. for instance, in a recent ,study it was highlighted that due to increased purchasing power and living, a vast majority of people have occupied a lot of land, food, etc. which in turn creates a depletion of resources.furthermore because of the rapid growth, companies that have shared this growth have started deteriorating  nature through the release of harmful gases and pollutants from big industrial factories. this all makes the government officials as well the general public  rethink  the economic widening.

Having discussed the dichotomy, what I opine is that economic development is essential. As if an economy improves a lot of suffering can be mitigated. Although there are few worse effects that give a  bad reputation for this growth,  still it leads a country towards innovation.

To sum up, it can be rightly reiterated that economic growth is vital even though the demerits of this exist it should be considered equally and improving the lives of individuals will lead to prosperity and happiness instead of starvation.

prompt: Many people think modern communication technology is having some negative effects on social relationships. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay:
It is argued that technological advancements in the field of conversation have adversely affected one's personal and professional relationships. Personally, I strongly disagree with this view.

As new ways of communicating with one another, such as mobile phones and social networks, are introduced, some fear that people might become socially isolated. Their rationale is that these technologies, which promote communication in virtual reality, have marginalized physical interaction and thus may potentially fracture concrete relationships. However, this claim is largely exaggerated. In reality, virtual interaction augments social relationships rather than undermines them. For example, most Facebook users talk to friends and colleagues both through the social network and in person. The extra features that Facebook provides like instant messaging and video calling do not substitute for having a conversation in real life, but merely help us stay connected over long distances.

I am convinced there is further evidence to suggest that innovations in communication exist not to the detriment of social relationships, but rather to their benefit. Not only do they address the question of distance as demonstrated above, these tools also help us to expand our social circles. For instance, online food forums connect people who share a passion for culinary arts, while photo-sharing applications like Instalgram can bring together a group of individuals who have the same taste in fashion. These examples are a testament to how technology establishes communities and promotes interaction among people.

In conclusion, there are sufficient grounds to reject the view that social relationships might be jeopardized by the advent of advanced communication technologies. It is my genuine belief that as technology improves going forward, so will people's social experience.

Both skills are important to work in an organzation but in my opinion, social skills are most useful in an organisation.

To begin with, academic skills are nowadays limited to books and theories whereas social skills make a person better in their life. Organisations in today's world work in the shape of projects where the social skills of their employees are needed. prompt: Some people think that technology makes life complex, so we should make our life simpler without using technology. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
In today’s world, it is believed by a part of the population that the complexity that technology brings is unnecessary and we should simplify our life by getting rid of them. This essay disagrees with this claim because technology has brought us convenience more than anything else and it is impossible to imagine our life without them.

100 years ago, life was indeed so much simpler than today. However, without the help of technology; transportation, communication, and many more services were extremely poor and hard to access. So no one can deny that technology has revolutionized all those basic aspects; now we can travel to the other side of the world with just a few hours, see and talk to each other with just a few clicks. It is true that technology can somewhat turn our life just a bit more complicated, although in the end, it also makes our daily basics simpler yet much more efficient than ever before.

Moreover, life without wonderful machinery no doubt is challenging as human has already got familiar with using them every single day. If we wipe out everyday object like smartphone, laptop, car, and bullet train, the economy would collasp within a few days due to the fact that a huge number of jobs are currently relying on those machine.

For instance, no sooner had the first mobile phone were born than companies and factories started to rise. This gave millions of citizen an opportunity to have a job and put their life standard higher than before.

To conclude, it is safe to say that there is no point in making life simpler by throwing away technology and we should thank them for giving us numerous of merits in the first place.

essay:
In recent years, the concept of the phenomenon has become widespread, referring to people who have become famous for their lifestyle. Sometimes the youth try to pretend to be like them. To my mind, it may have several negative consequences.

It is a simple supply-demand pattern, in which they try to provide the audience with something more required. Unfortunately, youngsters prefer glamorous celebrities instead of talented ones. Those who come to the agenda with their scandalous and rich lives are in the spotlight. For example, the Kardashian family has not any specific achievements; however, for a showy lifestyle, they have a huge following. They make unnecessary expenses and take part in meaningless events. This could be a bad example for teenagers who take them as role models. When the life they want is not offered, they can become depressed and, worse, rebel against their families or can behave inappropriately. 

In fact, some celebrities are often found in smoking advertisements, charged with drugs and other criminal activities. A young person who chooses this kind of famous person as an idol will be able to damage their health. Another example can be the impact of a particular celebrity's bad roles in films or series. For instance, Sanjay Dutt, Bollywood Actor is well known for his money and roles as a villain, his terrorist acts in different movies have given rise to violence and crime in the streets of Mumbai, all these were committed by adolescents for thrill and adventure.

In brief, because of the information age, children and adolescents are informed by watching TV, using social networks, and can follow celebrities on these platforms as their role models. If the younger generation is not properly guided, such things can have bad effects on them.

prompt: Many people believe that the current system of both teachers and students in the classroom will no longer exist by the year 2050. To what extent do you agree with this opinion?
essay:
Education plays a vital role in the life of students as well as teachers. A recent rise in the online learning has resulted in a system where the dynamics of student's and teacher's working are drastically changed. This essay will discuss these changing trends between the two with the evolution of technology.

In recent times, people prefer to study online. With the advancement in technology many people are opting for online studies rather than going to classrooms, since it is more effective and convenient.  For instance, they can simply login to websites and study without leaving their homes and to understand the topic better they can repeat the lectures on the laptop. A recent study has shown that online learning is nearly 20 percentage more effective than attending classrooms.

Although there are many aspects in which the online learning precedes the classrooms, there are some aspects of on campus studying that can never be replaced by online studies. Firstly, some subjects requires performing practical examinations, which can never be done via internet. To exemplify, subjects in science, namely, physics and chemistry require students to perform experiments in labs. Secondly, some subjects require people's interactions as a part of the subject which cannot be achieved through online education. For instance, subjects such as mass communication require students to interact with people in person.

To summarise, there are many aspects of current campus based education that will be replaced by online learning in the future. This essay discussed despite the major studying paradigm will move towards online education, some aspects of campus based learning is irreplaceable.

prompt: Some people think that in the modern world we are more dependent on each other, while others think that people have become more independent. Discuss both views and give your own opinion
essay:
In today's world, People have different views about whether we are more or less dependent on others. In my view, modern life forces us to be more independent than people were in the past.

There are two main reasons why it could be argued that we are more dependent on each other now. Firstly, life is more complex and difficult, especially because the cost of living has increased so dramatically. For example, young adults tend to rely on their parents for help when buying a house. Property prices are higher than ever, and without ,help it would be impossible for many people to pay a deposit and a mortgage. Secondly, people seem to be more ambitious nowadays, and they want a better quality of life for their families. This means that both parents usually need to work full-time, and they depend on support from grandparents and babysitters for child care.

However, I would agree with those who believe that people are more independent these days. In most countries, families are becoming smaller and more dispersed, which means that people cannot count on relatives as much as they used to. We also have more freedom to travel and live far away from our hometowns. For example, many students choose to study abroad instead of going to their local university, and this experience makes them more independent as they learn to live alone. Another factor in this growing independence is technology, which allows us to work alone and from any part of the world.

In conclusion, while there are some reasons to believe that people now depend on each other more, my own view is that we are more independent than ever.
evaluation:
