prompt:
Some believe that younger family members should be legally responsible for supporting older family members when they become physically, mentally and financially unable to look after themselves.

Do you agree or disagree?
essay:
some people contend that it should be a law for younger individuals to take the responsibility of taking care of their own older members in their twilight years when they have disabilities in terms of physical, mental and financial. I completely disagree with this notion. This essay puts this notion into debate and assesses its aspects.

It is undeniable that many offspring are not the best choice for taking care of the older generation. In other words, some individuals are not aware of their supporting duties, in consequence, they could cause a lot of problems in the process of caring. For example, supporting an old person in terms of physically and mentally is a daunting task and it needs people who are professionals in these fields such as doctors, nurses, and therapists to support and enhance the level of the old people's lifestyle. Hence, this approach as a law would not work efficiently and may cause many issues for both young members and old individuals. 

In addition, some people contend to participate with younger family members when older members of their family have financial inabilities. However, due to low salaries and cost of living, some family members are unable to have big investments to look after their old members in case of emergency. For instance, having a cooperative program between authorities and professionals with sufficient knowledge would make it much easier for the country in place of demand help from young members, provide residential areas for supporting older generations in many terms and support them financially. Thus, the responsibility of young members as law would not help older people to tackle problems of their disabilities in their twilight years.

In conclusion, due to many struggles that young members could have such as lack of awareness of their duties and financial instability, I strongly disagree with this statement.

prompt:
More people decide to have children in their later age than in the past. Why?
Do advantages of this outweigh disadvantages?
essay:
With the progression of the society, many people do their family planning in their thirties rather than twenties which was common a decade ago. This essay will discuss positives and drawbacks of this trend and which outweighs the other.

As people have turned extremely ambitious these days, they prefer achieving their goals and indulge into starting a family later. This priority shift not only help them focus and earn huge amount of money to make them self sufficient, but it also helps to financially support the future generation in a better way. For instance, financially independent parents are able to provide a better lifestyle for their children than those who are unstable in their careers.

On the contrary, ageing brings vulnerability of severe health issues in a person's life. By the same token, pregnancy becomes complicated at the later stage, both for a man and a woman. A recent research concluded that, the probability of conceiving in couples is reduced by 23% after they touch their thirties and can further be declined up to 53% over the age of thirty five. Secondly, individuals do not remain fit enough to support their children, if the age gap between the parents and child is big. For example, if a child is born when a man is forty five, his child would be only twenty and not financially independent at the man's retirement age. Hence, the family might need extra financial aids to support the children.

In conclusion, they are few advantages to starting a family late such as a child can be provided better financial aid to support his life, the disadvantages are more and it outweighs the advantages as the complications in conceiving can increase with a person's age and the generation gap between progenitors and their children is huge which can become a major issue in future.
evaluation:

- The candidate has adequately addressed the task by discussing both the advantages and disadvantages of having children later in life.
- The response is clear and coherent, presenting ideas in a logical order.
- The candidate has covered all parts of the task and provided support for their arguments.

(should be "This priority shift not only helps them focus and earn a huge amount of money...") and "the probability of conceiving in couples is reduced by 23% after they touch their thirties..." (should be "the probability of conceiving in couples reduces by 23% after they reach their thirties...").

prompt: Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
There is a growing belief among some individuals that teenagers should be obliged to participate in unpaid community work during their leisure time. While this may have some advantages for both teenagers and the community, I believe that it should not be mandatory.

On the one hand, the proponents of mandatory community work argue that it can provide several benefits for teenagers. Firstly, it can help them develop a sense of responsibility and belonging towards their community. Secondly, it can expose them to various social issues and challenges, which can enhance their awareness and understanding of the world around them. Finally, it can provide them with opportunities to acquire new skills and experiences that may be beneficial for their personal and professional growth.

Furthermore, mandatory community work can also have several positive impacts on the community. For instance, it can address various local issues such as littering, environmental degradation, and poverty. Additionally, it can promote social cohesion and encourage people to work together towards common goals.

However, I believe that teenagers should not be compelled to do community work, as this may have some negative consequences. Firstly, it may lead to resentment and resistance among teenagers, who may view it as a form of forced labor. Secondly, it may undermine the voluntary spirit of community work, which is based on the principle of free will and altruism. Finally, it may divert teenagers' attention and time away from their studies, hobbies, and other interests, which are equally important for their development.

In conclusion, while mandatory community work may have some potential benefits for teenagers and the community, I believe that it should not be imposed on teenagers. Instead, they should be encouraged and motivated to participate in community work voluntarily, based on their interests and aspirations.
evaluation:
## Task Achievement:
- The candidate has adequately addressed the given task by discussing both the potential benefits and drawbacks of mandatory community work for teenagers and the community.
- The response is clear and coherent, with ideas presented in a logical manner.

prompt: Some people think that museums should be enjoyable places to entertain people, while others believe that the purpose of museums is to educate. Discuss both views and give you own opinion.
essay:
There has been a difference of opinion regarding the final purpose of museums, while some believe that these kinds of places should be only informational, I would argue that can be both entertaining and educational. 
On the one hand, museums naturally are historical places due to the quantity of cultural heritage contained. In this way, exhibitions showing ancient components and the remains may be a great way to learn about the history of different cultures. In fact, in most of the antique representations are shown aspects about the life and customs of our ancestors. Also, most people visit these institutions in order to receive a further knowledge. For example, the majority of museums include a guide who is in charge of the tour. This person, can even give response of any particular curiosity surged. 
On the other hand, it is an important factor of museums the role of being enjoyable. Such historical institutions are principal tourist attractions, foreign people often have limited time. Because of that, is relevant the development of special methods, which sum all the data in an attractive form. For example, in many countries they offer audio visual systems in order to turn the tour into more dynamic. The average visitor may become bored if they have to read a lot of educational content, especially school students or younger citizens. Because of that, the museum is designed to be visually spectacular, and may have interactive activities as part of its exhibitions. 
By way of conclusion, I believe that educational and enjoyable experience cannot be brought into comparison to see which is more relevant because they have complementary equal meaning to those historical points.

prompt:
Some people believe that time spent on television, video and computer games can be beneficial to children. Others believe this has negative effects on a child. 

Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
There is currently a contentious argument whether electronic devices are should be considered as a benefit to  youth or not. In this essay, I will examine both sides and then explain why I believe how these equipment are good for children's' development.

Admittedly, electronic devices can be detrimental. The main reason for that is because it can lead children to isolation. It is known that electronic devices can turn children addicted to it since because it provides a delightful satisfaction. Therefore, if parents do not nourish their children and discipline them they will not be able to tighten relationships with real friends which can be harmful in the future. For example, children tend to leave school and run home in order to enjoy playing at home instead of play with real colleagues at school and this behaviour can be extended to adult life.

Although the reason aforementioned, electronic devices can far bring benefits to children. Mainly, these equipment help youngers in develop their focus. Mainly, when they are coping with electronics such as videos, games and suchlike they already have disconnected from the world and get concentration only to these devices while relaxing at the same time. For instance, when people are watching movies or spending some time in front of a computer they are relaxing due to the fact that they are able to forget about life problems when paying attention these activities; thus, they are increasing their focus. 

In conclusion, despite the fact that electronics can be harmful by turning children more isolated, I believe that the benefits that come up such as raising focus at the same time that they are relaxing for a couple of hours.

prompt:

What are the reasons for this? How can people research this?

Some families have their own houses while some others rent them. However, living somewhere whether it’s a house or an apartment is a vital question and in several countries, the number of people who are keen on finding out about the history of their residence increases because of the aura the houses carry in themselves.

 All places have their unique specifics due to the humans who reside there. Because people who inhabit somewhere always leave their energy and vibes. So it’s very important to find out who lived there before. Besides, discovering the past of the areas will enable us to know what kind of changes had happened to them. This information will help them to understand the creativity of the possessor and what other changes need to be made.

 In terms of families, who built their own houses or inherited them it’s rather easy. They know their ancestors and can find some information connected to them via archives or stories told. When it comes to purchasing a dwelling, studying what kind of family were the owners of the house is possible mostly due to speaking to them and asking some questions.

To sum up, we came to the conclusion that nowadays many people pay close attention to the history of the place they live in for folks who were settled there leave their vibes. And the easiest way to find out about the past is by trying to discover by talking to the people to whom the building belonged if possible, and if not, finding appropriate data due to archives.

The current generation of famous personalities are known more for their attractive lifestyle and less for hardwork which I believe is misleading the youngsters. I will explain in this essay how the focus on extravagant lifestyle of a celebrity instead of focusing on their work can leave a wrong impression on the youth.

 Firstly, the living style adapted by the well known people sets unrealistic goals and standards for an average person. Moreover, the importance is given to the looks and style of clothes rather than the succesful art which also results in people spending unnecessary money on expensive beauty and health products. The youngsters try to look like these stars by using overpriced materialistic things and hence, loose their focus on studies and their career. There are multiple online websites that sells the exact clothes used by the celebrities with an astonishing price range. With such standards a young person gets influenced easily and lead a misguided life.

 Secondly, the overshow of the luxurious way of life of a famous personality leads the people to beleive that the hardwork is the least imprortant part of their success. Their talent and artistic work is overshadowed by their media presence. As we all know, the social media has been an intimate medium to get an access to a celebrities life which is mostly deceiving. Although, the purpose of these stars is to motivate people but they end up leaving a bad example of putting the glam above the job.

In conclusion, I fully agree that by putting the excess expenditure of money and a luxurious lifestyle as the centre of attention, the famous people are misguiding our present youth.

prompt: Some people think that competitive sports have positive effects on teenager education, while others argue that effect is negative.  Discuss both view and give your opinion.
essay:
Nobody would dispute the fact that all teenagers need to have a healthy life by doing sports.But some people think that youngsters should not play competitive game because it can harm them.While others think that competitive sport such as football has a positive effect on children.I reckon that all teenagers should do sports and sometimes they can play competitively.In this essay,I will discuss both opinions and give a relevant opinion.

On the one hand,I believe that such sport as football or basketball have a lot of advantages.To be honest, it can be really hard to play in the team and you can have a misconception about your team players.But if you learn how to work in a group and have  good communication and mutual understanding skills it might help you in future.I reckon that people will use these skills in their future work.For example, ,usually employees need to do projects in big groups.Moreover, rival games can be more entertaining and more interesting than playing alone.

On the other hand, rival game have a negative effect on children.Generally, competitive games end with anger from the ones who loses which can lead to fighting.In my childhood, I used to cry after I lost the game and it could somehow affect my nervous system because after playing I always was embarrassed and stressed.

To sum up, competitive spots are very useful and we can learn a lot from them but  we should teach youngsters how to adjust to the loss and do not show anger.Also, I think that schools should let play rival sport from a certain year of birth.

On the one hand, it can be argued that the main role of museums should be entertained. The reason why for this is that museums usually collect a variety of exhibitions that attract considerable tourists who want to see these objects.  And then, if museums only give visitors the dull data, such as figures, texts and the others to introduce these exhibits, people will become tired and bored quickly. As a result, they may not be interested in museums any more. That is why currently some museums provide some enjoyable facilities such as toys, VR glasses and 3D movies to improve museums' entertaining in order to increase their attraction. 

On the other hand, some people think that museums should be a place where visitors learn knowledge. Generally, the data that is given by museums about the exhibits is accurate and objective, so it is easy for guests to get information from through these exhibits and the information is reliable. A good example of this is that foreign tourists who want to study or to understand the local knowledge about history, culture and technology usually go to the national museum. Therefore, the educational role of museums should not be ignored.   

In conclusion, there are convincing arguments about the museums' functionality. In my view, museums should be both enjoyable and educational.

Financial support is one of the important needs for graduates and postgraduates in other to fulfil their research. However, some people claim that the government should only financially support  scientific research rather than other subjects . In my ,opinion I totally  agree with the statement because science contributes to the evolution of the world . 

To begin, the science industry requires a lot of attention and financial support because they are the most important cooperation in the world .Furthermore, they contribute to the survival of species and the well being of humans as well as animals . For instance , in the year ,2020 the whole world faced the COVID-19 pandemic which had an impact on the nation. Each country,especially  Europe had to financially support the scientist to supply a vaccine. This actually helps them to provide us in this year 2021 with a different type of  vaccine that is helping the community to fight against the virus.

In addition, investing in postgraduate scientists is supporting the medical and technology research department for a better and easier future way of life . This is the best way for the government to improve the science industries to fight against future problems and also upgrade our life . For example, our way of communicating has been boosted for the past 10 years with the support of science. We can be connected at all times, working from a long distance and also been in touch with one family at every moment of the day . Thus , it is much easier to communicate and facilitate our conversation.

In conclusion,the government should invest more in scientists because the earth depends on their research to enhance the upcoming events that can affect negatively one life. And also,their contribution to technology can make our living environment a better place as well as contributing to the evolution of the nation.

Firstly, working straight after graduation is beneficial for several reasons, in another word, young people will be able to start earning money as soon as they finish their studies, they can be matured early than their same age people and start to learn live independently. Moreover, they will have real experience and skills in working which is can benefit their survivor life.

 On the other hand, people think continuing their studies to college or university is an advantage to have a better opportunity for their future career and improved their knowledge since some courses of study are not learned in high school, for instance, education to be a doctor or engineer. To sum up, there are several benefits for both in future, studies or going to work depending on what the people planning for the foreseeable future.

Discuss both views and give your opinion

On the one hand, many people think that art is a crucial course at schools  for various reasons.Although it is an extra effort apart from regular courses, individuals believe the future is bright for the employees in these fields since the salaries are high.For example, citizens who are good at theatre arts can get an opportunity to work in Hollywood films where the remunerations are high. Secondly, people specialized in certain artwork will become familiar personalities in the world.This will bring them huge name and fame which will remain even they are not alive.For instance,  famous books such as Shakesphere novels will remain in people's heart forever.

On the other side, some people think that art is a waste of time which is spoiling student's future.Despite there are few people who are successful in many arts, the ratio is relatively very less. To illustrate, though photography is a creative skill, very few people will become successful.Moreover, students believed in particular art and ignored their academics will regret that they have wasted a lot of time if they are unsuccessful.To give a clear example, pupils who ignored studies and concentrated only in skills will become unemployed since the success rate is very low in these creative skills. 

To conclude, this essay has discussed whether art is an important subject for students or it is a waste of time.In my opinion, though there are certain drawbacks, art is an essential subject for students at school.

prompt:
The best way to reduce poverty in developing countries is by giving up to six years of free education, so that they can at least read, write and use numbers.


To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
It is often argued that primary schooling should be complimentary in underdeveloped nations to make the children able for writing, reading and basic mathematics. This essay agrees with this statement because this is not only an initiative to bring impoverished kids into school but would also improve the literacy rate of the underdeveloped nations in long run.

To embark on, majority of people in developing countries cannot reach to the door of schools because they don’t have enough resources and capital to afford it. This decision of free schooling up to six years would encourage them to learn fundamental skills and knowledge. Consequently, people can use that basic education such as simple calculations, language writing to find out job opportunities for the survival of their family. Besides this, educational administrators should consider providing complimentary bags and one meal to reduce the extra burden on pupils. For instance, Indian government has been providing mid day meal in schools since 1995 irrespective of any caste, creed or religion. This policy has brought millions of poor children into public educational institutions. Hence, this scheme could motivate the humankind to take the advantage of educational resources which can direct them to job market.
Additionally, this proposal could turn into a great investment in escalating the level of literacy rate. To elucidate, many people in the third- world economies have been struggling to obtain livelihood and would never think to go in the school. This policy could provide a great opportunity to influence everyone for starting up a new life. Furthermore, the likelihood of continuing studies after six years would be more because many students will develop their interest and thinking to pursue higher education and enter job market. According to the article of India news, the illiteracy index has been reduced to 20% as compared to 44 % in India, after the introduction of free education program. It proves that complimentary primary schooling has raised the level of education which further open the new gate of jobs for literate individuals.

To sum up, complimentary education could act as blessing for disadvantaged people and their native country because it would not only develop the mindset and abilities of a child but would also help backward economies to educate a large number of masses.

In the modern society, it is encouraged that young people should develop the enterprenership mindset and building up their own enterprises. It is clear to me that the more money the bussiness makes the more responsibilities to the society it should contribute to. 

Firstly, it is absolutely no deny that businesses play a very important role in creating jobs for man. For example, Vinamilk is one of the largest food producers in Vietnam. They currently employ around 10 000 workers throughout Vietnam, according to their annual report. We can imagine that what might be happening if this giant company bankcrupt? Thousands of workers will be potentially loosing their job. This might impact markedly in the social balancing and the social sercurity as unemployment will rise up.

Secondly, large organizations are capable to use their manpower to provide social facilities in a bigger scale. For instance, during the last two years of Covid, Vingroup,in accompanied with Chairman Mr. Vuong and his wife had been donated nearly 9000 billions VND to help our government and Vietnamese people to fight with the coronavirus. This unbelievable distribution help to save many people lives and children. Without this generous co-operation and these individuals, it is hard for our government to do such things fastly and precisely as they was shown to the public in the last period of time.

In conclusion, universal is operated in a circle. As it is written in one of favourite quote that “the more you give out, the more you get back”. The more the bussiness contribute back to people, to the society, to help them to archive the desirable goals, the more successful the bussiness can get as it will be paid back by people who were helped by them. The companions between enterprise and society help to faciliate to create a better world for people to live.

prompt: Some people think news has no connection to people's lives, so it is a waste of time to read the news in newspapers and watch television news programs. To what extent do you agree or disagree?

I reckon we should not glean a public's daily news from the press, TV, broadcast, and other media. 

First of all, it got proved that affluent people and wealthy politicians give a bribe to media and TV channels to deceive the population for various reasons. If one of the parliament members offends some major crimes, he or she can conceal the offence by using the power of media deluding people, which is a classical way how the press earns. There are countless incidences relating to this in Mongolia. One of these is Tuvshin, a member of parliament congress, who hid successfully the fact that he raped a girl, and stole a large amount of money from the government thanks to the media, which is one example. Hence, it is crucial to do not believe news reported by media.

Secondly, insofar as the objective of the press and webs is to captivate as many readers as possible so that they can make more money. Many websites are posting many numbers of intriguing news, gossips, and other juicy info through the internet and social media every day. For example, you can observe that there are many trashy but juicy posts on Facebook uploaded by websites. Therefore, we have to react perceptively to these uncertain pieces of information.

In conclusion, I firmly believe that taking information from the media is utterly a wrong idea, as they usually provide citizens with fallacious news. Thus, I state again we must not advocate this.

prompt: Parents should encourage children to spend less time studying and more time doing physical activities. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Over the past few years,the issue of children's free time has been widely debated. However, some parents think children should spend more time on academics because that is very important for their future.In my opinion, outdoor activities are more crucial to them as I will discuss both sides in the following essay.

There is no doubt that studying in lectures is important, because that is one of the basic responsibilities of students. For example, in Taiwan,there is an obligate education policy which means it is compulsory for citizens to abide for 12 years of education from elementary school to high school. Moreover,Some students have to go to cram school after class ,this can put a high pressure on students for their study performance. Furthermore,learning knowledge and skills is vital at a young age,because education can be a factor in future development,and is highly correlated with future success in the eyes of some parents.

On the other hand,some parents think exercise is always the priority for their children,due to teenagers growing up very fast in this time period,it is called a” golden time”. After this period, it becomes challenging to influence the physical growth of children,that is the reason why parents should put more emphasis on their health.This includes nutrition, body flexibility, and mental well-being, especially since children may not cope well with excessive academic pressure.

In conclusion,studying hard in academics and doing outdoor activities are two essential factors and should not be ignored when children are growing up,provided parents can give more balance on both sides, it could be beneficial to their children.
evaluation:

- The candidate has adequately addressed the given task by presenting both sides of the argument and providing relevant examples.

- Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 6.5

- Suggested Band Score (Coherence and Cohesion): 7

- The candidate uses a range of vocabulary, including some complex and sophisticated words.
- **Mistakes:**
    - "obligate" should be "obligatory"
    - "abide" should be "attend"
    - "cram school" is not a common term in English; a better option would be "after-school tutoring"
    - "golden time" is not a common phrase in this context; a better option would be "optimal time for growth"
- **Suggested Modifications:**
    - "obligate education policy" -> "compulsory education policy"
    - "abide for 12 years of education" -> "attend 12 years of compulsory education"
    - "cram school" -> "after-school tutoring"
    - "golden time" -> "optimal time for growth"
- Overall, the candidate's vocabulary is appropriate for the given context.
- Suggested Band Score (Lexical Resource): 7

    - "Furthermore,learning knowledge and skills is vital at a young age,because education can be a factor in future development,and is highly correlated with future success in the eyes of some parents." -> "Moreover, acquiring knowledge and skills is crucial at a young age because education can significantly influence future development and is highly valued by many parents as a predictor of future success."
- **Suggested Corrections:**

prompt: Advertisements are becoming more and more common in everyday life. Is it a positive or negative development?
essay:
the issue of whether the popularity of marketing for products nowadays and this effect on the development have been raising a lot of debates. Some might say that the advertisements have a beneficial effect on the individual and the industries such as open people’s knowledge about the goods, increase the profit of the companies through buying their products to customers. On the contrary, others insist on the opinion that false advertising can have a damaging effect on a human’s health. Viewing from a general perspective, I personally agree with the former opinion for the following reasons.

To begin with, today, in the development of facilities and the internet, advertising has become close to citizens and determine to the decision to buy something for the customer depends on the attraction of videos that introduce the products to the public, then it will bring a benefit to both people and companies. Firstly, inhabitants can substantially broaden their horizon by watching or reading the advertisement on the television or newspaper and they will know clearly about functions, advantages or disadvantages of the goods that they are going to buy, it will help them to make a perfect choice for themself. For example, people who want to buy a new wash hair do not know which benefit for their hair, thanks to the introduction of the products about purpose in the social media or tv the customer will find the one which is suitable for them.   Secondly, the companies who make the marketing will receive profit from selling the goods by approaching consumers better through advertising. For instance, giving the new item to the public by using the interaction with customers through advertising on Facebook or Youtube,the detail of the goods attract the intention of people that leads to them decide to buy this. Finally, introducing the goods by marketing

on the other hand, some of the population think that some of the companies have the advertisement is not the truth about the function of the item and this has a detrimental effect on the health of the human when they buy low-quality products, besides a lot of video or picture of marketing for the goods in the network make citizens feel inconvenient. However, advertising brings to people a diversity of products and they can make a better decision.

In conclusion, the positive of the marketing such as inhabitants can choice what is suitable for them thanks to it and the industry can buy products and make a profit for them which outweigh its  negative effect

prompt:
In some countries, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in.


What are the reasons for this?


How can people research this?
essay:
In a few countries, an increasing number of individuals are getting fascinated to discover the past of the dwelling or property they reside in. This essay will discuss the curious nature of the current generation and the need for a sense of connection as the cause, followed by how families living for generations can help in providing information.

One of the reasons that are contributing towards this is the intriguing nature of human beings born in the late nineties. Many of them are aware that the premises they are now resident to must have had a beginning which is now refurbished and renovated. As a result, this triggers the brain to know more about what was the thought process that lead to the construction of this structure at this specific location. For example, in 2020 a survey conducted by Realtor.com displayed that 80 per cent of youngsters before renovating the building they reside in would research the initial idea behind it because they did not want to damage the sentiments attached to that habitation.

Another reason is that to feel at home, individuals seek a sense of connection. Usually, a structure is made from concrete, steel, wood and other forms of raw material. There is not an instant attachment to any property one would move in along with their family. Therefore, to convert a house into a warm permanent abode, individuals look for reasons to find feelings in order to settle down for their entire lives and build legacies there. For example, in 2015 research published by the psychology department of the University of The Punjab 50 per cent of those who bought a new property would search for the history of the building in order to find a feeling of belonging.

Out of the many approaches, one that is most common is meeting the elderly in the neighbouring houses, as they have seen the area built, the surroundings change around them and the tenants moving in and out of these dwellings. This is why they have the most information about the place and can be the most authentic source of data. For example, in 2017 an article published by The Newyork Times showed that 68 per cent of the intriguing stories were uncovered about New York by talking to the senior members of the society.

In conclusion, curiosity and a desire to seek a connection are two possible reasons why people investigate the history of their homes and in order to do so, elder members of society are the best peoples to reach out to.
evaluation:

prompt:
Schools should focus on academic success and passing examinations. Skills such as cookery, dressmaking and woodwork should not be taught at school as it is better to learn these from family and friends. To that extent do you agree or disagree.

You should write at least 250 words.
essay:
Nowadays, most people consider that the pupils need to some subjective science topic so that they should learn it and they have to pass their exam. The school only provide to this experience that's why if they want acquire some talent such as cooking, dressmaking or art subject then they should learn from their parent or relatives. However, on the other hand some people think about this sitiation is not correct because school should be educational roof and tutors must teach about nut only science topics but also they should teach some skills how can they do. This essay sugggests that the second view is closest to the truth but other side is not to be ignored. The discussion follows below.

First and foremost, many pupils have been studying in school for five years, sometimes their parents working and many times their mother and father can not find a enough time for rasing their child. Furthermore, These children can not learn about some skills from their parents and they do not have any opportunities than this school. The individual who dont know any skills or basic life requirement such as cooking, houseworking or dressmaking they wouldn't be qualified in the future life. For instance, according to an American psychologist, the someone who can not earn some simple life experience they do not exactly succeed in any area. 

Secondly, many people want to academic success and passing examinations and they claim that it can be if teachers teach about only this topics. Lots of the people exert the greatest motivation to children's growth and they send their children to prospering school. Additionally, this parents believe that the schools should focus on science,  quality and quantity topics, they consider if they want to some skills for their children then they can enroll the pupils in art or lifelong education centre. 

In conclusion, no one wants a negative education for their children or themselves, but some want to focus only on science and academics, while others want to acquire the skills needed for life. Although both views are right, I think it is necessary to learn life skills at school.

prompt:
Some people claim that many things that children are taught at school are a waste of time. Other people argue that everything that children study at school is useful at sometime. 
Discuss the both views and give your opinion.
essay:
Many Proponents believe that these days, educational institutes are wasting the precious time of a child by teaching unnecessary things, whereas, others believe that everything taught by teachers in schools is crucial for the child's development and will be useful in the future. I believe that every subject is important, and will benefit the children one way or another.

To commence with, the advocaters of the former viewpoint believe that the school curriculum is overloaded with a number of different subjects as some of them are just worthless and a waste of time. They ultimately adding an extra burden on the learners to cover all these subjects in a limited time frame and sometimes a child is not interested in that specific subject. For instance, arts and craft is a mandatory subject in secondary education and sometimes it is not suitable for all the children, because some students do not have any interest to learn paintings. Thus, these subjects are a wastage of resources.

Conversely, I believe that education is always worthwhile because there are various life-long lessons taught by teachers in the schools which are beneficial for a child's overall development. Besides, they could be transferred to the workplace, and there everyday life as past knowledge can be applied to a new situation, so all knowledge is vital no matter how significant it might be. For example, an article published by the oxford university showed that most of the entrepreneurs invented many products by using the knowledge of their educational background which they once learned at learning institutes. 

In conclusion, although it is a wastage of resources for children if they keen no interest in a particular subject, I believe that every information that is provided by schools is important for the child's cognitive development.

prompt: As well as making money, businesses also have social responsibilities. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
It is argued that as with being profitable, enterprises are able to take responsibility for society. I completely agree with this belief by the formidable positive impact on socioeconomic can be made.

On the one hand, it is true that the main purpose of companies is to make money in order to survive in a competitive world. Facing unpaid bills, investment fees, employees’ salaries, etc leading to making money is the first choice. However, in fact, they are not only implementing the common function but also responding to the responsibilities that can be included in earning money. If companies succeed in making a profit, it will facilitate new employees a workspace to expand their abilities and deplete the proportion of unemployed people. Due to this, it is the vital element supporting the economic growth of regions or nations which means raising the quality of citizens’ lives.

On the other hand, companies should be aware that society’s obstacles are impacted by them. For example, the surroundings can be affected by sound, air, water pollutants and pollution, which highly damage citizen’s health and accommodation. According to this, the implementation of social obligation is to shed light on solutions to solve the issues such as demolishing and reconstructing manufactures in urban areas, additionally, strictly carrying out tasks related to social responsibilities to avoid changing human lives. 

In conclusion, despite the main function of businesses is to make a profit, responsibilities are significant to solve the problems in order to lessen the negative impacts.

Historical buildings are always considered prestigious for most generations. A bunch of people shows their interest in the old buildings to find something exciting about, which they are staying, in several territories. In this essay, I will share the possible reasons and the way of finding such traces, and how they can do it.

To begin with, the causes of such findings of the ancient property. Firstly, their focus of interest is to know more about the facilities of the specific residence which were availed by the past people. Moreover, they have the excitement to know the actual information related to amenities that property had given before so that they can have the same benefits. For instance, their agenda is to get similar comfort in their present time. Secondly, most people have the habit of collecting accurate information for the material used at the time of construction. Hence, they are willing to gather messages about the quality of construction items used.

Furthermore, they are possible ways of executing the research about ancient properties. First and Foremost, the search should be in the direction for those humans who belongs to that particular period. Besides, they can provide numerous valuable data about the particular residence. For instance, neighbours always have this sort of news about the next-door family to pass on. Another way is, the original paper of land can give much info to their grandchildren. Therefore, by such documents, they acquire distinguish ideas relates to old structures.

To conclude, availabilities on the individual home might drag their interest of them to explore the past, and the research can be executed to get in contact with the right channels for such time.

prompt: Human activities have negative effects on plant and animal species. Some people think it is too late to do anything about this problem. Others believe that effective measures can be taken to improve this situation. Discuss both views and give our opinion.
essay:
Scientists believe that the earth will become uninhabitable by 2050 due to the extensive damage being done to the environment by humans. While many people believe that the fate of the earth is doomed, others are of the opinion that there are still chances of reviving it, if preventive measures are taken. In this essay, I will delve into both views and provide my support for the latter view.

It is undeniably true that humans have gone too far in exploiting earth’s natural resources and many believe that it is futile to even try to save it. I believe the main reason for this thought is our inherent selfish nature. Many people would rather live comfortably utilizing all resources rather than worry about the future generation. Therefore, it is quite evident that people are not ready to come out of their comfort-zone, despite knowing that they are destroying the earth.

On the other hand, it is never too late to take steps to protect our planet from further damage. This is because there are numerous initiatives and organizations already in place waiting to get the necessary support and funds from the government and common citizens. This could be achieved by taking small steps such as placing billboards on the busiest traffic intersections or posting relevant energy conservation tips on the social media. Since a majority of the population uses the subways for their daily commute, posters could be pasted on the subway walls as well. Obviously, we can do a lot if we stand united.

In conclusion, even though, it may seem like there is nothing we can do about the present state of our planet, it is never too late to take preventive measures. We have a collective responsibility to save this planet for our future generations
evaluation:
**Task Achievement:**

The candidate has adequately addressed the given task. They have discussed both views on whether it is too late to address the negative effects of human activities on plant and animal species and provided their opinion. The response is clear and coherent, presenting ideas in a logical manner. The candidate has fully covered all parts of the task and supported their arguments appropriately.

- Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 7.5

prompt:
Some people think that museums should be enjoyable places to entertain people, while others believe that the purpose of museums is to educate.
Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
Issues related to the museum are frequently discussed these days. Although some people believe that museums introduce us to have enjoyable moments with others rather than learning occasion, others criticize and argue that museums aim is to become an educational tool. Both sides of the view will be shown in this essay.

On the one hand, there are several reasons why museums should be joyful places. The principal reason is that the performances in the gallery have often shown both creative and aesthetic things influencing people to feel clam down; such as landscape painting. To explain, many forms of art; such as music can be a great tool to decrease stress problems. Thus; museum should be one of the places where offer joyful date for some society suffered from work. 

For instance, many families opt to take their families time for relaxing in the exhibition in the children museum.

On the other hand, there are a number of causes why the most beneficial goal of the museum is to educate the community. The main reason is that most of the exhibitions in the museums usually deliver some messages to trigger human’s notions or at least allows people to think of their meanings even though they do not know the artists. A good example in this point is that there are different meanings of sculptures between people when they are walking around them.

Another point is that apart from places were share the happy moments, visiting the gallery has a positive impact on learning skills in order to encourage students to interest their lessons. For example, many students enjoy listening the historical events while they are walking around the historical library and observing real matters rather than reading books.

All things considered, I am of the opinion that although the museums contribute to both enjoyable moments and educational sectors thanks to various sorts of museums, the benefits of educational terms slightly outweigh than other reasons. Therefore, individuals, especially pupils should be invited to go to the museums for developing their knowledge.

prompt: As well as making money, businesses also have social responsibilities. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
essay:
It is apparent that business entities benefit the most in light of the era of industrialization. Therefore, compelling notion that great profits are synonymous with many substantial roles, which they have to play in the society, is raised. Personally, I totally lean towards the idea for 2 major compelling justifications.

When it comes to social responsibility of businesses, perhaps the major contribution of each entity is their financial obligation to the government tax revenue. In other words, transparency in tax declaration and fulfilling tax responsibilities is not only surge national economic prosperity but also increase public welfare and subsidizes aiming at workers such as healthy insurance, maternity insurance, unemployment insurance. In return for the obligation, business enterprises, especially the small-scale ones, can be granted various supports from national purse such as capital allowance, tax relief and credits for research and development, enterprise investment scheme. 

What is more, maximizing profits seems to be the most practical aim of every entity; however, creating and maintaining company’s CSR - abbreviation for cooperate social responsibility, is the driving force for its existence in a competitive market. Alternatively stated, if a company use a proportion of their income into many social-benefit programs and go a long way towards manifesting their business ethic and social responsibilities, the company tend to draw more attention from consumers as well as arouse considerable public sympathy. Besides CSR, which usually costs colossal time and money, social duties can be done successfully within their own enterprise. Enhancing working condition and living standard for workers is cited as the most radical action. Given the win-win relationships between employees and employers as well as the unshaken importance of staff members as the primary force behind every fruition, I am convinced that they must therefore be treated well in terms of finance and living aspects. 

In conclusion, taking the aforementioned responsibilities not only benefits the society but has a decisive bearing on the reinforced existence and amelioration of all businesses. Because of this 2-way profitable knit, I am of the notion of social obligation of enterprise.
evaluation:

The candidate has adequately addressed the given task by presenting a clear stance on the importance of businesses fulfilling social responsibilities beyond profit-making. prompt: Some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to a successful career, while others believe that it is better to get a job straight after school. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
There has been a difference of opinion regarding the merits of continuing a higher education as people believe that is better to get a job straight after school. I would argue that are more benefits in going to college or university. 
The option to start a work immediately is attractive for several reasons. The access to have an independent lifestyle as long as younger people start earning money, a wider range of possibilities come with it. In this way, they will be able to afford their own apartment or start a new family. In terms of their career, getting a job brings the opportunity to gain experience in specific fields. Indeed, spend time working in a real industry and sharing different points of views with co-workers and bosses, gives an invaluable knowledge about the process.  
Despite the arguments mentioned above, I believe that is more beneficial for students to continue their studies. Firstly, academic qualifications are required in the majority of professions. For example, it is impossible to become a doctor, teacher or lawyer without having a degree. As a result, nowadays a large number of industries and hospitals are only hiring people who have a bachelor degree or higher. Secondly, in recent years, the job market is becoming more competitive and sometimes there are hundred of applicants for one position in a company. Subsequently, young people who do not have a degree will not be able to compete and without a job is more difficult to continue growing in a career. 
By way of conclusion, I believe that students will be more successful in their lives if they continue their studies beyond school level.

prompt:
Some employers believe that job applicants’ social skills are more important than their academic qualifications. To what extent do you agree? 

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

You should write at least 250 words.
essay:
In recent times, it is popularly noticed that social skills are becoming very valuable. In some industries, the recruiters feel that the interpersonal competencies of most job seekers have more value than their academic qualifications. I moderately agree with this opinion. This essay will discuss the reasons for my point of view.

To begin with, it is important to note that communication is an integral part of every work environment. Apart from interacting with clients, an employee needs to demonstrate social competency when relating with their colleagues to foster a healthy work space which in turn breeds organisation success. For instance, in my place of work, I have noticed that there is increased productivity when we work as a team with little to no conflict. However, in cases when there is a disagreement, there is less efficiency in achieving a task. This proves that good communication which results from good social skills promotes productiveness in every business establishment.

On the other hand, the educational accomplishments of an individual seeking a job are equally essential. This is because most professional jobs require a certain amount of skills and knowledge that is acquired through learning. To illustrate, only individuals that have received academic training as a nurse or a medical doctor should be allowed to carry out medical treatments and procedures for ailing individuals. Anything otherwise would result in hazards or loss of life whether the employee has good interpersonal skills or not.

To sum it up, this essay has explained why social skills as well as academic eligibility should equally be considered by employers when they decide to hire for a role. I hereby recommend that organisations should arrange training or workshops on good communication among their staff members.
evaluation:

- The response is generally clear and presents ideas in a logical manner.

prompt:
In some countries, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in.

What are the reasons for this?

How can people research this?
essay:
Many citizens today are keen to learn as much as possible about the homes they live in. This is because they want to understand their houses' history and design, evaluate their safety, and determine if they are haunted. I think that nearby seniors and the internet can be valuable sources of information for those who are curious about their homes.

Knowing a home's background gives people a sense of pride and satisfaction. This is why people who live in an old house are often interested in learning more about adobe. The history often includes the construction process, which was done by hand in a time before advanced technology. This exploration reveals unique and fascinating facts. For instance, some residents in our city's old district mistakenly believed their houses were built during the English colonial era. 

Actually, researchers have recently discovered that these houses were constructed to resemble English styles, but by the local masons. It was intriguing to learn this. In addition, the way a house is built and its quality provide significant knowledge about the safety and durability of the structure. Recognising such details could prevent individuals from experiencing catastrophic events such as the collapse of a house. Finally, some people believe that a house may be haunted if it has a dark past. Learning about a house's history often stems from personal beliefs and motives to either clean or vacate it. 

To conclude, in order to obtain accurate information, individuals can speak to senior citizens who have resided there for a significant period. They may provide firsthand insights about the property and other details not found elsewhere. Additionally, the internet can be a useful source of information about a house. Numerous websites contain data on properties in the area.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement:**

- The candidate clearly addresses the prompt and covers all parts of the task.

prompt: Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
A few people believe that adolescents must be encouraged to participate in unpaid social service during their free time as it would be beneficial for both youth and society. I disagree with this view as the benefits outweigh disadvantages.

To begin with, if juveniles are required to volunteer for unpaid neighbourhood services, some people think that it would enhance their feeling of empathy towards mankind and nature. For instance, volunteer to visit the shut-ins and people in needs can help teens to have a grasp of the life of them.  As the youngster is highly impressionable, working for the neighbourhood will turn them into socially responsible adults. So, for the benefit of the district and youth, teenagers must be encouraged to occupy themselves with  voluntary jobs in their free time.

However, children between thirteen and nineteen years of age are fragile and through neighbourhood task, they have to dig deep into the harsh realities of life such as hunger and poverty. This could adversely affect their young conscience and they would be carrying the the negative image of society in their minds throughout their lives. Also, if the job is unpaid, there is a lack of motivation as well because if they are not paid for their efforts, they may get discouraged to participate in future. For example, many children are devastated when they interact with the deprived segment of the society and sometimes this leads to serious cognitive issues like depression and phobia of meeting new people. Therefore, it should not be mandatory for the juvenile to take part in unpaid social work in their free time.

To conclude, although unpaid public service is a noble act, youth should not be compelled to engage in it until they are ready because it exposes them to the harsh realities of life. Hence, volunteering should be a choice and not an obligation.
evaluation:

prompt: Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Many people think minors working an unpaid part-time job for communities might have advantages for themselves and for the local residents. I personally agree how part-time jobs for youngsters will bring many benefits for their future, because they will learn how to manage their time for work and play

The main reason they will benefit from part-time jobs is that they will have hands-on experience, thus increasing their hard and soft skills, such as communication, leadership, and teamwork. Many youngsters and recent graduates, for example, struggle to find work due to a lack of work experience. They will have an early start in learning how the work field operates as a result of this. Another one is that they can help communities that are in need and grow connections. Working with the community that surrounds them will not only benefit the community but also themselves, because helping people will give us our own satisfaction and contribute to the country, starting with a smaller scope.

On the other hand, many adults are concerned that, because of their part-time jobs, teenagers will have less time to play with their friends in their spare time. But most importantly, it’s not about how the part-time job would take their time, but how teenagers will learn to manage their time so they can work and also live their lives as teens. A lot of part-time jobs are usually open around the summer, so they can divide their time more easily now that the school term is over.

To conclude, I fully agree with how the unpaid part-time job will give more advantages to minors and the community, as long as they can balance their work and play time with friends.

prompt: Human activities have a negative effect on plant and animal species. Some people say that it is too late to do anything. Some people think that we should take effective action to improve the situation. Discuss both sides and give your opinion.
essay:
There are controversial perspectives heating a debate over humans’ impact on nature. While some hold a strong view that actions have to be taken effectively, others argue that the issue is too late to be dealt with. Although each has its own perks, I would contend that there is still time for humankind to resolve this problem.

Undoubtedly, only after centuries of overexploitation did people realise nature has seriously been decimated, yet it is late to enhance the current situation. Since the dawn of civilization, a great number of species have ceased to exist due to humans’ activities . And when they become extinct, no matter how many efforts are made, there is no way people can bring these creatures back to life. Dodo birds can be cited as an obvious example as their extinction was directly linked to hunting. When Dodo birds were discovered by mankind, it took only approximately a century for these poor birds to be hunted to the last. That is why it is too late for some actions to be done in this day and age.

On the other hand, although the ecosystem has been destroyed severely, dwellers should join hands to make any possible efforts. As a wealth of fauna and flora are on the edge of extinction, authorities should create more preservation and ecosystem services to breed endangered species as well as protecting them from poaching. For example, the last White Rhino in North Africa has been under protection of the government for years. In fact, it is guarded day by day by soldiers in an isolated savanna. Therefore, dwellers are still capable of saving the wildlife from extinction, provided that dedicated actions of humans must be made.

All in all, I believe though many animals are facing extinction due to anthropogenic factors, we should still try to preserve biological diversity as well as possible in the long run.

prompt: Some people think the money spent on developing the technology for space exploration is not justified. There are more beneficial ways to spend this money. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
It's a well-known fact that several governments allocate large sums of money towards space exploration. Personally, I strongly agree that these funds should be directed towards public services that have a more direct, immediate impact on people's daily lives.

There are several reasons why space exploration should be reconsidered. Firstly, such missions can be a tremendous expense, requiring vast amounts of money for astronaut training, rocket and space shuttle construction, and advanced technology development. Secondly, the exploration of space does not have a direct impact on the lives of ordinary citizens who struggle with challenges such as earning a livelihood and maintaining health. Lastly, space research can pose risks to astronauts' lives. Although unmanned spacecraft can minimize the involvement of human beings in dangerous tasks, accidents can still occur.

I firmly believe that the money spent on space research would be better allocated towards schools and hospitals. Firstly, it is more cost-effective to train teachers and doctors than astronauts. Dollars spent on education programs can equip young people with knowledge and skills that can improve their efficiency in the workplace, thereby improving their standard of living. Secondly, if governments opt to channel the funds previously used for space travel towards building hospitals and providing quality healthcare to citizens, people will feel safer and happier as they will receive support from national authorities.

In conclusion, I advocate for the reallocation of funds to areas of education and healthcare that have a more direct impact on people's lives, rather than expending vast amounts of money on exploring space and remote planets.
evaluation:

- The candidate has effectively addressed the given task.
- They have clearly stated their position that funds allocated to space exploration should be redirected to public services.

prompt: Some People believe that Robots play an important role in future societies, While other argue that robots might have negative effects on societies give often. discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
Being part of a world where technology has been changing how we live, some individuals defend that machines have a positive impact on our future. Although, there are those who state the opposite, believing that robots will bring an undesired outcome for our society. In my point of view, these technological tools are beneficial for us, as we can adapt them to our needs, which will make our lives easier. 

On the one hand, some people strongly believe that technological machines will improve our way of living, as it can help us with repetitive daily tasks. Nowadays we have seen hotels in Japan, for example, using robots to take dirty plates from the door of the rooms. Indeed, during times of pandemics, for instance, this is an amazing tool to protect clients as well as employees. Besides, it has been used to clean houses, as well, thus, when you finish working, you do not need to take care of it anymore. Furthermore, places that are facing a labour shortage can try to use it and still deliver the desired service. As we can see, these machines can solve some of our problems, making our life less stressful. 

On the other hand, this discussion brings a group of people that do not believe in the positive contribution of these robots. They defend that these machines can be used to replace humans, hence, reducing human interactions. A great example of this is the smartphones, as they are already negatively impacting on our sociability. In recent times, people are avoiding meet friends in person, staying always in touch using social media or video calls. Consequently, with smarter machines, this change will be bigger and can bring some health problems. Indeed, this is an important point to be taken into consideration, however, I believe that some measures need to be put in place to avoid it. 

In conclusion, the use of robots in our societies has been concerning part of the population who do not believe in its benefits, however, there are those who think that this is an important improvement in our lives. Even considering both sides, I still believe that there are ways to avoid the drawbacks of this technology and take advantage of its benefits, which for me are bigger than the negative impacts.

prompt: Many students find it difficult to focus or pay attention at school nowadays. What are the reasons for this? What can be done to solve this problem?
essay:
These days, there are more and more learners are inclined to have focus and attention difficulties during the class-hours. This is mainly because of the lack of interest to the subjects and also digital destruction. There are a number of solution that could be implemented to help them motivated.

Firstly, the foremost reason for the students are not actively involved or participating in the learning process, is due to the material uninteresting. In other words, the learners might find some lessons are boring and irrelevant to their live, which causing the struggle to stay engaged and focused.  Some recent studies reported that most students nowadays seek for practical-subjects in which they could feel, touch, and experience through their activities. Secondly, the use of technology in the classroom is also owing to the increased of distraction. As a result, many schoolchildren may be tempted to use their devices for non-academic purposes such as games, social media, and others.

There are two effective solutions to the problem of lack engagement students in learning. One way to tackle this is by having varied teaching methods that related to the real-word applications. For instance, rather than learning to memorize technical terms or definition, students can explore more or doing experimental studies in the laboratory or school garden. Another method to dealing with students’ interest is by immersing them with something they eager for, computer and hand phone, which attract them more, can be a source of learning flat form during the lesson, but still with a clear policy.

In conclusion, it obvious that by providing practical lessons with enjoyable learning activities and adjusting technology as well are seem to give a solution to this notions. If the stakeholders could implement this, learners will be more pleasant to learn in the future.
evaluation:

- The candidate has adequately addressed the given task by identifying reasons for students' difficulty in focusing and suggesting solutions.

prompt: It is important for all the cities and towns to have large outdoor public spaces, such as parks or squares. Do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
essay:
There has been a controversy about the existence of large outdoor public spaces, such as parks or squares. Some say it's necessary to have these spaces in cities; some have the opposite opinions. I think having large outdoor public spaces is vital, and my reasons will be explained in the following paragraphs. 

First, parks can lessen our pressure. It's expected that due to technological development, we tend to have a heavier workload, and our working time is elongated; in other words, we may have to spend more time and energy on our jobs. Therefore, our living standards can be dampened, and it might stimulate the sales of tobacco and alcohol companies in order to release the pressure. At this point, the existence of parks can lessen our stress to a large extent; the smell and sound of plants and animals in parks exert a positive influence on our emotions. 

Second, expanding our social circles. It's commonplace that big events always take place in large outdoor public spaces, like squares. Hence, when a city has these spaces, which can provide good opportunities to meet new people and make new friends. For example, when a concert takes place in a square, it can attract its fans to come. In this case, you can find people who have the same interests as you in the concert; and as a result, you can extend your social circle. 

On the other hand, large outdoor public spaces have some disadvantages as well. For instance, they constantly require a large amount of space in cities. As we know,  to build large outdoor public spaces, the government has to draw an area exclusively for them; thus, such a situation can force the surrounding communities to move, and brings about housing insufficiency on account of these large outdoor public spaces. 

In conclusion, I believe the merits of public spaces outstrip their demerits.
evaluation:
## Task Achievement:
- The candidate has addressed the given task by providing a clear stance on the importance of large outdoor public spaces in cities.
- The response is coherent and presents ideas logically, covering all parts of the task.

prompt: Films and computer games containing violence are popular. Some people say they have negative effect on society and should be banned. Others say they are just harmless relaxation. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
Now-a-days, most of the movies and machine games containing violence are in demand. Few people thought that they have negative effects on society, while others say they are for mild relaxation. In the next few sentences, we discuss the views on both sides of the topic. In my opinion, the number of negative effects is higher compared to the other side.


Firstly, most of the machine games played by people contain violence because they are designed as per the survey people are playing. For example, today PUBG will be a game played by more than half of the world's population, while other games like puzzles are not as much popular. Even players are interested in games which includes firearms which leads to impact on society, as the person want to imitate the same in real life. When we go to the other side, films which have violence are popular compared to others. For example, one of the most popular pictures in India is Bahubali which has spread around the world where more than half of the picture time includes war scenes, whereas some other movies which has no violence/fights such as Midhunam is not popular here the movie describes how old people live their life's. Entertainment such as Movies and games has battles and wars which are throwing negative impact on society as some part of the people try to replicate them in real life.




On the other hand, few think that this is for entertainment and for relaxation, its true that most people feel relaxed when they win a game or when they like the film. By Recapitulating the examples in the second paragraph, a person plays PUBG for relaxation, he plays the game to win some badges and have a chicken dinner which helps him to release his stress levels by focusing on other information. When we come on to the movie part, People will feel relaxed when they have their specific interest as in present world most people are interested in violence, in particular people from south India expect fight scenes when they watch the picture.


To conclude, Films and machine games which have blood are popular as they have most of the negative impact on society, where people can go to malls or parks  for relaxation. Due to most of the negative consequences in society the films and machine games which have violance should be banned.

prompt:
Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well.
To what extent do you agree or disagree.
essay:
Scientific findings have clearly indicated that the excessive consumption of fast food is leading the health of people to deterioration. According to some people, this unhealthy practice can be stopped by means of education; however, some others have little faith in this solution. As the supporters of each view have their own justifications, whether education is effective remains to be seen in this essay.


 
On the one hand, raising the awareness of people towards the dangers of unhealthy food can certainly yield some promising outcomes. Firstly, many fast food products provide very little or no information on the nutritional content in them, deterring the consumers from knowing the amount of fat, sodium or cholesterol which they take in. By being informed of how much of these harmful substances is contained in their favourite hamburgers or chips, as well as being shown the likely consequences of over-eating these foods, consumers can be more cautious the next time they choose their food. Secondly, education at schools can help to form healthy eating habits for children and parents. For instance, schools can hold some extracurricular activities such as growing and selling vegetables with the attendance of both students and parents, in order to promote the benefits of healthy diets and warn against the potential risks of junk food.

On the other hand, some people doubt the effectiveness of education for certain reasons. To begin with, despite being aware of the negative effects of fast food, many people who are too busy persist to eat it due to its being convenient and time-saving. In this case, education hardly makes a difference as they have made a choice. In addition, compared with the wide range and availability of fast food stores and menus, healthy food is seriously limited. Furthermore, healthy food is commonly inferior to fast food in terms of taste and prices as a matter of fact. As a result, however convincing education is, it is almost impossible for people to change their eating habit without a ready alternative to their unhealthy food choices.

In conclusion, people have different opinions about whether to support education so as to reduce people’s consumption of fast food. In my opinion, education can be a viable measure with careful consideration of other impediments.
evaluation:
## Task Achievement:
- The candidate has provided a clear response to the task, addressing the prompt about the effectiveness of education in reducing fast food consumption.
- The essay presents a well-structured argument, with ideas organized logically into paragraphs.
- However, the candidate has not fully explored the impact on teenagers, as mentioned in the prompt.
