prompt: Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well. To what extent do you agree or disagree
essay:
Some people believe that teenagers should be required to volunteer in community activities in their free time. It helps them to improve their working experience, sympathy and benefit for the society as well. 

There are many non-profitable  or charity organizations in the world and also in Vietnam, such as “Tro Ngheo Vung Cao” or “La lanh dum la rach” which help poverty children can go to school. Some other organizations collect food and clothes for the poor people. With their help, many poor people can have food, and warm clothes in winter and children can have the education. Those contributions to society are undeniable. 

To keep these kindness operations continue, those organizations also need help from contributors who can donate money for charity or simply work without paying in their free time. 

It is better for teenagers to improve their personal skills when joining unpaid community work. Such as collecting food and clothes, classifying them in a suitable ways, or teaching English to poor children, etc. The candidates need to ensure the work is done on time. They need to manage the time to complete their homework at school and the voluntary task as well. The voluntary work might require them to communicate with many kinds of people which help them improve their interpersonal skill. Sometimes they need to solve some problems arising suddenly. In other words, the volunteers need to have good communication, time management and problem-solving skills. Those skills will take an important part in their success in the future. 

In conclusion, joining in voluntary work not only help teenagers improve their personal skills but also benefit  the community as well.

prompt:

To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Taking back historical artefacts to their originated nation, in this contemporary era, has become a desire of other countries. I accord with this assertion up to a higher extent and pertinent notions will be explicated further.

Commencing with pre-eminent favourable aspects of bringing back the historical things. The former viable anatomy is, sentimental and emotional values are attached with the historical objects. Besides this, a nation's history and cultural values are associated with those objects, which were taken away by other people. To exemplify, Lord Visnu's idol had taken by the Britisher during the time of India's independence and kept in the museum of London. As a result, Indians think that idea place of that statue is it is own country rather than keeping it in another state. Owing to this they have put pressure on the ministry to accomplish this task.

Another point to consider is that these items can be used as a remedy to ameliorate as well as build the relationships between two countries. When a nation returns  to it is originated country, it will bring peace and harmony . To illustrate it, during the first world war, Mummies from  Egypt were captured by  France, which creates disturbance between them. By dint of this, the prime minister of France decided to return it back to normalise the relationships; Hence it resumes the bilateral talks between the two nations.

In conclusion, bringing back the historical artefacts not only boost the relationships between the states but also bring happiness to the society and community as many cultural values are attached to it.

High robberies or crime rates will make people feel unsafe and may be disqualified regarding no one would like to live in a bad environment. On the other way, as being curious is one of the nature of humans, it is possible that people may only just wonder who had lived there before them.

There are plenty of sources for people or purchasers to find a habitation's profile, most of them searching from the internet which does not take much time and contained many pieces of information. Moreover asking a previous owners, nearby neighbours or sellers in order to receive brief information is also the popular method. 

In conclusion, safety is the main reason that people seek for historical of houses or other accommodations and this process does not take so long time because they can mainly search on the internet or asking from stakeholders like real estate agents, former owners or neighbours.

prompt:
Some people think that art is an essential subject for children at school while others think it is a waste of time.
Discuss both views and give your opinion.
Some people think that art is an essential subject for children at school while others think it is a waste of time.
Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
In recent years it's been a topic of debate whether teaching art in schools is necessary. Some argue that it is a waste of time and school curriculum should focus on academic subjects. In this essay I will be discussing both views and why i totally disagree with the prior notion.

To begin with, individuals who are advocating for not teaching art in schools base their argument on the fact that arts are something luxurious and children can practice it in their free time as a pastimetime activity. They believe that schools curriculum should focus and invest time on the important academic subject such as math, science and computer skills that will help pupils to succeed later on in their future careers.

However, We can not deny that through art young children can acquire important skills that are essential in life. Firstly, through art children can express unique ideas and thoughts that will help them to become creative thinkers . Moreover, it will help them to boost their confidence . A recent study that was conducted in the UK showed that children who participated in drama classes were able to overcome stage fright.Furthermore, artistic creations are born through solving problems. For example, turning the clay into a sculpture or portraying  emotion through a dance or a song . All of this improves youngsters' problem-solving skills which is a must to succeed in any career.

In conclusion, art is an important subject and it should be thought in school . only through art students can acquire skills such as creative thinking, problem-solving, non-variable communication and much more.

prompt: Many people argue that in order to improve educational quality, high school students should be encouraged to question and offer criticism of their teachers.
essay:
Many people argue that in order to improve educational quality, high school students should be encouraged to question and offer criticism of their teachers. Others think this will lead to a loss of respect and discipline in the classroom.Discuss both views and give your own opinion.Write 250 words.

Some people opine that students should be supported to evaluate or criticize teachers, while others are worried that these acts would lead to a chaotic classroom. I personally side with the former view because the two-way communications helps instructors refine their teaching methods and enables students to become more involved in the lessons.

To begin with, educational standards can be raised because teachers can modify their ways of delivering lessons based on the students' feedbacks. For example, if the class is slow, it will be ineffective for teachers teach too fast so that most students would fall to retain the information. Therefore, based on the comments of students, lectures would find it is easier to know the appropriate speed of the lesson and adjust themselves to their audience. This would result in enhanced pedagogical methods of teachers.

Furthermore, i believe giving the students the freedom in expressing their thoughts and feelings would enable them to become more proactive. For instance, many countries are promoting students-centred teaching with two-way communication, where open discussions between tutor and trainee are encouraged. This approach has a clear advantage of making students become more involved in studying. Increased participation in the classroom activities helps pupils understand and memorize lessons faster, which eventually improves the educational outcomes.

In conclusion, I believe allowing students to make judgement on teachers would result in better pedagogical methods of the educator and increase engagement of pupils in lessons. Consequently, i prefer the opinion that this measure should be encouraged to enhance educational quality despite the risks of disrespect and indicipline.

prompt: Some people think that the government should provide assistance to all kind of artists, including painters, musicians and poets. However, other people think that this a waste of money. Discuss both view and give your own opinion.
essay:
The investment of government’s fund to artists or other aspects is a matter for debate. When supporters suppose authorities ought to offer support to people who engage in industries that are based on art. However, opponents reckon that money should be poured into other fields. Personally, there are several reasons and instance as follows supporting my view.

Supporters of providing assistance to art field argue that an increasing number of artworks need protecting and developing. Providing help to art will attract more people and create many job opportunities. What’s more, this would give the people a sense of happiness.

On the other hand, other people believe that other domains, such as medical system and educational, are vital than using money in art because residents cannot bear the pressure of education and medical due to lower salaries and without medical insurance in some developing nations. If the government financial them, they no longer worry about the fees when they are ill. 

In my opinion, whether a country should provide assistance access to all sorts of artists depends on its financial and nation’s culture. Developed nations typically have accumulated substantial funds, technologies, and experience, allowing them to provide expertise for them without stress. On the flip side, the developing world, struggling with limited resources, may have no substitute but to priorities other areas such as infrastructure development and job creation instead.

In conclusion, while publicly funded access to healthcare and education can have many benefits, it may not be suitable for all countries. Ultimately, the decision should be made based on the unique priorities and available resources of each nation.

prompt: Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
It is argued that youngsters ought to do free social work in their leisure time which might benefit both teenagers and community. I am in complete favor of the above statement and I will give my stance with relative examples in the upcoming paragraphs.

To commence with the first and foremost point to support my opinion is that it helps to built social relationships with strong base. In other words, children are encouraged by their parents and oldest to do social work for free which further help in the development of moral values in the individual and teaches them the lessons like caring and sharing for others. As an illustration, during recent pandemic, many different age groups came forward to help each other to cope with this problem, but the main centre of attraction were children who stole everyone's heart by serving to the communities with their small hands. Thus, help done by teenagers has positive effect on community as well as on children themselves which promote healthy social bonding.

Moreover, the other reason is that it helps in the community development. To put it in another way, creative mind of young generation put many interesting ideas into actions which ultimately benefit the overall development of the society by various means. For instance, competitions could be held to paint the old walls of building or other vacant places which in turn, give a chance to teenagers to show the creativity and on the other hand it would enhance the beauty of the community. As a result, unpaid help by teenagers serve community to maintain its images. Furthermore, it enhances children to develop humanity in them by serving the needy people of community and make them responsible citizens of society in future.

In conclusion, for the reasons I have mentioned above, I strongly believe that encouraging teenagers for doing unpaid work will strengthen the social liabilities and additionally promote humanity among teenagers and helps in the beautification of the community.

prompt: Many customs and traditional ways of behaviors are no longer relevant to the modern life and no worth keeping. Do you agree or disagree?
essay:
In this contemporary epoch, the issue of whether or not traditional cultures need to be upgraded is certainly a contentious one. Although there are valid arguments to the contrary, I personally believe that such updating is paramount in order to accomplish homogeneity among nations and for the sake of art innovation and creativity. In this essay, 2 of the primary reasons why I totally agree with this trend will be further  elaborated.

To embark on, the first and also the most crucial reason relates to the upsurge in cutting-edge electronics and the fact that the whole universe has become a small village. This means that different nations have become in close and more prolonged contact than ever before. An eminent example of this is social media platforms which have enabled internet users to get acquainted with different cultures and traditions across the world. Thus, what can be said is that in order to accept and tolerate  this digitalized world, inherited traditions ought to be modified. 

Further and even more importantly, though, is the new opportunities which will allow artists to be innovative. In other words, if craftsmen, artists and musicians are exposed to different cultures, they will not only bring cultural diversity to their artworks  but also this will impact positively upon society at large. This can be witnessed in different disciplines of art which require fresh ideas to become vibrant and lively. Hence, I would contend that the democratic nature of art requires updating the conventional thoughts of people. 

In conclusion, after this essay has manifested the above-mentioned points, it can be reiterated that I believe that this issue is likely to become more important in the future as borders between countries have become increasingly blurred. Therefore, I am convinced that authorities ought to encourage it in order to accomplish cultural diversity and innovation in different aspects.

prompt: Some people think that one of the best ways to solve environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles to what extent do you agree or disagree ?
essay:
Many people are inclined to think that raising the price of petrol; diesel and motors  is one of the effective approaches to overcome  environmental pollution. I  disagree to a major extent with this notion. My position is justified further with reasons and examples.

The foremost argument to justify my view is that increasing rates of fuel may arise a lot of financial problems for many public. As the youngsters are travelling from rural to city areas on a daily basis  for jobs may face difficulty in managing their money. Also, most of the middle-class  can not afford costly transportation so they may lose their long-distance work owing to the high cost of travelling. However, there are other measures which can help to ameliorate the problems of the environment without any negative effects. Firstly, the government should encourage mankind to use electric shipment. This means  electronic vehicles are the best option as they will not emit any poisonous fumes into the air. The best epitome is  the USA , a developed nation, in which the  automatic transportation system  (electric tram) is introduced by authorities decades ago which helped in the reduction of air pollution.

On the other hand, others claim that the high cost of fuels can remedy the situation of environmental pollution. The main reason is that it will restrict folks from unnecessary usage of personal transportation. It has been observed that in city areas most of the youngsters have their own transit ergo they use more frequently for commuting which will cause the  air contamination. But, the high price of fuels may encourage them to benefit from public transport in lieu of  cars. This will create a positive impact on the surrounding by reducing air pollutants. 

In conclusion, notwithstanding at some point increase cost of petrol can help to overcome environmental problems by putting a restriction on the public for unnecessary usage of cars, the demerits of this situation can not be overlooked. Thus, authorities encouraging crowds to use electric trams and subways can be a more effective way to mitigate the issues about the environment.

prompt:
Some people believe that it is the government’s responsibility to provide care and finance to support people after they retire. Others, however, think that individuals themselves should save money in their own when they are old.

Discuss both views and give your opinion. > DISCUSS AND OPINION
essay:
Nowadays, an increasing number of people are concerned about the finance issue after they retire. However, whether they should save money by themselves or receive assistance from the government is a controversial issue. This essay will discuss both sides and my view is that a financial-independent person will bring more merits.

It is clear that authority plays an important role in allocating resources to improve their national security and the general welfare of its people. A disturbing fact is that there are a lot of older citizens who unable to work to earn a living out there, some of them even do not have their own children to rely on. So, the government should give their top priority to assuring high-quality life for especially the elderly. However, a strong rising of the old-age dependency ratio year by year seems to be a great burden on the government efforts of improving the quality of life. If each person can save money on their own, the government could spend these expenses to solve other problems like reducing the unemployment rate or tackle environmental issues and so on.

Besides, it is undeniable that the older generation today have rich knowledge and gain many practical experiences through their career, hence, they have self-awareness enough to prevent themselves from becoming a social burden as they are afraid of being an unworthy person when they get old. Although each family member should take care and provide basic needs for the elder people, it would be unethical for the old to rely totally on them. So they tend to save a certain amount of money from their monthly income in their early period of a career in order to avoid dependency on others and enjoy their old age. 

In conclusion, despite governments should hold the duties of providing its citizens with efficient subsidies, I believe that people should prepare for their living expenses when they get older rather than expect from government grants.

prompt: Young people are often influenced in their behaviors and situations by others of the same age. This is called “peer pressure”. Do the disadvantages of peer pressure outweigh the advantages?
essay:
Peer influence, colloquially recognized as peer pressure, stands as a pervasive dynamic within the socio-ecological framework, casting its defining imprint upon the behavioral paradigms and life circumstances of juveniles. The present exposition aspires to undertake a rigorous exegesis to proffer perspicuity on whether the liabilities intrinsic to peer influence inordinately eclipse its boons.

The beneficial ramifications that emanate from positive peer pressure are unequivocal. Predominantly, it operates as a galvanizing stimulant of unprecedented magnitude. When adolescents are privy to their peers achieving remarkable milestones across a diversity of domains, such as scholastic prowess or athletic endeavors, an incendiary spark of inspiration is kindled. This competitive impetus, an aspirational cascade of achievement, engenders not only personal flourishing but also orchestrates an elevation of accomplishments hitherto deemed unattainable.

Moreover, the profound compass of peer influence extends to the genesis of quintessential social adeptness. Ongoing interaction with peers imparts a nuanced education in the fine arts of negotiation, effective communication, and the nuances of collective decision-making. These quintessential competencies stand as crucial instruments requisite for navigating the labyrinthine precincts of adulthood, enshrining their indispensability in contexts as diverse as professional environs and intricate relational matrices.

However, to confine our reflection solely within the precincts of advantage is to sidestep the abiding adversities concomitant with peer influence. Negative peer pressure, notably pernicious, frequently catalyzes perilous comportment among juveniles. This coersive undercurrent may compel individuals to partake in deleterious activities, encompassing substance consumption and debauched indulgences, to assimilate with their peer cohort. This ignites multifarious threats, not only to the somatic and psychological well-being of these impressionable adolescents but also to the impending specter of legal censure and social reprobation.

Additionally, the regulatory agency of peer influence, far from being an innocuous agent of camaraderie, possesses the latent potential to occlude individuality and extirpate personal identity. The magnetic allure of group conformity, in its more potent manifestations, potentially incites individuals to disavow their dearly held values and renounce their innate passions in the inexorable quest for conformity. The resultant repercussions include arrested self-actualization and the preclusion of the unbridled exploration of unique talents and idiosyncrasies.

In summation, the variegated tapestry of peer influence, replete with contrasting facets, undeniably wields considerable sway over the comportment and vicissitudes of the adolescent cohort. While the boons intrinsic to positive peer pressure are starkly conspicuous, notably in the realms of motivation and the cultvation of pivotal social dexterity, it is incontrovertible that the attendant liabilities, prominently featuring injurious behaviors and the stifling of individuality, are equally trenchant. Thus, it becomes incumbent upon the burgeoning generation to adroitly calibrate the scales of influence, ensuring that the choices they make are circumspect, fostering a trajectory of personal evolution that is both discerning and positive.
evaluation:

- The essay adequately addresses the given task by exploring both the advantages and disadvantages of peer pressure.
- The candidate presents ideas in a clear and coherent manner, with a logical flow of information.
- The essay covers all parts of the task and provides appropriate support for arguments.

prompt: In some countries, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in. What are the reasons for this? How can people research this?
essay:
Nowadays, lots of people are being notices of becoming more interested in knowing about the past of the house they live in. 

Everyone has his own reasons for knowing this history, despite some of the reasons that could be mutual. First of all, people tend to have a great connection with the house they lived in since they were children. Furthermore, they don’t like to leave for a new residential district. Accordingly, they become more open to knowing more about it. On the other hand, those residents are more likely to sell the house so they will start searching for the history of the building. Provided that they have found the needed information, they will not solely sell a house but also sell the story of the building. This means the seller earns tons of money, ,however the buyer feels proud of the place they will move to.

Finding out about the history of a given house is yet an easy mission. It requires hours of research, hardworking, and attention to dates and timelines. In my humble opinion, there are quite a few steps people can follow to accomplish this mission. Firstly, by asking their parents if they might know any information regarding the history of the house. Unless they find anything, they shall search for the sale contract of the building at which they will be able to know who was the owner of the house. Finally, they will look for the ex-owners and ask them about the place. 

All in all, searching for the history of the building is not an easy mission. It requires patience and dedication but sooner or later after following the aforementioned steps, they will definitely finish their mission and reach their goal.

prompt:
some people believe that studying at university or college is the best rout to a successful career, while other believe that it is better to get a job straight after school.

Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
It is becoming extremely challenging for young individuals to decide what career they want to choose straight after school. Consequently, some argue that universities and colleges should be necessary to complete, so that young individuals can develop their professional skills and get ready to build a successful life. I strongly agree with this statement, because schools provide individuals just with basic knowledge which has to be improved further through higher institutions.

First and foremost, even though schools have a variety of subjects, it is not enough for starting a working career. This is mainly because professions require specific knowledge of skills which need to be mastered during higher education. For instance, to work as a teacher, in any country, it is crucial to learn how to manage a class with many children, organise lessons and  follow a particular school's curriculum. Hence, developing professional abilities before working at school will help to prevent problems during the teaching process.

Additionally, the child who just finished school is still immature to work in a professional environment, as they have never experienced it before. Universities and colleges provide a great opportunity for students not to participate in theoretical subjects only, such as lectures and seminars, but also to participate in the placement where individuals can practice their skills getting familiar with an employment space. Take Melbourne University, for example, which collaborates with many local companies to employ students for volunteer jobs.

In conclusion, even though some universities need to be paid a tuition fee, it is worth doing so as they offer a range of possibilities to expand students' knowledge, as well as prepare them for a future career. Hence, I strongly believe that higher education is vital for those who want to be successful and confident in a new working environment.

prompt: Some people think that one of the best ways to solve environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuel. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
The world is now surrounded by many urgent environmental problems, and many people feel that raising the cost of fuel is one of the most effective ways of combatting them. Although I tend to agree with this viewpoint, I believe there are other environmental measures that need to be taken. 

Increasing petrol prices would help save the environment in many ways. As the number of vehicles on the roads is increasing dramatically, so is the amount of vehicular emissions released into the atmosphere. However, if governments increase fuel costs, this solution would serve as a deterrent for people who drive their private cars, reducing air pollution and ozone layer depletion. Besides discouraging people from driving their private cars, this would also generate income to make further investments in environmental initiatives. Given these potential benefits of raising fuel prices, is it hardly surprising to see so many countries applying it to practice.

Apart from increasing the cost of fuel, we can also implement other solutions to environmental issues. For instance, on an individual level, people who want to help the environment should become more environmentally responsible by buying eco-friendly products, and reusing and recycling plastic bags. They can also take public transport as opposed to their personal cars, which produce toxic fumes. From a government’s perspective, it is essential to switch to green energy sources, such as solar and wind, rather than continuing to rely on gas and petrol. Thus, environmental protection goes beyond just raising fuel prices. 

In conclusion, though I attach great importance to the practice of increasing fuel costs, I think that both individuals and governing bodies should become environment-oriented in their mindset to tackle environmental problems.
evaluation:

prompt: In some countries, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in. What are the reasons for this? How can people research this?
essay:
In a number of corners in the world, there is a growing interest in researching the historical background of the appartments occupied by nation. This essay will consider possible causes of this interest and decide on how people can accomplish this goal.

To begin with, knowledge about the history of the building contains much valuable information such as the date of construction and which materials were used. These facts contribute to safety of the building and its financial and historical value. For instance, if residents know that the house they live in is obsolete or made of breakable wood, it is much easier for them to determine what actions and renovations should be undertaken in order not to let the building be destroyed. Moreover, knowing what historical events took place in a specific building or what architect designed a facade might rise the building's costs significantly and make it unique. Taking Almaty, my hometown, as an example, there are expensive appartments in the city centre which have faced a lot of important historical revolutions and were constructed in an outstanding way attracting local celebrities.

While doing research on the history of the accommodation can have numerous advantages, it is challenging to obtain precise data because the only way to do it by examinating official documents from the local authorities. The problem is that people must prove that they live in the certain building in order to find out about its history. For example, in my country, this issue is common because the access for information about the living areas is limited and can be granted to dwellers only, However, it is still feasible to determine the decade when the house was built judging by its design because this feature changes every time.

In conclusion, the rising interest on the house's background is reasonable due to safety concerns and the desire to establish the house's worth. I would recommend to conduct research based on documents issued by reliable sources because it's the most accurate data.

prompt: Detailed descriptions of crimes on newspaper and TV can have bad consequences on society, so this kind of information should be restricted on media. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay:
In today’s society, many detailed crime descriptions flood newspapers and TV. In my opinion, although the dissemination could lead to negative influences on society, an outright ban on this kind of information should not be imposed on mass media altogether. 

     It is beyond doubt that massive descriptions of crimes in detail can have negative influences on society. Firstly, this can be detrimental to children's growth. This is because the details of crime normally carry numerous questionable contents, including bloodiness and violence, and are considerably widespread through mass media like newspapers and TV on a repetitive basis, which have adverse impacts on children’s growth in a long run. Secondly, the broad exposure of crime descriptions in mass media may potentially result in youth crime. This is because that teenagers might be vulnerable to imitate negative behaviors from what they have seen from media. For example, the popularity of a series of gangster movies titled “Gu Huozai” caused many teenagers to imitate the plots of the movie, becoming gang members to do many illegal things such as theft and robbery. Therefore, crime details in mass media do have bad consequences on our society.

However, taking into account the aforementioned viewpoints does not necessarily yield an absolute conclusion that this kind of information should be forbidden in media for all. Acknowledging the latest criminal means through newspapers and TV could warn people to be precautionary, as a large number of people get information from the platform of media. So appropriate dissemination must be allowed. 

In conclusion, it is undeniable that detailed crime descriptions in mass media may have bad effects on society. However, it does not inherently guarantee an indisputable view that we should restrict such information altogether.
evaluation:

prompt: Some people think that one of the best ways to solve environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuels for cars and other vehicles. To what extent do you agree or disagree ?
essay:
In the last few decades, there has been an increase in problems related to the environment. Although some people believe that the best way to limit the issues is to increase the cost of fuels for vehicles and promote environmental eco-friendly vehicles, while others believe that those who need vehicles will use them regardless of fuel prices. This essay will discuss in detail and explain why I think, increasing the price of fuel is not the only solution.

Firstly, increasing the cost of fuel will lead to a hike in the prices of food products. For example, wholesalers use vehicles to transport their food and other products to their store location. This leads to an increase in service tax by the sellers including transportation charges and thus an increase in the cost price of the product. Also, the government should promote e-bikes and bicycles rentals as they are more eco-friendly and cheaper than public transport. Hence, an increase in the cost of fuel will not resolve the environmental problem permanently.

Secondly, people who are rich can still pay the higher prices for the fuel whereas the middle and lower class people do get impacted due to the prices. Rather than increasing the prices, the government should set up awareness campaigns for the public so that citizens understand the environmental issues and learn different ways to limit them. Campaigns like,  promoting the use of electric vehicles, providing subsidies on purchasing them or interest-free loans on eco-friendly vehicles.

To sum up, the above problems cannot be dealt with individually but needs collective effort from the government and the public. Therefore, I certainly think that there are other better methods to resolve the environmental issues rather than increasing the fuel prices.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement:**

- The candidate has adequately addressed the task by presenting their opinion and supporting arguments.

- However, the response lacks depth and fails to fully explore the counterarguments or provide specific examples to support their stance.

prompt: Advertisements are becoming more and more common in our everyday life. Is it a positive or negative development?
essay:
The number of advertisements is increasing sharply in people's daily life. However, some individuals claim that this development is beneficial for human life but some believe advertisements can lead to a wide range of negative concerns for customers. Moreover, this essay is going to discover both sides behind this trend. 

On the one hand, advertisements would bring a lot of profit to several businesses when they rely on advertising to attract more people, especially small businesses. To illustrate, customers are frequently attracted by some products in advertisements because these usually provide a ton of exaggeration in order to make their products become much more fascinating, appealing, and qualified. Moreover, advertising also helps shoppers to prefer wisely among a huge number of products on the market. On the other hand, some also say that advertisements can lead to various negative influences on the environment such as releasing a ton of paper and other materials while creating an advertisement video. Besides that, advertising is believed to be misleading due to its exaggeration, which can distract individuals a lot. For instance, customers may make mistakes while shopping such as purchasing unqualified stuff and their money will be wasted. To conclude, there are still both many advantages and drawbacks of advertisements, however, the downsides tend to outweigh the positives. Therefore, all generations need to be responsible for reducing the frequency of advertising on television and social media platforms in order to help the environment become a better and more eco-friendly location for everyone.
evaluation:

prompt:
Some people think that instead of preventing climate change, we need to find a way to live with it. To what extent do you agree or disagree?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay:
Every living organisms life are influenced by the weather system. Due to different types of pollutions, global warming and other factors the climate begins to change. A few peoples have the opinion that finding a living method according to the climate method is the better choice than that of controlling climatic changes.

Climate plays a significant role in the food products we consume daily to survive. Though we have a plethora of varaities of food across the world, every country will choose their own variety of food which suits their climatic condition. Frequent climate change will also impact the cultivation of crops. Mostly, farmers select the crops to be cultivated based on the seasons. For example, In India, the northern half remains to be cold and dry, so the farmers will cultivate wheat whereas, in southern half will have good rain and also it remains warm in few months of the year so the farmers in the south will choose rice. Even though we are in the technology developed world, there is no alternative found for food.

Not only humans but also other living organisms will also affect by this climatic change. Most of the animal breed based on the climate only as a consequence of climatic change the particular animal may move to the verge of extinction. Furthermore, It will also affect the trees and plants across the world. Factually, the average life span of trees are around 60 years and also they will grow based on the climate and soil types alone. If the climate started to change, there is a high probability of extinction of the trees. Trees are the major oxygen producer of the world, humans inhale oxygen to live. As a result, there is no possibility for the survival of the living organisms in the world.

In conclusion, by the above discussion, I strongly oppose the opinion of finding the method to live according to the climate change. If we chose there is less probability to get a high success rate. Because it requires the reconstruction of the whole world based on the climate changed which includes food, trees etc.
evaluation:

prompt:
The shortage of housing in big cities can cause severe consequences. Only government action can solve this problem.

To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Real estate has been drastically grown in metropolitan areas. The inability to provide a living area for the people in major cities is creating huge trouble whereas people believe that actions from authority alone will resolve the issue. I will examine all the possible aspects of this problem in this essay.

Finding the right place to live in a huge town has now become a big problem as the majority of the area has been constructed already. Hence we are required to go further to the city outskirts to find shelter. When we tend to move further away, we have to spend a lot of time on travel to work and other essentials. Also, we will not be having the facilities like the municipality in terms of sewage, transportation, and water. We also have to bear the cost of the above facilities which will increase the monthly wages.

Some individuals believe that only the government action will eradicate this situation and fulfill their needs in terms of providing a livable environment in the urban area. They want the ministry to take a look into the housing requirements and come up with a development plan which will lead them into a peaceful area. I strongly admire that without the people who are willing to take care of the responsibilities, the government can not achieve a solution. We as an individual have to try for a solution within our range like bringing the basic facilities to the place where we live and creating some employment in local itself.

To conclude, A place of residence is a very basic need for everyone in the world. When working in a huge town we might face hardships finding a residence. But we should be ready to face and rectify it instead of relying on the government to announce some scheme to resolve the difficulty.

prompt:
SOME PEOPLE BELIEVE THAT PURCHADING OMPORTES ARGRICULTURAL PRODICTS HAS A POSITIVE EFFECT. Others think consuming domestic products is better. 

Dicuss both these views ang give your own opinion.
essay:
There are differing opinions regarding consuming agricultural products or buying products planted in our country. To content the food demand, it is necessary to deliver food abroad. However, from my perspective, I prefer to consume domestic foods to support local farmers.

 

On the one hand, Taiwan is an intense island with limited resources. People would like to exert each land’s value. To make the world operates more efficiently then importing is essential. For instance, Taiwan imported numerous economic crops from America due to mechanical farming methods are much cheaper than Taiwan. Regarding worldwide, the same products which make the less consumption of natural resources are more environmentally friendly. In this concern, shipments of agriculture and trading products foster eco-friendly.

 

Nevertheless, the complex economic system is not only for efficiency but also for employment rates. Concerned with the entire worldwide operation, if people solely consume aboard products, it could cause abundant farmers to lose their jobs. Furthermore, recently the farmland decreased and was substituted into factories. It could lead to other environmental issues such as air pollution and decreased species diversity. With the healthy awareness arousing, citizens prefer to purchase local products than imported foods, which even are more expensive. People care about the food’s quality and it can reduce transportation distances. Besides, accelerating local district economic growth can make the country's system operation more stable and also could enhance social bonding.

 

In conclusion, it is still essential to import agricultural products that Taiwan’s weather is not suitable for. However, consuming local products can make people more healthy and improve job opportunities.

prompt: As major cities in the world are growing today, so do their problems. What are the problems for young people who are living in the cities as the result of continued growth? What are the solutions for these problems?
essay:
It is true that the nations have increasingly developed, which means that current generations of these countries face a significant number of pressures when residing in the metropolises. In this essay, I will point out the origins of this phenomenon, and suggest several methods to mitigate it. 

To begin with, several factors act as a catalyst for such a phenomenon. First, the competition in vocations is increasingly serious. To be specific, the proportion of newly-graduated students is extremely high, but available occupations are unable to meet their needs. In fact, in Vietnam, almost all businesses only employ staff who have over one year of experience, which results in a significant number of unemployed individuals. Second, adults who migrate to metropolises always have the pressures of success. To elaborate, said citizens always want to have a new life with a stable income to take care of their family and themselves. In the long run, this destructively impacts their psychology such as depression. 

Fortunately, this phenomenon can be tackled when various measures are taken. The most pertinent point is that The coalition between universities and firms would create career opportunities for undergraduates. Specifically, these days, universities would arrange for  final-year students to intern at numerous firms to have practical knowledge. In reality, at  Foreign Trade University in VietNam, teachers frequently organize professional events to help undergraduates orientate their lines of work in the future. Another justification is that households and communities play an important role in the developing career of adults. In particular, families and society should communicate and accompany them in the built-processing careers of the young in urban centres. In addition,current generations are encouraged to engage in clubs to decrease stress. 

In conclusion, it is disputable that the rate of unemployment and the pressure of life are menaces for minors in cities. Therefore, the combination between schools and families is of paramount importance in alleviating it.
evaluation:

- The candidate has adequately addressed the task by identifying the problems faced by young people in cities and suggesting solutions.

prompt:
Some people believe that the best way of improving public health is by increasing sport facilities. Others believe this will have little effect and than other measures.
Discuss both views and give your opinion
essay:
Ways of improving the general wellbeing of the entire populace has been a subject of discussion in recent years. While a sect of people is of the opinion that a significant addition to the existing number of sport facilities represents the best way of improving physical conditions of the public, others opine that having a large number of such facilities would not have the desired effect. This essay will discuss both views and explain why other measures such as reducing pollution in the environment and routine vaccinations against spreadable diseases are better options that can be utilized to achieve this aim.

On the one hand, sports and sporting activities present a perfect escape route and a means for de-stressing.  As people engage in sports like running, cycling, they are able to build up their body muscles, blow off steam, and also get adequate blood flowing within their body system properly. In addition, watching sports as a form of entertainment also helps to relax the entire system thereby improving both mental and physical wellbeing of the people. Therefore, increasing the number of sport facilities would not only present an avenue for more people to both partake in sport activities and enjoy the view as a spectator, but also help them relax and forget about their current stress.

However, measures such as significant reduction of air pollution can have greater effects on increasing the overall fitness of the populace. A lot of pollution related health problems have been reported in several developing countries. Finding a solution to this pertinent problem would greatly aid both physical and mental conditions of the public. To add to this, routine vaccinations against spreadable diseases would also ensure that more people are in better shape Healthwise. For example, frequent immunizations for the flu disease would significantly boost the immune system.

In conclusion, this essay discussed the use of increased sports facilities as a tool for improving the public wellbeing as well as other measures such as pollution reduction and vaccinations. In my opinion, while sports activities can help to improve our general outlook, utilizing other measures as discussed in the essay presents a far better option and would generate greater and optimum results.
evaluation:

prompt: Any country should be able to sell goods to other countries without the restrictions of the government. Do you agree or disagree?
essay:
There should be  free trade among nations with no limitations from local governing bodies on the import of items from  other nations. This will allow  access to globally available technology and medications to everyone. Furthermore, it will establish a good relationship between people of different localities. It will increase the economical gap among the republics. I partially agree with the statement and elaborate further in the next coming paragraphs. 

To begin with, this will allow the developed states to export their products to underprivileged areas and in ,return they can get  cheaper raw materials from those territories. Additionally, those republics can achieve a workforce with lower wages, this means that such companies will make more profit and contribute to the GDP of the country. Moreover, well-educated and skilful people will migrate to developed countries, meaning brain drain will take place in third-world places. For instance, some African nations going through a shortage of doctors and nurses due to  migration. Hence, this will widen the gap between the terrains.

On the other hand, poor countries will become  poorer in regard to money,manpower and technical skills. For example, the duty-free export agreement with China leads Pakistan to the edge of bankruptcy with inflation rising in  every field. Such kind of business reduces the foreign currency reserve of the region to a critically low level, pushing them into debt. Similar way labour and service industry is going to suffer as there will be no customers.

In conclusion, considering the effects of  open trade on both exporters and importers, it will be harmful to the recipient party and fruitful to sending company. That's why I agree in part with the idea of tax-less transactions.
evaluation:

- The candidate has addressed the task by providing arguments for and against the statement, although the response lacks a clear stance and could benefit from a more explicit conclusion.
- The ideas are presented somewhat coherently, but there is a lack of depth and development in the arguments.

    - "there should be free trade" -> "there should be unrestricted free trade"
    - "developed states" -> "developed countries"
    - "underprivileged areas" -> "less developed countries"
    - "get cheaper raw materials" -> "obtain raw materials at lower costs"
- Suggested Band Score (Lexical Resource): 6.0

    - "There should be free trade" -> "I believe that there should be unrestricted free trade"

prompt:
Some people think that it is a waste of money for countries to host big sporting events like the world cup, and that the money would be better spent on other things. However, others think that hosting large sporting events has a clear, positive impact on a country.


Discuss both these views and give your opinion.
essay:
People hold contradictory opinions regarding governmental funding for holding sports events. Critics decry it as an inefficient allocation, and state that other essential infrastructures deserve this monetary aid, however, others think in contrast. I will discourse on either side in this essay, and state my opinion.

Opponents of international sports state that it is a wastage of resources, particularly for developing countries. Because poverty alleviation and other substructures should be the utmost priorities for any authority. Such important issues are likely to be dilapidated if a huge sum of money is disbursed on sporting events, such as cricket or the football world cup. By eliminating poverty, nations grow as a whole and more mouths can be fed than before, unlike when the government prefers to spend money on sports. Furthermore, a mass gathering of people at sports ground can further cause problems for the state to tackle as the crowd can be vulnerable to safety threats, and providing security to the audience can be exorbitant too. Hence, funding on big sports events is less essential than alleviating poverty which may have longer-lasting impacts.

Nevertheless, others believe hosting Olympic games between different nations relaxes political tension and builds rapport among diverse ethnic groups. Folks from around the world gather for a shared viewing experience and to root for their teams. For example, in the PSL Cricket tournament in Pakistan, people from around the country were on the same page irrespective of their cultural background. Besides, the government generated hefty revenue by selling sports match tickets to the audience, which is another productive impact of hosting such events. To illustrate this, various countries struggle to take the honour of congregating cricket world cups in their homeland to support local markets to merchandise their products during these matches, such as hotels are fully booked on match days. Therefore, it can be said that conducting such sports is worth spending financial resources on them.

To conclude, although other crucial issues require governments' attention and funding, yet I believe the significance of sports tournaments can not be neglected. It is irrefutable that people from around the globe tend to partake in sporting events and develop harmony with each other. Besides that, governments further generate capital in turn.

prompt: Some people think that technology makes life overly complex, so we should make life simpler without using the technology. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Nowadays, technology is a crucial part of human life. The community might lose a sense of life without technology. There is argued that life gets more messed up by futuristic devices. A simpler life is created without using technology. On the other hand, I personally disagree with the statement. I conversely think that things are simpler and easier with  technology. This essay will substantiate my opinions in the paragraph below

To begin with, the first following reason is technology provides time-efficient for people. Technology radically exemplifies fast and easy solutions. For example. a cleaning robot machine is one type of smart household machinery. There are several functions to cleaning and wiping the floor by itself. People who own it can do other important work instead of cleaning the house. The time-saving positively occurred.

Secondly, advanced machinery gives better life management in many aspects. Most of the population own a mobile smartphone currently whereas online applications are easily installed into the phones. Business management has been done online by  smartphones. For instance,  before era technology does not exist. if we want to do the financial activity with the banks such as transfer money we must go to the actual bank but now we can do it via smartphone within two to three minutes. As well as reminding us what we have to do in online schedules is help us to know what we should do on workdays.

In a nutshell, all the explained reasons above have shown how life gets  easier with  technology. Time-consuming and well management in life are provided by technology. I strongly believe that life will get more complicated without technology.

prompt: The range of technology available to people is increasing the gap between the rich and the poor. Others think it has an opposite effect. Discuss both views and give your opinion. Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay:
The advantages of technology give us a lot of opportunity to develop themselves and our economy. Nevertheless, the growing of technologies are shared our society to two parts: one part become richer, another become poorer. Some people think that it is opposite effect for our society, while others believe conversely. In the following paragraphs I will present both opinions and  present my perspective.

Undoubtedly, the range of technologies are increased our economy and the intellect of people. People become more affrodable to knowledge because technologies give us opportunity to work with our mind not by hands, therefore we safe our energy to think For instance, people who take a chance, become rich: producers of TV, computers, phones and other devices, also people who can work with technology, because they are demanded in the market place.

By the way, we know a lot of people who cannot work with devices, computers, especially elderly people. It is hard for them to find jobs. Another point that people who work by hands waste their time and make less things than equipment. To illustrate this, modern industries use equipments, few operators and manager who can control it. Therefore, a lot of people can find job, because workers by hands not are demanded in the contemporary world.

In conclusion, it is a bog problem for our society, and without job people cannot to educate their children and be healthy. In my point of view people have to be adapt and flexible and be open to knowledge and new resources not only to be rich, also to live with their society equally.

prompt: Some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to a successful career, while others believe that it is better to get a job straight after school. Discuss both views and give your opinion

Many people are of the opinion that younger' priority for a successful career is taking courses from higher education. However, some believe that getting jobs after finishing high school is better. This writer was in two minds and will discuss  both sides in this essay.

It is vital to understand that the higher qualifications students have, the better job they will get. They spend approximately four years on courses which taught they massive and professional knowledge in their fields such as law, and engineering. This means young people will gain expert knowledge and have more opportunities for promotion in their work. On the whole, a plan for further education after high school should be set up by young people.

It can be clearly seen that late teens will gain experience from early jobs which is essential for their career. During their work, they can always learn from their mentors some skills such as communicating and networking. Hence, this leads late teens to be more mature and able to solve problems in the working environment. Therefore, they can easily have better place due to their soft skills.

Personally, I hold the belief that students will gain more and more benefits from higher education. Although early jobs are attractive to teenagers, the university not only gives you specialized knowledge but also improves students' coop skills. 

All things considered, although getting work is an upward trend among youngers, more and more companies are likely to hire employees who have degrees or better qualifications.

prompt: The increase in the production of consumer goods results in damage to the natural environment. What are the causes of this? What can be done to solve this problem?
essay:
There has been a rise in producing consumer products, which leads to harmful impacts on the natural environment. While there are some reasons why this trend happens, several solutions can be taken to solve this problem.

To begin with, this tendency happens due to a number of reasons. The first one is that the more products people manufacture, the more trash such as defective items people throw at the nature, especially the aquatic habitat. This would result in water or air pollution. Additionally, in order to get necessary materials such as wood for the manufacturing process, businesses’ owners normally have to gain them by exploiting from the environment, which could lead to deforestation or soil erosion. For example, the Son Tung logging company used to cut trees a lot, which led to the biggest flood ever recorded in the history of Vietnam.

Fortunately, several measures can be done to deal with this issue. Firstly, entrepreneurs can apply technological developments to recycle trash, so that, these trash can be used again and again. By following this idea, enterprises can reduce the regularity of leaving trash in the nature. Secondly, the government should apply some laws against exploiting natural resources. For example, if I keep illegally deforesting the Amazon rainforest despite not being allowed to do it, I might result in  permanently being in jail as a punishment or even being put to death penalty.


In conclusion, when manufacturing consumer goods, people exploit resources from and throw trash at the environment, which would lead to negative impacts on nature. Applying the newest technologies and some strict laws can help to solve this serious issue.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement:**
- The candidate has addressed all parts of the task and provided relevant reasons and solutions to the issue of environmental damage caused by consumer goods production.
- The ideas are presented in a clear and coherent manner.

prompt:
Some people think that instead of preventing climate change, we need to find a way to live with it.
To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Nowadays, many countries are facing  the same issue, which is climate change. Therefore, people think that instead of preventing weather change,  they better find a solution to deal with this problem. I agree with this statement. In this essay, I will explain both situations and my personal view. 

To begin with, global warming has been an enormous problem on the earth for years. Today, weather changes a lot compared with  the past. In some, countries the weather is getting very hot around 48 to 52 degree. Other countries are getting a lot of rain and hail. Therefore, these changes are affected people live, especially farmers. For instance, in Australia Victoria , in the past five years, a lot of table grape farms had been damaged by hail. Although, some farmers are covered by insurance, while others are not. Thus, they feel so stressed about the climate changes. 

On the other hand, some people believe that, if we cannot control the weather,  we got to deal with it. Hence, humankind is thinking a lot of different ways to protect their businesses. For example, some fresh fruit farmers are building shine-houses to protect wind and hail damage, and they are satisfied with this idea.  

In summary, a global warming is the bigger issue in today society. Many folks believe, if they cannot prevent the bad weather,  they should get a better way to live with it. I strongly agree that we have to find a solution to deal with climate change, as we cannot control the weather, so we should do something to prevent this environmental issue.

prompt: Some people believe that watching television is bad for children. Other people believe that watching television is educational for children. Which opinion do you agree with and why?
essay:
It is thought that enjoying television is an advantage for children by some people, however, there is another opinion that it is a disadvantage to raise children. While watching television to cause a become poor communication with friends, it is an essential option to learn about the rules of society. 


There are several opinions of watching television. First, according to TBS company’s survey in Japan about tv programs, how much watching TV is affected to 6 to 10 years old children are compared between A group who are watching tv shows a prolonged period time, and B group who people are not watching television for long time. In fact, there is a wide difference that the former’s communication ability was lacking. Furthermore, their physical strength was less developed than later. This is said to be one of the huge problems that we have to consider it. 

Nevertheless, watching tv shows is believed by some people to be a useful source in order to educate children, since nowadays television companies create diverse programs, namely learning English and other country’s cultural channels. In addition, currently, tv has been developed so that children can connect and join to tv shows in real time by SNS. In the other words, a kid does not have to feel lonely when he or she is at home alone owing to their parents’ job. 

In conclusion, enjoying tv program is a good way to teach them about making friends and building communication skills, but it is believed that it has several negative effects on teenagers in their childhood.

what are the reasons for this?
How can people research this?
essay:
Nowadays, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in.The old buildings which were built over 100 years ago are rare to find out  these days.

        To begin with, some of the engineers and rich men were interested in the ten decades houses and buildings because they can learn the structure  with  old techniques to build a house which inspired by. On top of that, there is a quote ' Old but Gold' this means no matter what new things are becoming popular but can not compare to  antiques. For instance, Bagan has been existing for many years ago and we can know the skill of the people of the city by seeing the architecture. For this reason, the culture and traditions of Bagan are really great  and unique at that time. Thus, this is announced as one of the UNESCO places in the world.  Archaeologists, historicism and engineer are always visiting  historical places and buildings to gain  knowledge .On the plus side, these are very effective and useful to apply in our living lifestyle. In addition to this , a few high-class men try to buy them to make renovations and then open them as a museum for the new generation at the same time they earn a lot of money from that. But for some people who just want to maintain culture and tradition. In addition to this, younger students are always motivated with pride when they went to take a  tour and sightseeing around this kind of place.And now every government give a huge favour to the historical places in other to make tourist attraction and show their glory and  dignity.

          In conclusion, every intention to conserve  the historic places and buildings is deeply honourable. People also should try to focus and involve  in some maintaining projects with obeying the rules and regulations.

prompt: Nowadays celebrities are more famous for their glamour than for their glamour and wealth than for their achievements and this sets a bad example to the young people. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
In the present days, some people obey that a notable person receiving prosperity without the appropriate and sufficient efforts. Therefore, this phenomenon has sparked heated debates among individuals for the excessive acquirement of the celebrities that obtain the reputation without a proper performance and contributes to a bad role model among young adults. In my opinion, I totally disagree with this statement and in order to receive a reputation its required large efforts from the celebrity themselves.
To begin with, to become a public figure, the celebrity must provide the large effort as well as performance for having spots in the society. Besides, it required great talent and potential to become remarkable and noticeable. As a result, their potential is sufficient for having a large achievement and fulfilment. prompt:
Many people argue that in order to improve educational quality, high school students are encouraged to make comments or even criticism of their teachers. Others think it will lead to a loss of respect and discipline in the classroom. 
Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
It is widely believed that for a country to prosper, it is of paramount importance to assure a high level of educational standard. In order to do so, some people claim that high school students should be able to make comments or even criticism on their teachers, which I believe would be beneficial despite the view that it could lead to a disrespectful and undisciplined study environment. 

It is understandable why some people have voiced their concern over the act of students being able to judge their own teachers. To them, doing so means teachers and students are on equal terms, which can trigger the rebellious side in the latter and they may make comments full of animosity directed at their teachers, which is undoubtedly a sign of disrespect. In addition, some are afraid that teachers being judged might lose their authority, which can be an opportunity for delinquents at school to wreak havoc and cause trouble. Nevertheless, I believe these problems can be dealt with if there is proper regulation about student comments. For instance, any feedback without solid evidence or one showing prejudice can be disregarded when evaluating the performance of teachers.

On the other hand, I concur that having students give presumably constructive comments can be advantageous to the educational system as a whole. The key rationale is that teachers and instructors are presented with a chance to self-reflect, which means they might adopt a more student-centred approach while teaching. To illustrate, some teachers in international schools in Vietnam have chosen a facilitator style in class, after comments from students and parents. Even with the controversy this might raise, like shattering teacher’s self-esteem and causing them to quit; or the fact that graduate students might become reluctant when applying for a teaching role in view of the uneasy feeling of being judged, I believe that a teacher that is willing to change to strive for the better would be an invaluable asset to the education system.

To conclude, even though some people are against feedback and comments on teachers with the fear of losing discipline in class, I still support this idea, as it can really help teachers hone their teaching skills, benefitting the system in the long run. If there are some schools that are still adamant about this initiative, I suggest that they can use questionnaires first, before reverting back to written comments.

prompt: Some people think that family has the most powerful influence on a child’s development, while others think that other factors such as television, friend, music have the biggest effects. Discuss both views and give your opinion?
essay:
There has been much discussion revolving around the issue of whether parents or other aspects such as television and friend is more effective on a child's development. In my opinion, I believe that although the family has the biggest impact on children, overall the environment and media are more effective. This essay will consider these different elements of powerful influence sources, before concluding that they are all vital.

First off,  some insist that while education starts in the family, it has the biggest effect on a child’s development.  As younger children are more affected and they spend most of the time with their family, parents have great obvious influences on the children. For instance, children may behave similarly to their father or mother in the next ages. Additionally, there are some genetic effects on these heritage behaviours. Although genetics mostly remains in the phenotype, many scientists who have studies conducted on behavioural genetics, state genetics plays a big role in personality. 

Conversely, many think that the impacts of media and friend environment are bigger than the family. Since there is a variety of news on social media and traditional sources and spending most of their time online, children are more vulnerable to resistance. Also, youth people can influence emotionally by famous people in movies or even songs of their favourite singers and it can affect to change their character. Taking scientific research as an example, it can be seen that the biggest proportion of children's role models are celebrities. Furthermore, kids are generally being a friend who has similar features to them and when they feel more close the friends, they can copy others' thought or disparities.

In conclusion, there is a debate about the biggest factor in a child’s development. From my perspective, even though both have many contributions to the child, the most powerful influence of the source is other factors such as friends, television and music rather than family.

prompt: Some people think that employers should not care about the way their employees dress, because what matters is the quality of their work. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
It is often argued that the dress code of employees is not necessary, it is simply because it does not affect the quality of their production. In my point of view, I agree with this opinion, however, it does not also show off the professionalism and respect of staff as well as formal clothes.

On the one hand,  employees do not need to care about clothes when they go to company. Firstly, it will make them more happy and motivated when they wear their favourite attire. Furthermore, they can wear normal dresses, which will make them more comfortable. For example, employees work in a private environment and  spend most of their time on a computer or laptop, comfortable clothes are easier to work in and make them more relaxed.

On the other hand, uniforms play a key role in service industries such as healthcare services or restaurants. Formal wear or uniform shows professionalism and respect for customers and clients will also realize waiters or waitresses faster, thus saving time and effort . Besides, it is fair for staff in the company and it is not indiscriminate poor or rich, so make staff more confident when they trial.  Hence, a certain type of job like receptionist requires people to dress properly so it cannot worsen the company’s productivity .

In conclusion,  although one’s clothing preference or dress code at task does not directly influence productivity, its relevance is worth considering depending on the nature of production.

prompt: Employment should give their staff at least a 4-week holiday a year to make employees better at their jobs. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Holidays are provided by companies to their personnel for various reasons. Some employment grants sick leave, casual leave as well as annual leave as per policy. In my opinion, I agree that a 4-week break a year is a great idea to make institute prosper at their jobs. It gives department extra encouragement as well as helps them to mitigate personal issues to feel tension-free with the help of a long break.

To begin with, catalyst is a key factor that enables staff to do well in their duties and having a 4-week break annually definitely helps. For example, After getting such a long leave personnel will come back to their workstation with reinvented energy as whatever dissatisfaction they have will fade away by the time they join. It is a natural boost for department to do well. Above all, desire is always a major factor in any type of responsibility.

On the other hand, Felling relieved is always a welcoming factor for any employee and having a 4-week holiday in a year job holders can easily solve their personal issues. According to  recent research by a Workforce provider organization, staff who stay tension-free in their job from personal issues do significantly well than those who don't. Relived employees from any type of family problems are always a plus point. Finally, with a long leave, Any external factors can be easily manageable.

In a nutshell, encouragement and feeling relief are key factors that contribute to workers' performance. I am in line with the fact that a 4-week layoff annually is an excellent thing to make employees shine at their duties. It is my recommendation that every organization should at least provide a 4-week holiday to make employees improve at their work.

Over the past few decades, the issue of housing shortage in an urban area has been a major concer because the pricely land caused serious problems in society. Althought some people claim that only goverments can deal with this issue, in my opinion with a combination both of the goverment and individual, this problem can be tackled  as I will discuss in the following essay. 


There is no doubt that goverments have power to establish legislation and subsidies. For example, goverments will fine real estate agencies if they overcharge in the amount of price to live in the city, Therefore, real estate agencies would provide a reasonable price to sale. Furthermore, another thing goverments can do is to provide financial supportted who buy housing in the city . A good example of this is Taiwan goverment share a proportion of money to subsidies people who buying a husing in the urban area. As a result, citizens can alleviate the financial burden. 



On the other hand, individual also need to take actions in order to deal with this issue. People should try  find vertical apartments instead of  private twonhouses in urban area. For example,  In Sigarpore, the marjoority people tend to live in high-rise building so that more people can live in the city. By doing this,  apartments can accommodate more population in the urban area. 


In Conculsion, despite the fact that government should take most responsibility, from my perspective, a combination of government and individul should be accordinated to solve the proble. Provided benefits as well as are encouraged people to live in urban area, this phenomenon can be alleviated.
