prompt: Housing shortages in big cities can cause severe social consequences. Some people think only  government action can solve this problem. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay: In recent years, the increasing population has caused trouble in purchasing lands. On the one hand,  the society argues the fact that authorities should make remedy actions to fix an issue of inadequate  residences. However, on other hand, people themselves should solve this issue. I partially agree  with the given statement, and I will provide the substantiate argument in upcoming  paragraphs.  To commence, the government should restrict the allocation of land. To put it another way, government should apply more taxes to real estate so that they limit the making of houses.  Moreover, a focus on vertical housing would help to resolve the issue of even distribution of  homes. As an illustration, the apartments, and townhouses in developed cities like Singapore,  are made in a vertical manner in limited areas. Furthermore, authorities should apply more taxes  to bungalows and large houses. Therefore, people would purchase less of them. As an example,  the Canadian government restrict the purchase of houses for two years to resolve the issue of housing shortage.  On a contrary, people could also solve this issue by themselves. To simplify, they should prefer  living in villages and outskirts of towns instead of living in bigger cities. People can find more job  opportunities like farming in villages to earn a livelihood. This would help in bringing more  employment in the country and in this manner, society could also develop the villages. The fresh air  of villages would also make people more healthy and less stressed. Therefore, it would reduce  crimes in society.  To conclude, although people move to metropolitan cities in search of better opportunities,  they still face residential issues. Therefore, it is the responsibility of both government and people to resolve the issue by encouraging people to live in vertical housing and villages.

In the process of learning history, some curricula need to be included to confirm that the students gain expertise. The argument is divided into two perspectives, whether the importance of local history or world history. In my opinion, both of them have the same merits, and this essay will explain them in detail based on experience.

Learning local history leads the students to know about the best practices used by their founders to rule the nations with the state systems and become developed countries. The students need to see this subject because, in the future, every nation will face some uncertainty problems where the decisions created by their founders could be considered to solve those problems in the future problem. For example, in Indonesia, the state systems have changed from the colonialization era to the new order era. At present, Indonesia has a stable system and is a democratic nation. Therefore, learning history is really important for students because they will be decision-makers for their countries.

On the other hand, learning international history also significantly impacts students in the middle of the globalization era. The student will know that some nations create bilateral or multilateral agreements with other countries because there is only a nation that can stand up to be a developed country with support from other nations in terms of exchanging knowledge in economy, technology, education, health, etc, 

In conclusion, the statement to learn local and world history is essential. While the knowledge to rule the country by the policy will be taken from this subject, the experience of why the country becomes a a developed country needs needs to be known by the student to increase ability as a decision-maker in the middle of globalization.

prompt:
Machines are taking over more and more jobs previously done by humans.  
Discuss the advantages and disadvantages
essay:
Nowadays most of the work has been done by instruments whereas ,in the past, it has been done by individuals. There are some benefits and drawbacks which will be discussed in the forthcoming paragraphs. 

To commence with, there are two main benefits to complete the job by machinery. Firstly, it helps to enhance the production by using instruments.  To elaborate it, owners prefer to use machinery to increase manufacturing capacity which leads to keep the making cost down. As a result, people can get better revenue by selling them at competitive price. Secondly, people who use machine tools to get consistency on product quality. To explain it, product quality plays a major role in the competitive market hence individuals intend to utilize the machinery to get the perfect products and stand with their competitors. 

On the contrary, there are multiple drawbacks to using machines to finish the job. In the first place, it could lead to unemployment in the society. In other words, if most of the jobs are accomplished by machinery, human intervention would not require in the workplace. As a consequence, workers may face difficulty to get a job. Furthermore, machinery products have less durability. To explain it, products which is made by instruments are delicate therefore consumers could not use those products for a longer period. Thus, individuals have to spend money on a periodical basis which causes  financial instability.

In conclusion, if individuals prefer to use machinery, they could get better work efficiency and stabilize the quality. However, it could rise unemployment in civilization and affect  products’ durability. Therefore, it is necessary to weigh the benefits against the drawbacks carefully to prevent  employment in society as well as work productivity.

prompt: More and more people are becoming seriously overweight. Some people suggest that the solution to this problem is to increase the price of  fattening foods. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
In this contemporary society, obesity is considered a global issue because of its consequences among all age groups. A large section of society claims a rise in the cost of junk food should solve this concern. This essay supports the assertion to a major extent despite some reasons such as due to a busy schedule.

 To begin with, increasing the price of fattening cooking can discourage individuals from purchasing the product, and as a result, this can reduce consumption. This means that it could  contribute to weight management and improve overall health initiatives. The best illustration as educational campaigns and fitness programs can help people  maintain their fitness as well as diet and also address the issue of junk feed roots. Probing ahead, having knowledge of nutrition is important for individuals to differentiate between healthy meals and foodstuffs that are high in fat.

Another perspective is, home home-cooked food is valuable. In today's fast-paced world, the community often do not have the time or energy to cook at home and prefers to grab meals from outside. However, this can lead to health issues, including obesity. Fast snacks and other take-out options may be convenient, but they are often high in calories, unhealthy fats, and added sugars. For instance, doctors always restrict the nation from consuming foods that contain fat in order to maintain good well-being and also encourage the public to focus on consuming a balanced and nutritious diet.

To conclude, Rising rates of fattening foods can influence individuals to consume more home-cooked meals, which are typically more nutritious. I believe that the aforementioned points support the viewpoint.

extent do you agree or disagree?

Overweight might be a serious issue nowadays. However, I disagree with those who have opinion that the solution of this case is to increase price of foods which consist of high fat, compared with those with have other alternatives. 

On the one hand, the increasing price of fattening foods might be a solution so that people would not tend to buy the expensive fattening food. They might think that to eat fattening foods needed maximal effort in the context of gaining money. The pricey fattening foods could also make the society become to prefer eat non high-fat foods so that they consume other nutrient components along with avoided by fatty foods. It could appeared an awareness about fattening foods.   

On the other hand, not all overweight people are poor, that is why this is not an effective method. Moreover, fat foods are also needed for some people who have underweight and not all of them are rich, it will cause the new problem, which called social-economic gap. In addition, either the obesity or overweight people could diet if they have the motivation for being ideal itself. For instance, an overweight person still try to make a lot of money to have the pricey fattening food as they want unless they have an intention for reducing their weight. Other methods that should be applied are the campaign of healthy lifestyle, such as exercise regularly, food diet, and so on.   

In conclusion, rising the price of fatty foods might make people think twice to buy fattening foods, however it is not an effective approach for making people become aware of overweight or obesity problem.

It is widely known that one of the most important modern science inventions is robotic system. In spite of its popularity, some people strongly believe that use of robots may have some negative effects on humanity in the future. In my way of thinking, it is the best thing that scientists have ever invented and there are no certain doubts that it will be one of the most crucial things in every industry. So, in this essay, I am going to prove my viewpoint with several arguments.

To begin with, it is necessary to understand that some field, such as mining or car producing are so dangerous for workers. For example, according to statistics, there are about 100 catastrophes in mining sector annually lead to the human’s deaths. As a result, a lot of companies all over the world have begun to use smart machines to reduce the number of dangerous situations during the working process. 

On the other hand, one of the possible reasons to scared is too smart AI system. Some part of society believes that in the near future robots would become uncontrolled and would become an enemy for humanity. Nevertheless, modern scientists consider that it is utterly unrealistic way, due to the fact that people mostly are so careful, especially in these field. 

In conclusion, I would like to say that it is very important to use new technologies. However, under no circumstances, should people expect that everything would be all right and do not use all the possible ways to protect themselves from the unexpected future.

prompt: In cities and towns all over the world, the high volume of traffic is a problem. What are the causes of this and what actions can be taken to solve this problem?
essay:
Needless to say, we are witnessing an alarming trend of  car over-usage. Starting from small towns to the metropolises, they are all full of an excessive number of vehicles on their roads. This essay will highlight the reasons for this modern-day issue along with would-be solutions. 

Nobody would argue with the fact that at the present day any consumer endeavours to obtain anautomobile by taking credit. Some individuals might consider this fact as a virtue, ,,however it exacerbates the situation on the roads. Moreover, there are various families where almost every member possesses a car inasmuch as many of them have a hectic lifestyle. Not only is it convenient to travel to work, but it is also considered to be prestigious.

However, the government in concert with local authorities can arrive at the solution by imposing heavy taxes on petrol. Consequently, most families would be confined to having one automobile for the whole family. Beyond any doubt, it will reduce the number of cars, and as a knock-off effect, decrease the amount of traffic congestion. In addition, in order to find an alternative , the option most avid drivers would consider switching to a bicycle, which certainly ensures the lack of potentially appalling traffic.

In summary, undoubtedly, today it has become trendy and necessary to own a personal vehicle. Therefore, the government is obligated to reduce traffic with the aid of either levying heavy taxes or supplying citizens with adequate road conditions in order to boost bicycle users among people.
evaluation:
### Task Achievement:
- The candidate has addressed the given task by discussing the causes and solutions for excessive traffic in cities and towns.
- The response presents ideas clearly and coherently, covering all parts of the task.
- The arguments are supported with relevant examples and explanations.
- Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 8.0

prompt: Some people argue that we should do research into their family history. Others, agree with the view that we should focus on the present and future generations. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
One school of thought holds that people should research their family roots as the best way to create a meaningful study, whereas others believe that concentrating on the present and later offspring is a better option. This essay attempts to shed light on both perspectives before concluding that I am in favour of the latter notion.

On the one hand, some individuals should study their ancestry origin due to a variety of factors. First, it must be affirmed that each person has his or her roots, a place called hometown, and a reason to be born, consequently, this exploration helps them to better understand their origin. It is really practical compared to the studies that are somewhat macroscopic and some of its contents that are vague and unverified. In addition, if parents deeply understand ancestry traditions, they will become an encyclopedia helping their offsprings understand their ancestor's origins. This knowledge, as a historical demonstration of each parentage, is summarized to help their descendants approach as quickly as possible. For instance, parents can help their sons and daughters understand their ancestor's history through brief stories every night before they are going to bed.

On the other hand, there are a host of compelling reasons why I am convinced that it is more beneficial to focus on succeeding generations. One reason is that children are the future of each parentage, the prosperity or survival of each family depends on their offspring. Therefore, parents need plans to orient their children to overcome upcoming difficulties and challenges. For example, the major Korean Cheabol Groups such as Samsung, LG, and Hyundai are very focused on training their children to become heirs to the family. Their descendants all go through an extremely harsh training and learning process to have forthcoming success, as Lee Jae-Yong - the current President of Samsung is a typical example. Another reason is that in the macro aspect, descendants are the factors that help their own country develop and compete with other countries, as a result, focusing on their education is more important than anything else.

In conclusion, while it is irrefutable that people could research their roots without any consideration for others, I would contend that it should be limited and focus on the next generations because of their indispensable influences on human's future.
evaluation:

- The candidate has addressed the task by discussing both views and providing their own opinion.
- The essay is generally clear and coherent, presenting ideas in a logical order.

prompt: Some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to a successful career, while others believe that it is better to get a job straight after school. Discuss both views.
essay:
Right after finishing high school, teenagers often wonder whether they should continue their education or get a job. While many believe studying at a college or university will be the best way to guarantee a successful career, others claim that working straight after school is a better option.

Start working straight after graduation is beneficial for several reasons. Firstly, young people can start earning money as soon as possible by working. As a result, they will be mature enough and able to live independently on their income. Secondly, a person who decides to look for a job rather than pursue higher education will likely have a chance to obtain a lot of real experience and practical skills. This may lead them to progress more quickly in their chosen profession.

On the other hand, some argue that it is more beneficial for young people to continue their studies after high school. Firstly, a college education prepares students to meet academic qualifications, which most employers require nowadays. Consequently, university graduates have opportunities to earn higher salaries than those without qualifications. In addition, the job market is becoming increasingly competitive since hundreds of applicants often chase one position in an organization. Having a degree is an obvious advantage that university graduates have. In many countries, students who graduate with an engineering degree are highly paid and have an easy time getting a good job.

In conclusion, working straight after high school and continuing higher-level studies have unique advantages.
evaluation:
## Task Achievement:
- The candidate has addressed the given task by discussing both sides of the argument, providing reasons and examples to support each view.
- The response is clear and coherent, with a logical flow of ideas.
- However, the candidate could have provided more specific examples and evidence to support their arguments.
- Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 6.5

## Coherence and Cohesion:
- The essay is well-organized with a clear introduction, body paragraphs, and conclusion.
- The use of linking devices (e.g., however, on the other hand) helps to connect ideas and paragraphs.
- The logical flow of information is evident throughout the essay.
- Suggested Band Score (Coherence and Cohesion): 7.0

## Lexical Resource (Vocabulary):
- The essay demonstrates a good range of vocabulary, including some academic vocabulary (e.g., qualifications, competitive).
- However, there are a few instances of inaccurate or overused vocabulary:
   - "start working straight after graduation" could be replaced with "enter the workforce immediately after high school."
   - "a lot of real experience" could be replaced with "valuable practical experience."
- Suggested Band Score (Lexical Resource): 7.0

## Grammatical Range and Accuracy:
- The essay displays a variety of sentence structures, including complex sentences and compound sentences.
- There are a few grammatical errors:
   - "Start working straight after graduation is beneficial for several reasons." should be "Starting work immediately after graduation has several benefits."
   - "Consequently, university graduates have opportunities to earn higher salaries than those without qualifications." should be "As a result, university graduates have the potential to earn higher salaries than those without qualifications."
- Suggested Band Score (Grammatical Range and Accuracy): 6.5

## Overall Band Score:
- The overall performance of the essay is good, with strengths in coherence and lexical resource.
- The essay addresses the task requirements, provides reasoned arguments, and uses appropriate language.
- However, there are a few areas for improvement, such as providing more specific examples and correcting grammatical errors.
- Suggested Overall Band Score: 6.5

## Feedback and Additional Comments:

**Strengths:**

- Clear and coherent organization
- Good use of linking devices
- Adequate range of vocabulary

**Areas for Improvement:**

- Provide more specific examples and evidence to support arguments.
- Correct grammatical errors.
- Expand the conclusion by summarizing the main points and restating the thesis statement.

**Strategies for Enhancement:**

- Read widely to expand vocabulary and learn new expressions.
- Practice writing complex sentences and compound sentences.
- Use a grammar checker or consult a grammar book to identify and correct grammatical errors.

essay:
Each coming day welcomes some new trend in a fastly progressing world like ours.One such new trend is the developing interest of people in the history of the place where they live or plan to do so.This essay would discuss the possible reasons for this trend and how can people do their research in this regard.

To begin with,people are more interested nowadays to know more about  their habitat due to a number of reasons like better connection to the place and surprisingly,fear of hauntings too.Firstly,many believe that to be better connected to a place they live in,knowing more about its history and facts is crucial to truly admire it and to be better attached to the place.For instance,people,especially when moving to a new place,avoid homesickness by researching about the new place,they move in.Secondly,some people these days are quite afraid of the haunting rumours due to the increasing horror genre movies' influence over people like many even abandon their current living place after listening to some scary story about it.Thus,increase in the trend of researching the history of the localities is increasing.

A number of ways are there to learn more about the past of localities which include the internet and the local libraries.Firstly,the internet is a great source of knowledge to dig about someplace.For example,anyone can know loads of stuff about their own building by just typing its name like when was it built,what was there before it,and even the names of people that owned it.Secondly,local libraries also maintain a catalogue of towns and cities which can also be a great source of such knowledge such as if someone wants to explore a street then he simply has to search by its number and he can simply access all the official information about it.Hence,in an age like this,access to this type of information is easily explorable.

To conclude,nowadays the public wants to know more about their living place which is not difficult at all in this age of information.With this increasing trend,it can be predicted that in the coming days the public will pay attention to the history of the place they are living in or they would consider buying.

prompt: Nowadays, more and more people decide to have children later in their life. What are the reasons? Do the advantages of this outweigh disadvantages?
essay:
In my opinion, the given statement stands partially true. Many of the married members of any family, prefer to have children at their early ages. Over the period, the decisions are changed. There could be many reasons for taking such decisions. For example, the raise in the cost of living. Due to increased prices of all the basic needs, people are finding it difficult in raising them, providing them the basic education, and taking care of them.

I believe this is the major reason behind taking such decision. Talking about the advantages and disadvantages, there is a wide scope for advantages being outweighed.

Planning for children after certain period of time, from the marriage day, it gives the couple/family a lot of time, to think about the future. Also in laying a path for their (children) lives. Parents will be able to plan according to their financial status, balancing the requirements. It given an advantage of planning their education, the best institution to chose, and also a strong support with some savings made.

Talking about the disadvantages of having children at early age, it becomes a big challenge in taking up such big responsibility. One should become more stabalized in terms of finance, and ready to spend a lot on education and other expenses.

Being a family of 5 members, with 2 siblings, I really found it very difficult for my parents in rising us. Since, they were not financially stable, and they had to make many debts for providing us all the basic needs like clothes, shelter (rented house), education fee, etc. It took them almost 20 years for them to clear all those debts. Hence I believe, and advice to the point of having children at right time, when couple are really ready to take the responsibility.
evaluation:

- The candidate has addressed the given task by providing reasons for people deciding to have children later in life and discussing the advantages and disadvantages of this trend.
- The response is clear and coherent, presenting ideas in a logical order.

In a conclusion,parents killing time with the children is very important for their children personal growth rather than allowing them to do their activities on their own.It is also suggested that,the more time parents spend with children in teaching them stories,the more good manners their children learn.

prompt: Some people think that all teenagers should be required to do unpaid work in their free time to help the local community. They believe this would benefit both the individual teenager and society as a whole. Do you agree or disagree?
essay:
It is often argued that the teenagers should contribute to help the community with unpaid work, since it would be benefit both. It is a very common thought that this type of contribute could help to educate the teenagers.  However, I strongly disagree with this point of view, as I believe that each job should be paid and free time is an important resource for the teenagers.

Firstly of all, a person who works has the right to be paid for their time. This is because the economic situation is not so good for several families and most of them has already started to work to help their family, such as pay the bills, pay the rent or the books to study. For example, I have started to work at the age of 16 years old to buy my scholarly books and help my family with other expenses. Without a job it would be impossible for me to attend the school.

Secondly, almost all teenagers attend the school. In other words, this means that grand part of their time is dedicated to the study and their free time is an important part to improve their mental health and reduce the stress. For instance, many doctors think the sports as whole help the students to increase the concentration.

To sum up, I think the work is an optimal instrument to help our teenagers to understand how works the life and to help them to realize their dreams.

prompt: Some people think that museums should be enjoyable places to entertain people, while others believe that the purpose of museums is to educate. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
Museums have had been playing a significant role to magnify the glory of a nation along with serving educational purposes. A segment of society opines that the sole aim of museums is to entertain folks; diametrically opposed to this, others believe that these places are more useful in imparting invaluable cultural value to the young generation. Both statements may advance equally compelling arguments, but I inclined the second notion for the reasons which are explained in the following paragraphs.

First and foremost, museums are the buildings that hold  invaluable information regarding the ancient era of human civilisation. How the human species have had been evolved from the first phase of the life cycle is clearly depicted in this architecture with pictures. For instance, the national museum Delhi has diverse articles from the magnificent ancient era including the statues of the kings of that period and their accessories like jewellery and clothes. Thereby, apparent visuals of these articles longer last than reading; these structures are the source of knowledge for those who are keen on exploring history.

Moving further, thanks to globalisation, it is easy to travel and investigate  other countries around the globe. The popularity of these monuments attract  tourists, therefore it would be cooler if these buildings have  modern amenities like air-conditioned halls and better visibility of the accessories, safe security system where children can roam and enjoy themselves to the fullest with their parents.

To conclude then, whilst there exist contrasting stances on the matter, it is taxing work to decide which one have a more positive outcome, howbeit, undoubtedly, museums are the prime source of ancient cultures and can upgrade the youngsters with the history, but it would be impeccable if these buildings have offered some entertainment along with a safe environment to the sightseers.

prompt:
Some people think that art is an essential subject for children at school while others think it is a waste of time.


Discuss both views and give your opinion


Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience. 


You should write at least 250 words.
essay:
There is a highly controversial issue relates to whether it is vital for children to learn art or not. In this essay, I will examine this question from both points of view and then give my own opinion.

On one side of the argument, there are many people who argue that art is an important subject for children to learn at school. The main reason why they hold this belief is because art can foster children’s creativity which is very fundamental to children’s career prospects. In order words, through drawing and painting, youngsters can develop creative thinking which can be applied in any fields of careers in the future. Hence, they could be very successful in their professions thanks to high level of creativity. For example, currently I am an English teacher of young children. Teaching children English, I have to be very creative enough to draw pictures to illustrate new vocabulary on the board every day. I see that my drawings and creativity were developed thanks to previous art lessons when I was in primary school.

On the other hand, it is also possible to make the opposing case. It is often claimed that joining  lessons of art at school is such a waste of time. People often have this opinion because art is not a compulsory element of many professions from which people can get high salaries. Nowadays, most of parents do not want their children to become artists, but professionals such as doctors or employees in Information Technology so that they can have high income. Hence, those parents do not want their children to spend time on art subject which is not important to their future careers. Instead, they force their children to make use of their time to study subjects that are helpful and directly related to their orentied professions in the future. 

In conclusion, I believe both points of view have their own merits. On balance, however, I feel that it is crucial for children to participate in lessons of art at school because it can help children improve their creativity which is a vital ability to get success in the future.
evaluation:
## Task Achievement:
- The candidate has adequately addressed the given task by presenting a balanced discussion of both views on whether art is an essential subject for children in school.
- The essay is clear and coherent in its presentation of ideas, with a logical flow of information and support for arguments.

In contemporary society, some people think that wealth is the main factor which makes it possible for individuals' well-being, but others argue this idea. Therefore, although some nations are already rich and bring about the addition of economic wealth which increases, citizens in the countries do not feel more satisfied. This essay will discuss both sides of the controversy, and my opinion will be provided.

On the one hand, advocates of this perspective believe that even if arises  stable finance in nations that are already rich, it does not help the population in this country be more pleased. It is clear that economics is not a major determiner that allows people to pleasure in living. In other words, some regions may lack a variety of conveniences such as amusements, transport, and other facilities.

On the other hand, those against the idea of people in the rich countries feel that are not satisfied, despite  additional increases in finance. The reason is that the more there is budget in the countries, the more there is comfortable living because the budget is a foundation of development. Furthermore, the government will spend this fund on the generation of places which satisfy individuals, and they can provide a lot of supplies such as food and materials. As a result, the high-income regions can bring about benefits for citizens.

In conclusion, some researchers believe that  wealthy nations do not cause the population to feel more comfortable. In my view, I strongly disagree with this issue because money is a basic part of life.

prompt: Consumers are faced with increasing numbers of advertisements from competing companies. To what extent do you think are influenced by advertisements? What measures can be taken to protect them
essay:
is undoubtable that the majority of the brands around the world will advertise their products in the television as well as billboards. in this essay, I shall further elaborate my point of view by analysing this particular issue.

Generally speaking, we are surrounded by advertisements in our daily life. Perhaps, one of the greatest sources of such promotion is from the mass media, for instance, newspaper, television as well as the internet. One important point to be made is superstars are hired by the branding company as an ambassador to promote their products. If one idolise this superstar, they will purchase the product endorsed by them. Another related matter is cigarette is often used as a prop in movies and drama. Whilst smoking is regarded as deleterious o one’s health, youngsters will however smoke for the purpose of imitating their idol. In short, advertisement is considered as a strong method to attract buyers.

Despite many advertisements are aired and printed freely, measures should be taken to avoid consumers being exploited. First and foremost, legislation about the contents of advertisement should be created. This is clearly important as many companies tend to promote products which are disadvantages to consumers, such as cigarette. Another point to note is the law should state the advertisers must be honest in terms of the quality of the product or brand which they sell.

In a nutshell, it is evident that advertisements have made a great impact on consumers, not least because people would purchase the items advertised on the television and endorsed by superstar. This is however, must be control through legislation in order to protect the consumer’s right and safety.

First and foremost,criticising lecturers will lead to various problems such as messy classes and a lack of respect. That is to say, if students do not admire and honour their monitor,they will not be able to learn any subject by them. For example, learners  in upper grades can not learn math,science and artificial intteligience at school if the teacher does not have class-mangement or he/she can not make students listen or follow up with the lesson. Thus, accepting rude comments  will lead to out-of-control tutition as well as desortation of respectable image of teacher. 

On the other hand, evaluting teachers could be one aspect of teaching ,yet it should be taken as a holistic evaluation containg parts such as: parents,administration and students.Moreover,this evalution should be conducted professionally and without any bias criterian .The most impotant point is to deal with criticisim as a factor to motivalte teacher not  as a mean of offense  and humilitation. For instance, principles may attend demo-presentation and scofold teachers to overcome any difficulty or deficiency tactfully and kindly as well, focusing on positive features first. Thus the teacher will feel comfortable,consequently,this will lead to more productivity.

prompt: In some countries, people are having children at later age in life. What are the reasons? Do the advantage outweigh disadvantages?
essay:
In today's world childbirth is a huge problem for most women.Individuals are more inclined towards making their career than on giving birth to a child.Adapting this method has more negative impacts than positive.

Firstly, the reproductive age of a woman lies between 14yrs to 40yrs.Focusing on late childbirth has caused a rise in the infertility rate.Women undergo menopause early so they need to conceive early.Late born child brings many risks to the mother like,physical weakness and mental depression.

For instance,it has been reported that women are developing many obstetric and gynaecological problems as their age advances.PCOS, has been reported as the most common cause of infertility with advancing age,so doctors are recommending parents plan their family early to avoid such issues.

On the ,contrary there are some advantages of late pregnancy.Girls should not be forced to marry early instead they should be encouraged to study further and become independent.In doing so they will be capable of looking after their kids and giving them a bright future.For example,many individuals who have persuaded their higher degrees and then married have been shown to give a healthy and good life to their future kids.

To conclude,although the merits of late birthing is completing their studies but we cannot ignore the demerits it brings and its number has been enormously increasing.The biggest threat it causes risks to the mother and many women become infertile by the time they even think of becoming a parent.In my ,opinion women should plan early to become parents than to wait till they become independent.

prompt: Many university graduates cannot find a job in their chosen profession, what factors may have caused this situation and what, in your opnion, should be done about it? 2
essay:
Nowadays, it’s undeniable that you must work hard to get a job, many university graduates can’t find work in their chosen profession. This essay will discuss the main cause. In addition, it will suggest a suitable solution to this problem.

The primary main cause is companies hire foreigners to give them a low income. In other words, a lot of organizations hire people from outside their country rather than hiring a person from your own country because of the cheap salary they give to foreigners. For example, many reporters say that the percentage of companies who are hiring foreigners is nearly 80% because of the low salary that foreigners ask for. Although some companies hire people from outside their country, the government should make a rule that you have to hire people from your country.

The viable solution to this problem is that the government should launch a publicity campaign in the media to hire graduates from your own country. In other words, many organizations hire individuals from outside their country. The awareness campaign should shed some light to hire graduates from your own country. For example, Japan started a campaign to stimulate companies to hire from their own country this calling positively impacted the Japanese. 

To conclude, this essay highlighted the main cause which is hiring foreigners. In addition, it suggested a suitable solution which is the government should launch a publicity campaign in the media to hire graduates from your own country. In my opinion, if companies still hire foreigners the economy will be decline.

For instance , even though they are  totally indulged in their studies for many years  when they have a break , they have no stress on their mind and spend a quantity of their time . Although they grab more knowledge , and have to think freely about their carrier ,  when the pupil just go for studies after completing the school then they do not have much time to think about their subjects and interests . Moreover , they have  experience . Nevertheless , they go for work , they get a good experience and have a chance to learn well about it practically .

On the other hand , some students do not return back to their studies . For example , they are doing a work or job they like it as its earning is good and work is good , they do not like to come back because they are happy with it . In addition , although they lose the chance to be expert in that field , however they do their studies then they have a degree and can take a job in big company , now they can only do work on small scale .

prompt:
Some people believe teenagers should be required to do unpaid community
work in their free time. This can benefit the teenagers and the community as well.

applicable.
essay:
For the betterment of society and youngsters, some people feel that youngsters should spare their leisure time by doing unpaid community work. I completely agree with this point and in this essay I will support my view with example.
One of the most significant benefits of teenager's involvement in social work is increasing their level of awareness of social issues. Young people mostly unaware of communal problems so if they enrolled themselves for free social work then they will realise the gravity of particular problem and also could be able to provide a piece of advice. For instance, I worked for the NGO from Pune, India formed by college-going students and took volunteer participation in clean Narmada river program. Thus, as per my experience, I feel that to develop adolescents’ likings in community work, people should encourage them.
Furthermore, spending free time in engaging communal activities would develop teenager's interest in politics, social work, and public sector services. The reason for this is, nowadays, most of the children spend their spare time by watching some TV programs or by playing computer games. If they start investing that time doing community tasks, they might start thinking to become a politician or a social worker or a public service agent to help community grow faster. To illustrate this point, students from Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) fought for Maharashtra state assembly election last year and got unbelievable response from public as they have done tremendous social work before.

prompt: In the past, people stored knowledge in books. Nowadays people store knowledge on the internet. Do you think the advantages outweigh the disadvantages?
essay:
In this day and age, more and more people opt for obtaining knowledge on the internet instead of storing knowledge in books. This has many merits and demerits. I am firmly convinced that using the internet to access knowledge has more merits than demerits.

On the one hand, using the internet to get information and knowledge has several/certain downsides. First, some information and knowledge are only published in the form of paper books. As a result, it can be difficult for people who only use e-books to access this information. For instance, series of books such as Story Central do not have ebooks, so they must be bought in stores. Second, there is lots of false information on the internet. The main reason for this is that online information is not usually censored. As a consequence, readers can fall victim to false information and may be deceived.

On the other hand, it is my firm belief that the upsides of storing knowledge on the internet are more significant. To begin with, searching for information on the internet is more convenient than looking for knowledge in books. People just need a phone or laptop with internet connection to access online information whenever they want. Moreover, the price of e-books is generally lower than that of paper books. This is mainly because the price of traditional books includes the cost for paper, transportation and storage. Therefore, it may be more economical for readers to use paper books.

In conclusion, although getting knowledge on the internet has some drawbacks, I firmly believe that its benefits are more considerable.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement:**

- The candidate has addressed the topic appropriately and covered all parts of the task.
- The ideas are presented clearly and coherently, with a logical flow of information.
- Arguments are supported with relevant examples.
- Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 8

**Coherence and Cohesion:**

prompt: Many university graduates cannot find a job in their chosen profession.What factor may have caused this situation and what in your opinion, should be done it.
essay:
University graduates are dreaming to get an occupation in line with their chosen profession. They hope by enrolling in university will help their professional career in the future. However, in reality it is hard for them to meet their professional expectations. In this essay, I will describe factors that may lead to this situation.

Firstly, it is because of the limited experiences that they have. Experiences explained here not only talk about work but also others experiences such as organizational, group activities, and all works related to campus. This might happen because in university, scholars tend to have their own choice of education courses. Then, sometimes they choose not to be involved in any other projects or organizations because it might be helpful for them to focus on subject matters only. By doing so, they do not realize that all activities outside campus give them points plus to add into their curriculum vitae which is necessary in time ahead. In my opinion, In order to avoid this situation, it is very crucial for universities to make mandatory program activities not only about working but also organizations such as internship, exchange students so that undergraduates must participate actively. Hence, when they finish their school they definitely have experiences in their resume.

Secondly, getting a job for recent graduates is very competitive. It is simply because every year the universities produce workforces and the company available is limited. Hence, I think it is better for the university to have some entrepreneur programs offered in order to prepare the sophomore to think not only about having employment but also to open business to the public. Indeed, it will create a job market for everyone and to increase economic activities in a country.

Finally, universities need to offer various programs to boost careers for students. Since the graduates lack experience in the working field, they need to prepare for it.
evaluation:
## Task Achievement:
- The essay addresses the prompt and identifies two factors that may have caused university graduates to struggle finding jobs in their chosen profession (limited experience and competition).

prompt:
In many countries today, parents are able to choose to send their children to single-sex schools or co-educational schools. Some people think that children going to single-sex schools have disadvantages later in life.
To what extent do you agree?
essay:
childhood at school has been a part of life which everybody cherishes and admires, as it often involves memories of fellow classmates and them having fun and doing all sorts of shenanigans, Although while being a kid your classmates being a boy or a girl does not matter  this can have some issues as the individual grows and in my ,opinion same-sex schools do lead to some disadvantages which are face by both genders irrespectively. 

The main problem that this type of educational institution create is a lack of understanding of the opposite sex and also a lack of confidence, consider an example of a boy studying for 5 recent years of his life in the company of other boys, he shall develop more confidence in talking to another guy but will hesitate if he has to converse with a random girl, as he will be out of practice. It also affects the children in not knowing the preferences of other genders in different situations, such as 

not being aware of being a little gentle and well-behaved while talking to a female . If all these ideas have dwelled into them at a young age it can help both the groups to know the differences and mannerisms of each other and respect those differences.

The major problem shall actually be bigger than having a lack of understanding and low confidence, the low knowledge of the opposite sex may result in bad cooperation in future relationships and may  lead to constant arguments, it may also cause a sense of discomfort to a woman when criticised by  men due to her lack of exposure to this particular feedback. Finally, the whole idea of a singular-sex school does fit   certain age criteria but can cause more problems in the future than resolving them.

In Conclusion, many schools should practice this method up till a certain age and then incorporate another group of sex during the higher education phase, this way children can actually be isolated in the right way and also be prepared when their age is correct, if not so this type of schooling system can sometimes not only take out the most joyful moments from a students life but also leave them socially impaired.
evaluation:

prompt:
Experts believe that over the next decade, robots will be doing many of the jobs currently done by humans.

Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this.
essay:
In the future, specialists predict that most of the work done by humans will be replaced with robots. Having machines replace humans has both positive and negative aspects, we will discuss these in detail.

The main advantage of using robots to perform a task is its performance and accuracy. A robot can outdo a human in terms of perfection and quality. For example, the aviation industry has zero-tolerance for errors, and so they prefer automation to manual labour. Another important advantage of employing a robot is increased productivity. A robot never takes a vacation nor it requires a break, they can perform their duty round the clock. To illustrate, manufacturing industries can utilize an industrial robot to perform repetitive tasks. 

Although there are positive sides to using robots to perform jobs, there are equally negative sides present for the same. One of the main disadvantages of using robots is their high maintenance cost. For instance, machines tend to wear and tear, run into technical glitches it is often required to maintain and upgrade. Another negative aspect of replacing humans with robots is joblessness. In this age, when the population is growing at a rapid phase the need for a job opportunity is scarce. Adding to the existing job crisis, introducing robots will escalate the joblessness to a new height.

In conclusion, while there are positives of using robots to perform work, there is some significant negative impact. Proper care should be taken to strike a balance on how much work can be replaced with  robots.
evaluation:
## Task Achievement:
- The candidate has adequately addressed the given task by discussing both the advantages and disadvantages of robots replacing human jobs in the future.
- The essay is clear and coherent in presenting ideas, offering specific examples to support arguments.
- The candidate has adequately covered all parts of the task and provided appropriate support for their arguments.
- Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 7.5

How can people research this?

There is a tendency that people are more interested in the history of the buildings where they live and this interest has significant reasons to occur. The following essay will try to find out what are those  and the way how individuals can research  their house's history.

First of all, why are people  even curies about it? Since the 21st century started, governments all around the world, have been trying to preserve old buildings. Then, for most of the past century houses were filled with people, consequently making them concerned about their condition. Some of the houses have not been maintained for years, so  people may experience some domestic issues, such as water pouring from a rooftop and more. Moreover, these old buildings might be placed in those streets that have not been noisy and crowdy until nowadays, and the people are likely to find out what are those architectural and planning issues that caused such problems and it all leads to buildings history where they can be found.

Secondly, it needs to be found out how and what certain individuals should  look at their house history. Maybe to most ,people the best of research would become the internet. It will allow us to search for information and find those events that happened in past, that led to the current situation. Actually, the internet is able to contact  anyone who used to live old house and it can provide researchers with useful information and they will not lose a considerable amount of time.

Overall, it can be seen what made people get interested in the history of their own houses and there are many ways to find out it.

Many people believe that musems are place where every person, especially youngsters, enjoy and can last their time by observing items, while others claim that this place is a centre of education rather than disneyland. This essay will discusses both arguments and then I will give my own perspective.

The main reason why a big number of people visit museums with their children is to expand outlook by demonstrating local history, famous ancestors and old customs. As well as this, young generation only want to enjoy instead of getting knowledge about something. For example, many researches conclude that current generation spend a great deal of time in the social media rather than reading books. In addition, by visiting such kind of places they can be more aware about their country and citizens. If museums are constructed as an antractive place it would catch more attention by adolecents. Furthermore, museums are more likely to be fun and useful for building close relationships between parent and kid. 

On the other hand, there are several strong arguments who sees museums as an educational place. As far as museums are concerned tradisionalists argue with former opinion. The key reason for this lacking of understanding what museum is by teenagers. Moreover, teenagers seek only enjoyment rather than gaining something that they do not know. Also, items which are exhibited in museums are very historical. Thus people ought to visit for educational purposes.

In conclusion,there are merits and drawbacks of two arguments, hence both notions can taken into consideration. However, on balance, I lean to the idea that supervisors of museums try to use advantages of both approaches.

prompt: In some citites and towns all over the world ,the high volume of traffic is a problem.what are the causes of this and what actions can be taken to solve this problem.
essay:
Traffic congestion is an issue in  urban centres.In some parts of urban places around the globe,an increase in traffic cramps is an issue.The causes are people using their own cars and  not working from home.However,solutions like  taking public transportation and telecommuting are actions to curtain the phenomenon.The essay will explain in detail the  causes as well as solutions to tackle the problems in the subsequent paragraphs with examples.

To begin with ,there are several factors for the rise of  traffic jams in the cities.Firstly,the majority of people in the cities prefer to use their own private cars to go to work and most students too travel around the same time.This causes congestion during  peak hours.Although workers will  feel comfortable with their vehicles ,others will suffer.Moreover,most employees are not working from home which leads to an increase in traffic because a lot of them are travelling to work within the same period.If workers work from home,there will be no  jams.For instance,during the covid 19 period ,companies made their staffs   work from home which helped ensure the easy flow of vehicles on the road.Therefore, an increase in private car usage and personnel not working from home are the two factors of  increased cramps in the cities.

Secondly,there are several solutions to tackle the problem of congestion.Individuals should take public transportation so that the number of cars on the road will reduce.It will ensure free flow  on the road.It will help employees and students to reach their destinations on time.For example,in Adiembra , most students and workers take public transport and this has led to ease flow on the highway.Furthermore,telecommuting is when  personnel works from their various houses.The initiative will help tackle the jams problems because employees will be working from home.

In conclusion ,private vehicle usage and personnel not working from home are the two factors for the rise of traffic cramps in the towns whereas measures such as taking public transport and working from home will help tackle the problem.

prompt: Many university degree holders cannot find a job in their chosen profession.What factors may have caused this situation and what, in your opinion, should be done about it ?
essay:
Unfortunately many university students have to choose a different career path.The reasons for the same are mainly due to imbalances in the job sector.In my view, proper planning by the government can bring the situation under control.

Crucial factors contributing for not finding a job in chosen profession are lack of availability and pay disparity. In many countries, jobs available and university offering courses are not aligned properly. For instance, an excerpt from the Stanford mentioned that half of the graduates from United Kingdom have pursued business and one in every three graduates from India is an engineer. This is forcing them to shift to a new industry for a living. Also, salary differences in some of the industries is also leading to change their profession. For example, scientists in many developing countries are paid often very less where they do not have any option but to quit and continue in a different domain.

This inequality can be mitigated by careful planning at individual and government level. Governments should understand how the market is shaping up, focus on increasing the corresponding skill set. Also, ensuring there is a correlation between the no of graduates and the employees for a particular industry. For example, Vietnam focused on improving industrial skills as they knew many industries will be set up because of its economic policies. This helped immensely for the students and resulted in double digit economic growth. Although planning from the congress is required, one must understand the trends at individual level for a better future.

To conclude, many graduates are ending up in a different profession than they wished for, because of the inequalities between the courses offered and industry prevalent. Countries should predict the market trends and focus on providing the necessary skill set for its graduates.

prompt: Some people think that employers should not care about the way their employees dress, because what matters is the quality of their work. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay:
In recent times, several people have had conflicts about whether employers have to obey the dress principles in office or whether the productivity of work is their priority. I strongly believe that people should concentrate on the quality of their work completely instead of their dress, and this essay serves to elaborate on my opinion.

A majority of people argue that employers prioritize the quality of their work. When people pay all their attention to working, their production and performance in a company will be better and bring several benefits for both themselves and this company instead of spending time on resolving the problem related to fashion. Specifically, their company receives more reputation, hence employment's career and position may have a chance to be promoted. For instance,in a prestigious company like Apple, there are no requirements about the employees' dress, Apple's employees spend most time on design, fixing errors, and enhancing their products. These criteria made Apple become a famous and successful brand and community with several electronic devices existing everywhere.

Moreover, the dress restrictions may expand the gap between employment in their working environment. Several companies force their workers to wear impolite clothes with many costume accessories, some staff want to show their wealth to others by their fashion style and only interact with people who have brand clothes like them and avoid working with people wearing simple clothes. Hence, after a long time, these kinds of working environments may become a fashion competition, instead, people have to create ideas, and products to promote and increase the company's profit. Many companies have collapsed for a similar reason that the directors create complicated and unnecessary principles that lead to low-quality working environment, so many employees quit their jobs and these companies lose their customers.

In conclusion, I firmly believe that bosses should not impose dress rules on their staff based on the effect on the productivity and workplace.

prompt: Some people think news has no connection to people's lives, so then it is a waste of time to read the news in the newspaper and watch television news programmes. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
It is true that many individuals believe that reading the news in the press and watching it on television wastes too much time as it does not relate to any aspects of their lives. Personally, I partly agree with this view due to some reasons.

On the one hand, It is considered to be a waste of time  to catch the news through the newspaper or social media as the appearance of numerous fake news every day. This happens because there are some content creators nowadays who make themselves well-known by posting untrue stories online. This leads to the problem that people involved in the stories somehow are not only misunderstood but also misjudged by the readers. For example, a few famous artists in Viet Nam were said to pass away after a long time suffering from cancer, while they are actually fine. 

On the other hand, reading or watching the news is suggested as the best way to keep up with the latest information about things happening around the world. People living far away need the news to catch up with what is occurring in their hometown or country. Besides, news can help us to improve our general knowledge as well. For instance, about 3 years ago when the Covid-19 pandemic broke out, everyone had to be isolated from each other and therefore, getting news on some online basis or on TV was the most efficient way to get information about what we had to do to prevent the disease. 

In conclusion, it seems to me that the news has both positive and negative extents. It is necessary for readers to choose the source of news carefully in order to get accurate information.

prompt:
Some think that governments should support retired people financially while others believe they should take care of themselves.

Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
It is irrefutable that senior citizens are the most vulnerable members of our society and are often financially supported in enormous developed economies. In numerous nations around the world, elderly people accrue funds for themselves that give them a sense of independence and curtail the financial burden on a province.

In this contemporary era, people prefer to become financially independent by accumulating funds for their golden years. It gives them a sense of independence and self-respect. The government of Canada encourages pupils for financial planning  so that their citizens can lead a stress-free and luxurious old age.

Moreover, this approach is beneficial to curtail the financial budget of a country. Instead of distributing money among senior citizens, the government can invest these funds for development such as infrastructure refurbishment. This would captivate the influx of tourists, hence, a country's economy will boost. A multitude of dollars were invested by the government of Indonesia to restore their historical buildings which attract thousands of visitors every year. As a result, their revenue increased precipitously. 

Financial support to older generations is their fundamental right and the onus of the legitimate agencies. This is because retired people have paid huge tariffs during their working years and contribute toward a country's development to a great extent. Therefore, it is the obligation of the financial ministry to pay them back for their hard-earned money.

Even though elderly people have paid a significant amount of taxes to the government, I firmly believe that becoming financially independent not only gives a sense of freedom and self-respect but also reduces the financial burden on a nation. Thus, they should take care of their monetary needs by themselves and not rely on legal affirms.

prompt:
Nowadays celebrities are more famous for their glamour and wealth than for their achievements, and this sets a bad example to young people.

To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
essay:
It is true that popular people are more known for their glamorous lifestyle than what they actually have gained and therefore they might be bad role models for the youth society. However, I partly agree with this statement.

On the one hand, there are a variety of reasons why it is thought that wealthy famous people may badly affect young and ambitious ones. The lives of rich, famous people are presented through social media and teenagers are exposed to the luxurious life of their dreams without accurately understanding their background. For example, they might not figure out how much effort famous people have made into meeting their current life and this appears as something easy to them. Furthermore, following rich people's life may lead to high unrealistic expectations for juveniles and by not reaching such a place, they might feel disappointed.

On the other hand, not all people are famous without their achievements being considered and if so it would not necessarily have negative effects. Firstly, watching a person lead his or her life by achieving their passion, teaches ineexperienced ones that they can possibly make their dreams come true. A young boy for instance, may become interested in playing a guitar under the influence of his famous guitarist. Secondly, by setting wealthy famous people as role models, young ones are becoming tempted to work hard with the ambition of a more luxurious life.

In conclusion, Although following people who are only well-known for their charming life might be a bad example for adolescents, I think it would bring profits for them as well.

prompt: Some believe that people should make efforts to fight climate change while others think it is better to learn to live with it. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
Nowadays , a few numbers of people think that global warming is a big issue and we can solve it but others believe that it is not important to life so  this essay illustrates this statement and give my opinion.

First of all , we should fight against it the reason is that it is harmful to our life such as whenever we go outside then facing some skin problems. prompt: In recent years tourists have paid attention to preserving both the culture and environment of the places they visit. However, some people think that it is impossible to be a responsible tourist. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
essay:
It is argued that there is no chance for tourists to take responsibility for protecting the environment and culture of host countries. However, I disagree with this view and believe that is a worthy aim  that can be achieved in various ways. 

Firstly, everyone should be informed about cultural heritage and its great impact on the environment. They should be more aware of their and childrens' behaviour. For instance, the  young generation must be properly educated in order to avoid littering public places with a variety of rubbish such as plastic bottles or residue of food, or touching valuable items like statues, special documents, famous pictures and others. 

Moreover, there should not be promoted cultural differences between both local and international humanity. A bright example of this  can be India, where cows are established as sacred animals. Nevertheless, some individuals may bring beef or eat it, breaking Indians' religion. Additionally, there is a rule that people are not allowed to chew gum. Unfortunately, as a result of bad awareness and poor preparation for visiting foreign countries, similar situations occur and the nations change their minds about these individuals. Also, the community of Tangier in Morocco have done a lot of efforts such as recruiting about 70 security agents in all museums of the city and plentiful signs hanging at the main door for giving more details about the story of each building. 

In conclusion, some personalities can not be responsible towards cultural and environmental areas they went to. Although, others claim that it is impossibly to follow all foreign rules. I believe, that with the help of appropriate education the risk of law-breaking and losing the liability, will be minimized totally.

prompt:
In some countries, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in.

What are the reasons for this?

How can people research this?
essay:
In some places, history plays a big part in their culture. Nowadays, people are getting more curious about the origin or the history of the buildings they reside in. This essay will further discuss the reasons behind it as well as give information to research about this occurrence.

Lately, the media has been showing the public many forms of culture, arts and history. With more people being engaged in these topics, plenty of individuals also got exposure to influencers, mostly on YouTube or TikTok, who are finding out about the stories of the places they live in. Because of these influencers, individuals get more interested in the back story of their houses. They might also get an idea to create similar content as it is quite popular nowadays. Other than that, the public now understands the importance of the past, as it could evoke a sense of belonging to one's culture. 

For those who are interested in finding out the past of their places, the internet is a great place to ask questions. One-click on the search engine could lead someone to discover a wide range of information, from general history to more specific details. Furthermore, data can be retrieved from the local office that is in charge of collecting the residential information. The office would be able to provide more accurate findings of one's residential.

All in all, as more and more people get exposed to history contents and the importance of it, this phenomenon might happen even more in the future. This could potentially lead us to a future where we could proudly embrace our history and culture.

prompt: Some people say that to prevent illness and disease, governments should focus more on reducing environmental pollution and housing problems.
essay:
It is believed that illness and disease are resulted from external factors related to the environment and housing. The government should make more efforts to mitigate environmental pollution and housing problems. From my perspective, I totally agree that this is a potential way to prevent illness and disease.

 

First of all, the significant reason that explains why reducing environmental pollution is worth protecting people’s health is the speed of spreading viruses. Although viruses are tiny creatures, depending on the variety of substances in the environment, especially the polluted environment, the number of viruses in the atmosphere increases significantly and develop many different variables. Consequently, people are easily attacked by them during the process of absorbing oxygen for survival because they will integrate in the flow of air to pervade the human body. Therefore, if the environmental pollution is reduced, the probability of patients getting disease by virus may go down.

 

Furthermore, housing is also a conscious problem when discussing reducing health problems of people. At present, there are many people who are homeless or poor and living in slum areas leading to low access to medical conditions when getting sick. Moreover, due to the effects of external factors such as lacking foods, not hygienic environment, etc., they usually get diseases related to respiratory, gastrointestinal or skin infections. Hence, this may motivate the government to provide social housing to the homeless or raise funding to help people in slums to afford houses. This step is helpful to mitigate illness and disease in society.

 

In conclusion, I would restate that environmental pollution and housing issues in many regions are the major causes of illness and disease, so the government should pay more attention to reduce these causes.

So, most of the people prefer the junk food only. At the same time fruits, dry fruits and vegetables which are healthy had became expensive and usually people are avoiding it to having them.

By increasing the price of food items that leads to overweight is not only the major reason. We need to take care of our diet and should give preference to the daily exercise. On the other hand government should implement some instructions on the food industries which prepares junk food and should encourage people to lead the healthy life. To conclude that, food items that give rise to obesity should be expensive and healthy food items should get at cheap rates. And it is an individual responsibility to have the controlled on their consumption and should follow a good diet with the consistency.

prompt: In some countries, people encourage students to find part-time jobs while some people don't. Discuss both sides and give your opinion.

There is no doubt that earning while studying has many advantages. There are some people support acquiring a job as long with education, others oppose this due to some reasons. In my opinion, I strongly believe in former view because it has some merits.

On the one side of the argument, it is sometimes thought students would focus only their academics instead of  getting a part- time work. This is because engaging in the other activities might result in poor performance in the examinations. Consequently, these learners would suffer a lot as they could not show an excellent educational background in their adulthood and employability would slim. For instance, in India, rarely, children have been allowed to work by both their parents as well as the teachers.

On the other hand, nevertheless, opponents of the above mentioned argument point that joining as a trainee in some work would give a better job prospects when they become adult. In other word, having an hand on experience in the field of preferrence, could give a chance to successful. For example, nursing students often work as a care giver during their student period. This not only assist to earn money, but also job related skills. Therefore, I, firmly think that joining a small work along with studies is highly essential for the futuristic employees.

In conclusion, even though people have different opinion on whether to have  a job along with studies. In my viewpoint,  I think it is a great idea to get a work as well as education.

prompt:
Men and women are different in terms of their characteristics and abilities. For this reason, 
some jobs are better done by men and others by women.
Do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Even in this modern stage of mankind's history, there are some people who believe job positions should be divided by gender and men or women have  limited, specified abilities that are not in the other sex. I contend that this cliche needs to be stopped once forever.

Firstly, the various experiences in history showed us that there are so many men ad women that can go through society's dictated rules and become even better than the dominated gender in that occupation. One of the most common instances is how men became great and excellent chefs while the society stereotypes claimed cooking is a female job and men should not take it as an occupation. Moreover, there are great names of women in male-dominated jobs like being a judge, astronaut, etc.

Secondly,limiting people by demonstrating typical rules for them controls the unseen abilities and stops them from exposing. As if Maryam Mirzakhani one of the greatest mathematicians in her times, had accepted society's mindset about women, she would never make that phenomenon in the science of mathematics. So in order to not lose the chance  of having these phenomenons, there should be an equal and unisex perspective on occupations and abilities.

By way of conclusion, I again insist on the miracle of the human's body that is never predictable and should not be generalised. There should be equal chances for both sexes from childhood to find their capabilities and wishes and not be judged for what they decided to do or be in their future life.
