prompt: Some people think that all teenagers should be required to do unpaid work in their free time to help the local community. They believe this would benefit both the individual teenager and society as a whole. Do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Many people work on a volunteer basis, and this can only be beneficial for both individuals and society as a whole. Personally, I disagree with this opinion.
Working as a volunteer has become increasingly popular among teenagers. I agree that this can help them to fulfill their free time. On the other hand, studying is more important than doing unpaid work and most of them find it extremely hard as a compulsory studying. If individual teenagers had free time, they would do sports instead of doing unpaid work. They have many years of work ahead of them when they finish their studies. 
On the other hand, those who think that all teenagers should be required to do unpaid work, they pressure on them and it can cause resentment amongst teenagers and society. Furthermore, I do not agree that society would benefit from unpaid work as a whole. To force young people to work as a volunteer could be counterproductive and parents would be dissatisfied how to rise their children. Encorcement on teenagers can gain nothing for the young and society. For example, recent survey on how enforcement can be devastating effect on children states that roughly over 50 percent of teenagers leave home to escape their parents' pressure. It shows us that doing unpaid work under pressure is not optional for both.
In conclusion, despite the requirement that some people think about unpaid work, I do believe that studying is also as unpaid work for teenagers and to avoid pressure is more important than making this compulsory.

prompt: Some people believe that younger family members should be legally responsible for supporting older family members when they become physically, mentally and financially unable to look after themselves. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Ageing is one of the inevitable difficult parts of life which must be experienced by every human being in the world. Due to the advancement of the medical field, life expectancy has been raised gradually in many countries in the world including developing countries. But unfortunately, caring for the elderly population is becoming a huge problem in every corner of the globe. 

when people are getting old, they tend to develop non-communicable diseases such as diabetes, hypertension and heart disease. Moreover, ageing will lead to memory impairment and they become dependent on others not only for their physical needs but also for psychological support as well as finance. Actually, the young generation of each family should care about the senior citizens of their family. However, in this modern world, most seniors are neglected by their offspring due to several reasons. 

Many decades ago, there was a thick bond among blood relations which connected each member in many aspects. people lived in extended families rather than nuclear households. This strong bond protected the geriatric population very well. 

In contrast, nowadays, households are scattered and each member acts individually. Parents and grandparents are not spending adequate time with their children and grandchildren due to the busy schedules of their jobs. Therefore, the relationship is split which pushes the senior citizens to a bizarre living in the latter part of life. Most of the ageing population is looked after by elders' homes or community centres. 

Some people still believe that the youngsters of each generation should take responsibility to look after their seniors and legislation should be made to ensure the safety of seniors. However, it carries a lot of pros and cons. 

But I believe that  making  good relationships among family members will teach the younger generation how to care for their parents and grandparents rather than making rules.

prompt: Human activities have a negative effect on plant and animal species. Some people say that it is too late to do anything. Some people think that we should take effective action improve situation. Discuss both sides and give your opinion. ?
essay:
There are tremendously controversial perspectives heating up a debate over what human’s next move is after bringing immense influence on flora and fauna species. While some people hold a strong claim that nothing we can do in this day and age because it is too late, the opposite makes a statement that with a view to revamping the situation, some efficient activities should be implemented.

Without a shadow of a doubt, there is an eclectic mix of convincing reasons which contributes to a notion that it is too late to treat those pressing consequences rooted by humans on plants and animals. They account for those irresponsible and selfish actions ranging from urban sprawl to overgrazing, especially deforestation. For the time being, there is an ever-growing demand for lands to live as well as woods to consume, which breeds abundant species on the verge of extinction and some may have died out already. Pandas in China which are on the brink of extinction nowadays can be cited as a suitable instance. Pupils had set fire to the forests, chopped down a majority of trees on their own purpose, by doing so, those poor pandas consequently lost their home to where they used to settle. Hence, due to a great many persuading roots, it is fairly late for humans to fix what they have done to flora and fauna.

Whilst the negative effects which are bred by humans are widely acknowledged, some effective approaches in order to redress that urgent matter still lingers. There are plentiful reserves that have been put up in order to provide a safe environment for those endangered faunas. Under the government’s observation, Cuc Phuong reserve has been built and become a home for a considerable species ranging from common to rare ones. Thus, proper tactics to cope with these dire issues always exist, however, it depends on how much pupils want to make it come true.

In conclusion, it has never been too late for humans to try to repair their mistakes in the past even with the simplest action, the most pivotal thing is people’s awareness.

- The essay addresses the task by discussing both sides of the argument and providing an opinion.

prompt: Some people believe that eventually all jobs will be done by artificially intelligent robots. What is your opinion?

One of the major example of this scientific development is the introduction of robots in the modern era which has eliminated the need of mankind in the jobs sector. This essay will discuss about the differences of work done by robots and a person.

A growing number of people argues that upgradation of technology in 21st century has not only made the lives easier but also it reduces the work load pressure. In field of businesses, the usage of robots has proved to be very useful as it diminishes the overhead cost. It makes the work more efficient and effective in a productive manner. Additionally, when the firms have more mechanical person, they don't have to worry about the office space hereby minimizing the expenditures.

Even though there are some positive facts about the involvement of automation in the work areas, nevertheless there are major negatives as well. Firstly, the excess operation of droids in every areas, lead to unemployment.  Researchers claimed that in upcoming 10 years, the immortal machines will takeover the mortal. At present, almost all  the tasks are being completed by machines, this can be best illustrated by an example of the new tesla robotic car does not require a person anymore to drive, it can be done automatically. Secondly, automatic to genius does not has a human brain and runs on the battery life long which ends up putting pressure on the nature. Thirdly, their functionality depends on thr internet, when the company is experiencing server problem or some technical error, the work will be delayed.

In my opinion, I believe that the companies should adopt the mix of both personal and mechanical blend in order to achieve its targets.

prompt: Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Should teenagers be required to unpaid work in time, when they are not studying? Should they do any community work for no money? In my opinion the answer is absolutely clear and it is – no. I strongly believe that unpaid job does more harm than benefits.

Each job must be paid. It does not matter whether it was done by adult or by a teenager or child. The job that is paid well is always done more accurate and clear. Some may argue that children can do this unpaid work for some reasons but I totally disagree with those statements. Paid job is a good way for teenagers to learn some aspects of adult life. If they learn it in childhood it would be easier for them when they grow up.

Of course job for community benefits both teenagers and community. But it does not cancel the fact that unpaid job is wrong. For example parents can give some money for children who do any community work. So teenagers would be able to help the community and at the same time they will earn their own money. It will help them in their future, when they would not underestimate their capabilities. They will also learn that money are not so easy to earn as they may think. I have no doubt that it will improve relationships between parents and their children.

In conclusion I would like to say that parents should pay their children’s unpaid community work if they want their children to grow mentally health and hardworking.

prompt: Some people think that technology makes life complex, so we should make our life simpler without using technology. To what extent do you agree or disagree.
essay:
Nowadays, some people think that technology is complicating our lives. They also think we should lead a basic lifestyle with no technology. Personally, I completely disagree with this view.

For a variety of reasons, firstly, the advancement in technology makes our work easier. When we need a meeting to coordinate the work, we just need to sit in a place and join a meeting room online. This helps us save time to move. Secondly, modern technology helps us communicate with everyone in the world. Take Facebook as an example, we can talk with our families and friends who are distant apart from us with a video sharing option. Thirdly, innovations in aviation sector has made our travel time much shorter and more relaxed

Furthermore, new technology makes our life enjoyable. The more technology develops, the more software appears. This means that people can watch videos, stories or play games instead of watching television. Moreover, technology also helps the medical industry thrive. Recently, patients can be advised by the doctors through medical applications or ask doctors some questions through an email. Besides, the health sector has been able to cure cancer, polio based on high-technology. Thanks to technology, our life has become more comfortable.

In conclusion, despite technology has made our life complex, this essay can explain the benefits of technology. I personally disagree with this view if this life has absolutely no technology.

To begin, these days people enticed by junk fast food and various other products that are responsible for tremendous weight gain. Some people believe that rise in the price of these junk food could dissuade people to buy these things but I disagree due to several reasons. People, who love to eat junk food, purchase these food regardless of their cost. For example, if someone is addicted to drink fizzy soft drink that contain high sugar such as, Coke, Pepsi and several others, then person could not stop drinking of these drinks evenafter surge in their prices.

Moreover, these days, people are leading highly paced extremely busy life with hectic schedule and they are having considerable less time to cook, therefore, they love to order food items from fast food outlets that adversely affect their health. For instance, due to shortage of time, people generally buy Pizza, Burger etc, from resturants and this habit of regularly having these meals, has a deterimental impact on physical and mental well being.

In conclusion, people think that the price increase of obesity causing products, could effectively control weight gain, but I believe that this can not control the concerning issue of weight gain. To tackle this problem, government should provide awareness about the harmful effects of some food items on health.

prompt: The increase in the production of consumer goods results in damage to the natural environment. What are the causes of this? What can be done to solve this problem?
essay:
In recent years, an increase in the manufacture of consumer goods has been seen. While this is connected to population growth, it has resulted in an increase in a detrimental effect to the environment. In this essay I will look at 2 possible causes for this as well as suggest some solutions. 

Due to the extreme high volumes of manufacturers in order to meet the increasing demand of products, there has been an increase in factory produced CO2 gases. This is because the manufacturing processes have not become more efficient as quantities have risen. In China for example, many new factories have sprung up over the last few decades resulting in huge quantities of pollution being fed into the air. If factories were to spend funding on researching more efficient manufacturing processes, the amount of polluted air would be decreased. Manufacturers in their numbers, should concentrate on reducing CO2 production. 

With the increase of factory workers, there has been a matching increase in the transportation of these workers to the facilities. In addition to this, there is an obvious rise in the transportation of products, all of which has resulted in higher Carbon gas emissions form vehicles involved in the process. The number of busses and trucks carrying labourers to and products from the factories in China have added to the already polluted atmosphere in the country. Improved and more efficient vehicles using no fossil fuels, such as in electric vehicles, or less fuel will improve this situation. Transportation accounts for a large percentage of the worlds total carbon gas production.

While it is understandable that we need more manufacturing facilities for the ever-increasing world population, we need factories who take environmental issues seriously. Factory management need to ask themselves the question, "are we doing enough to minimize our carbon footprint?

prompt: Some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to a successful career; while other believe that, it is better to get a job straight after school. Discuss both views and give y0ur opinion
essay:
Some people think University or College is one of the important sector for a student which help them to make their future bright while other believe that after finishing the school student should involve in work directly rather than going to university. This essay will discuss on both views and explain why university education plays a crucial role in achieving career goal rather than going for job after school level.
In one hand, studying at university will make learner more responsible as they become more mature after school life, which fascinate them to achieve their career goal. Furthermore, the student will get more opportunity to learn more about the subject in which they are keen. For instance, student who wants to persuade their career in the engineering field can learn more about the math and physics subject. Therefore, it will be easier for them to work practically if they have theoretical knowledge. Moreover, they will become more serious about their goal so for the successful life they will study hard. Hence, university study is importance for their goal achievement for prosperous and success career.
In other hand, many people believe that they should indulge in a fieldwork after finishing their school life. Many people think this because they believe it will aid younger people to learn practically. Moreover, they will earn money to feed themselves and the family burden can be decrease. Furthermore, they use to analyse theoretical study is not imperative if they got jog with good salary. For instance, a recent study concluded most of the people want their children to finish their school and search for employment to make them independent rather than admitting them in university.
However, in mine opinion education always make humankind generous and successful. So more we study, we get more knowledge especially in case of children. If they choose college after school study, they can make a choice of the subject according to their interest and can motivated to grab more information in related field. Hence, they can easily achieve their goal if they do their further study in college.
To conclude, University degree is necessary for bright future, as children will get more chance to evaluate their interest. Therefore, it’s always the best idea to make them persuade to go to university rather than searching for job after completing school study for jolly and successful life

prompt: Some people think that illegal Internet downloads are having a negative effect on the music industry. Others feel that they have little or no impact on artists. Discuss both views and give your own opinion
essay:
Nowadays, it is a very common to download from the internet and it is becoming a topic of debate whether it is legal or not. However, while many advocates that music piracy doesn’t effect on the music industry, I side with those who believe that it does affect the music industry as a whole.
On one hand, it could be argued that download music from the internet is not illegal and it doesn’t affect the music industry because they have multiple sources of income. Many artists create videos or songs just as a hobby. Likewise, many artists do live shows or advertisements, their main income sources are not just music. Hence, supporters of this claim that download from the internet doesn’t affect much to them.

On the other hand, I hold the opinion that download music from the internet is illegal and it significantly affects the music industry because to make any song is expensive. Many people work behind to make an album and artists needs to pay for the staff, advertisement fees and rent. If people do not buy their album legally, artists will not able to pay them and in the end artists will get bankrupt. In other words, they will stop making music albums and people might lose great artists.  Thus, in my opinion, people should not download music from the internet illegally.

To conclude, although some musical artists make albums as a hobby or they do not rely on one source of income, Music downloading from the internet without paying for, it causes the whole industry will not survive in the future. Therefore, on balance, I think people should avoid music piracy.
evaluation:

prompt: Some people find advertisements amusing or annoying and they are not influenced by this when they shop. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Advertising and its influences have long been a topic of numerous debates, especially in recent years. In this regard, some people argue that the impact of advertisements on shoppers is neglectable. However, in contrast, the majority number of people including me hold the view that advertisements could channel the shoppers' choices in an effective way. In the forthcoming paragraphs, I will support this point of view with likely explanations.

To begin with, it is widely accepted that the modern human is leading a consumerism lifestyle due to indulging in social media platforms and being bombarded with commercials offering an excessive range of products. This means that huge enterprises meticulously target individuals, particularly younger consumers, with impressive adverts on social media platforms such as Instagram and Telegram. As a result, this level of omnipresence of new products with gimmick options makes it inevitable for young people who spend most of their time surfing the internet. The latest statistics in the UK, for instance, have demonstrated that nearly 60% of people who spend a certain time on the internet buy at least one or two items every month under the direct influence of online advertisements. 

Furthermore, the fact advertisements could be functional in terms of making customers aware of various features, options and models of available products in the market. Thanks to the informative form of adverts, people have an opportunity to compare different items they need in terms of prices and features to make the best decision, which would have not been possible otherwise. This trend is quite beneficial for both individuals and companies as it increases sale figures and boost the economy in society. Apart from that, driven by advertisements, the time devoted to shopping sprees has diminished substantially due to the fact that before attending the malls or shops people exactly know which items and brands they want to purchase. For example, when I have to buy a mobile phone I  do not waste my time in the shop since, thanks to the adverts and pops on the Internet, I am already familiar with the exact features, costs and quality of every available smartphone in the market which makes the process of buying in the shop significantly lower.

To sum up, despite the fact that a minority group of people do not trust adverts anyway, in my opinion, most people, especially younger ones are affected by advertisements since not only it could enhance their knowledge about different goods but also  can stimulate demand and interest to newly produced items.

prompt:
Some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to a successful career, while others believe that it is better to get a job straight after school. 
Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
People’s opinions differ as to whether students should continue to study higher education or obtain a job right after school when they completed high school. While there are benefits to have a job straight after graduating school, there are also good reasons why it might be beneficial to study further. 
On the one hand, the option to gain a job after completing school is attractive for several reasons. Firstly, it is one of the best ways to train students to become mature people. For instance, they have to think more critically about each decision and have responsibility with the consequence without the support from family or teachers. Secondly, having a job could give the students a whale of opportunities to expand the relationships, earn practical experiences, knowledge from the reality that is extremely useful for them in the near future.  Thirdly, students will appreciate the value of money, so they will change the mindset and understand the challenges that their parents suffered. 
On the other hand, there are a variety of reasons why keeping on studying further is also necessary. First, students could obtain the academic degree which is important to apply for a job with a high salary in the future. For example, according to the statistics of the Viet nam ministry of education, 40 percentages of graduated students gain at least 500 dollars at the starting wage for a job straight after school. From a personal perspective, it can be argued that study in higher education provides more job opportunities, career progression, and therefore an improved quality of life . Finally, the students could have a chance to acquaint themselves with many experts in some specific fields, so they could learn more knowledge, acquirements which are very useful for them in the future.
In conclusion, it seems evident that both continuing studying at university, college and having a job right after completing high school have their own unique advantages.

- The response adequately addressed the given task by discussing both views on the topic of university education vs. immediate employment.

prompt: 5.6. Some people think that robots are very important for humans' future development. Others, however, think that robots are a dangerous invention that could have negative effects on society. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
Over the last two or three decades, the way people live and work has changed dramatically due to major advances in technology. As a result, it is believed by many that robots play a significant role in the development of the nation whereas others think that it is a negative advancement and has adverse impacts on humanity. In this essay, I will look at both sides of the argument and give my opinion.

To start with, why do individuals consider the development of machines beneficial for society is the advancement of lifestyle because they have made life easy and time-saving. In addition, robots have the ability to do error-free tasks which results in the productivity and efficiency of the task. For example, automatic machines are used in all industries to fasten the work and reduce the labour force. As a result, companies can increase their productivity and growth. 

On the other hand, using robots in every field can have detrimental effects on people's lives because they do not have the ability to distinguish between right and wrong and work on emotional intelligence only which can result in the loss of lives. Moreover, the unemployment rate will increase with the growth of robots in every field which is harmful to the public because they will take the place of human forces and people will no longer be required in industries to perform various tasks. 

To conclude, I consider the evolution of robotics as a well-needed development as it has increased productivity and adaptability but it has affected society negatively as they are not reliable and people will become unemployed with the use of automatic machines in every field.

prompt: Government spends a lot of money on education. More money should be spent on free time activities. To what extent do agree or disagree?

Many people believe that the government need to invest money in education, whereas others believe that more money should be spent on leisure activities. In this essay, I will discuss both views and give my opinion. 

On the one hand, there are two main reasons to explain why government funding is necessary.First of all, it will help children have equal education opportunities, especially in mountainous areas. Many parents do not have enough conditions to pay for the school fees of their children as a lot of children do not know how to write and read. In addition, investing in education means investing in the future because it helps young people have more and more opportunities to improve their knowledge. 

On the other hand, funding leisure activities will help citizens release from overstress or depression. In modern society, young people are stressed by many factors such as relationships and peerpressure, especially when they struggle with many exams and hard homework. The government needs to provide some entertainment channels and other facilities. school can build a place thathas a cafe for students during break time. They can relax and spend time with their peers due to having more energy for study. From that, learning will become easier and more effective.

 In conclusion, the government should spend money on education as well as entertainment, both of which will help children develop wisdom and mental health.

prompt:
Some people think that instead of preventing climate change, we need to find

a way to live with it. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Many years have seen a change in climate and few people believe that they have to look for other alternatives to living with climate change rather than restricting it. I strongly oppose this view and my reasons will be explained in the following paragraphs.

To begin with, restraining climate from changing is basically the only way we can have a chance to save the world  since it causes weather changes in the future. This will stop the human race from extinction due to harsh weather caused by climate change. For instance, if we try by all means to avoid air pollution this can actually help to prevent the climate from changing which will cause drought due to too much radiation from the sun. Furthermore, we can limit climate change by helping stop the ozone layer from continues breaking and causing deadly direct sunlight. For example, human beings can do programs for planting trees everywhere which  will assist in avoiding the destruction of the ozone layer.

On the other hand, we can learn to survive  the changing in the climate since beings are created in a way that adapts to change. Thus when there are extreme weather conditions caused by the change of climate we can always find means to survive these dangerous atmospheres, when it is too cold we put on warm clothes.

In conclusion, I believe that preventing the changing of the weather bears more weight than devising ways to survive in the conditions due to the reason that people can plant more trees and avoid polluting the air this will stop the climate from changing. However, we can learn to survive harsh weather.

They may research  it by using Google where all types of data are available as well as not adulterated with fake materials.

Secondly, the owner wants to collect the past of their home so that they can provide the knowledge to their posterity as a memorable element. In fact , citizens can get the idea by hearing the real past from their ancestors. Furthermore, They can learn by reading books  history or old magazines.

prompt: Children today have more responsibilities than the past. Some people think it has positive effects than negative ones while others disagree. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
In the past children used to have more responsibilities in comparison with the current situations. Some have the idea that it has more benefits than what is occurring nowadays. From my point of view, the given responsibilities should be limited to what a child can handle.

Having more responsibilities can prepare children for life. Due to the numerous duties that kids may be in charge of, life skills are encouraged and developed in a more effective way. Being influenced by the experience gained, the children are wiser to take appropriate measures to solve any issue imposed . In Japan, the education system promotes being responsible by encouraging the students to clean their school as part of their daily routines. Children who are used to taking more responsibilities can act more accurately in life.

On the other hand, the reduction in the number of duties may provide more time for children to play which is fundamental to their mental health. We need to consider more time to play for children, if we want to have healthier children. Having numerous duties is harmful to their mental health as their capacity to handle and deal with many tasks is limited. In Africa, there are many kids deprived of childhood as they have to work like  grown-up adults. Play is vital for every child as it brings satisfaction and happiness.

In conclusion, although some have the notion that preparing children for life by giving them different responsibilities is crucial, I think the need to play should considered as the first priority for any child.

prompt:
Some people believe that they should be able to keep all the money they earn, and should not have to pay tax to the state.
To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Tax is the important source of government’s revenue. It is said by some individuals that they should not pay tax  to government and keep their money with themselves. I strongly disagree with the statement and my viewpoints on this  issue will be elaborated in the aforementioned paragraphs.

To begin with,  tax is fixed according to the income of the people if they will not pay the tax then  rich will  become more richer and poor will become more poorer and it will definitely create the problem of inequality of income and  wealth.For instance  a survey was conducted in India in 2017 and its result was that India  faced the problem of tax evasion  in which usually people do not pay tax and find the way to hide their income and this problem had given birth to several problems such as hoarding of black money in foreign countries and exploitation of  poor by rich people.

Furthermore, there are some advantages of  collecting tax for  the government.Firstly, it is the  source of government’s income and regime can utilise this money for the welfare purpose of people  and this money can be used to built public parks, amusement parks , building bridges.Secondly , taxes are compulsory to make balance between the rich and poor otherwise rich will become more rich and poor will become more poor.

To recapitulate,  I would like to write that  it is  the main duty of every individual to pay tax.

prompt: The only way to improve the safety of our roads is to give much stricter punishments on driving offenses. What extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Road safety has become a pipe dream for most individuals living on Earth. Every day a significant number of people become victims of accidents thus making it a global concern. Although a plethora of steps has been taken to alleviate these mishaps, the number of casualties has not declined yet. Some people hold the view that punishing drivers is the only way to ameliorate road safety, while I believe that it is necessarily not the only solution. This essay tends to explain the reasoning behind my viewpoint.

To begin with, drivers are not the only persons to be blamed for these casualties, highway conditions are also responsible. Nowadays, streets are constructed with substandard materials, accordingly, potholes are formed during the rainy season. Similarly, ongoing maintenance of streets leaves behind dug-up roadways without any proper barricades. The unavailability of street lights also exacerbates the problem. For instance, recently an Indian girl died when her scooter slipped into a hole because of the darkness around. 

Additionally, inferior vehicle conditions contribute to accidents. For example, in Bangladesh, most public buses are 10 to 20 years old. Despite severe technical issue, they are still running on the highways. So, in times of emergency, it is impossible for the operators to stop the vehicle. In worst scenarios the buses can collide with another automobile, killing all the passengers on board. Moreover, there are no organised  traffic regulations and highway patrol in most cities hence no security. Due to dysfunctional traffic lights, the crossing of pedestrians and cars coincide resulting in misfortunes. Considering all these, the government should be held blameworthy as it is the authority's responsibility to provide safer public transportation and systematic traffic rules.

To conclude, mishaps are caused not only by reckless driving but by several other factors. Improved roadways, vehicles and laws are indispensable to enhance the safety of our roads. Therefore, I disagree with the given statement.
evaluation:

- The candidate has addressed the task by providing a clear stance and supporting arguments.

Nowadays, with globalization, the connect of nations become closer. There ave many urgent and serious problems happend in this world. Some peope claim that most of urgent issues can only be addressed with international cooperation. I would partly agree with statement.

Admittedly, part of urgent problems only can be trackled by cooperation with other countries. The assistance of internation is more powerful and immidated. Take war for example, if somewhere happens war, the residences would face the situations, like injury, homeless, the lack of food and drink, and even the threat of life. Above these problems, domestic government cannot solve these by themselve.The only method is via international cooperation, internationa orginazations or the goverment of other nations will assist to address these problems, about numans rights, like rescuing the locals, offering necessary resources, and providing the shelter oversea for these refregees.

Conversely, not all of issues can solved by other countries, such as crime rate. This issue is long-term and associated with various aspects of domestic, like education, employment, the policy of punishment and so on. The domestic goverment should be capable to trackle these problems by themselve, instead of relied on the help of other countries. Despite of this, the local goverment can also ask the advices of other nation as references of improvement.

 In conclusion, I agree with this statement in specific aspects. The international cooperation is indeed a powerful method, but most of domestic problems only can addressed by the local government.

prompt: In some countries, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in. What are the reasons for this? How can people research this?
essay:
In recent times, people from many nations across the globe have become more intrigued by the former events of their residences. Concerns of safety and means to maintain household facilities are the primary reasons that trigger the growing curiosity. This essay will elucidate the intentions as well as outline the mediums to successful research.

The main reason why individuals are interested in the background of their property is to feel a sense of security. To further explain, the house or the apartment could have been a place where a criminal resided or where a terrifying crime took place. Hence, to avoid unnecessary doubts and attain clarity, the new tenants investigate the history. The second factor would be to supplement the management of the facilities since the previous owners may have blueprints of the water, electricity, and heating systems. For instance, if something were to break and the layout of the system is available, it can be troubleshot and get fixed easily.

In turns of research methods to acquire the history of the residence, the internet is probably the most convenient platform. There are multiple websites and blogs where one can find the record of ownership or what the location used to be before the residential area was built. An inquiry to the neighbours would be another simplistic way in researching. For instance, some probably have lived in the community or the building for decades, therefore, they are likely to have all the answers. Lastly, the local property authorities can also provide accurate and detailed information to the requestors since they are accountable to keep the records and data.

To conclude, individuals are more curious about the place that they are residing in to feel secured and for the smoother maintenance of the household facilities. In order to acquire those facts, they can rely on the world wide web, converse with their neighbours and request to respective authorities.

prompt: Some people argue that we should do research into their family history. Others, agree with the view that we should focus on the present and future generations. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
There are two controversial perspectives heating up a debate over history. While some people claim that it is essential for individuals to conduct studies into the history of their family, others make a statement that concentrating the present and next generations is necessary. From my viewpoint, each has its own redeeming features, so it is optimal to combine those.

Without a shadow of a doubt, we should pay attention to the history of our ancestors. Because it allows people to have a firm grasp of their cultural identity and some traditional customs of their family. For example, in Vietnam, when Lunar new year comes, a steady stream of adults regularly take their toddlers to some churches adjacent to their houses in order to offer incense and provide children with the family historical background. Hence, having a good understanding of the family history is of paramount essence. 

While the imperativeness of taking notice of the history of family is widely acknowledged, it is unfair if the importance of focusing on the present and posterities. Since the offspring will follow in their ancestors’ footsteps and have job orientations. For instance, in Vietnam’s society, there are myriads of families having a private corporation and lucrative businesses. Hence, their descendants can inherit this legacy and continue conducting the traditional career of the family. Hence, laying stress on the younger generations is quite necessary in this day and age.

In my conclusion, while some assume that investigating the family history is crucial, other people say that specialising in the youngsters is of necessity.

prompt:
Some people think that instead of preventing climate change, we need to find a way to live with it.
To what extent do you agree or disagree?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Write at least 250 words.
essay:
Perhaps, the greatest threat in the world today is not the nuclear bombs, Terrorism, political instability, population outbreak or regional conflicts but it is the climate shifts and environmental degradation. According to me, The last thing a human should do is find a way to live with this and do nothing about it.

To begin with, The frequently occurring storms, Rising temperature in the Arctic, Ozone layer degradation, rising sea level and El-Nino effects in some coastal areas are leading to the one major climate change and if not prevented, it would cause animal extinction one day. We have already harmed the environment to a great extent, but now it's time to come together and solve this crisis in order to secure the future of animals on this planet earth. The sudden flood in U.S regions, rising droughts in African countries and frequent storms in Asian areas are increasing than ever before. According to the 2001 report, Global warming would cause the sea level rise up to 4 feet by 2025 which can cause major Tsunamis in many areas and would likely to cause the extinction of many regions.

Furthermore, extinction caused crisis are maybe little farther for now, but there are so many other issues to which we have to deal with right now. Deforestation and use of some coal, fuels are one of the major issues today. We cannot ignore these concerns and just live with it. These are the major factors which are responsible for Environmental pollution and temperature rising.

In addition to control this crisis, Countries should work together. Establishment of panels and setting some ground rules against deforestation and usage of some harmful materials globally, can reduce damage. Industries have to take strict actions against not using any chemicals and waste materials should not go into water sources.

To conclude, For our own existence on the mother earth, we have to take immediate actions, individually as well as on an international level to reduce the climate shifts or otherwise, we will fail to save our mother planet earth.
evaluation:
## Task Achievement:
- The candidate has addressed the given task adequately, presenting a clear stance on the need to prevent climate change rather than adapting to it.
- The response presents ideas in a structured manner, covering all parts of the task and supporting arguments with examples.
- The essay lacks depth in its discussion of the counterargument, which could have strengthened the overall argument.
- Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 6.5

## Coherence and Cohesion:

prompt:
In some countries, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in.

What are the reasons for this?

How can people research this?
essay:
There is a growing trend whereby residents are researching the history of their homes. This is due to a natural curiosity and practical concerns and should be done through official channels.

Many are interested in the past of their home because they desire to link with history and are worried about potential structural faults. The first reason is analogous to exhaustively studying family genealogy. By researching one’s ancestors or place of residence, it is possible to understand and establish a connection with the past. Moreover, there is a pragmatic reason related to historic construction methods. Older homes, in particular, may have employed unsafe techniques or materials that will degrade, creating the risk of structural damage and, in the worst cases, collapses. By learning about the house and the period when it was built, residents can take the necessary steps to ensure the house is structurally sound.

The method for carrying out such specialized research involves requesting local records. It is possible to do initial research through “word of mouth” and collecting relevant stories in a community. However, this information may be unreliable, and therefore an individual should endeavour to contact their local building authorities. In most countries, it is possible to register  freedom of information requests and receive the required documents from municipal offices. Governments have little incentive to protect such information and are likely to be receptive and helpful in offering assistance. Residents can then be assured they have the most trustworthy information possible in order to better understand the history of their home and any possible defects in its construction.

To conclude, some today gather information concerning the history of their home to understand the past and guarantee their safety. This development is advisable and the authorities should comply and encourage such fact-finding.

- The candidate has adequately addressed the task by discussing the reasons for the growing interest in researching home history and providing methods to conduct this research.

prompt:
Some people think that instead of preventing climate change, we need to find a way to live with it. 
To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Presently, the planet is suffering from a number of environmental issues, namely climate change. Thus, some suggest that it is better for people to adopt to this circumstance and live with it, rather than preventing environmental problems. To certain extent, I am inclined to agree with this statement. 

Some people believe that certain measures can be taken, the effects of which may prevent the climate change. Precisely, people should be encouraged to be eco-friendly consumers. For instance, individuals can use public transport or electric cars, and avoid using motor cars, which pollute the air. Besides, large companies and factories, which its operation highly depends on fuels, can sue renewable energy sources. For example, Intel, famous manufacturing computer processors, has now become one of the largest companies that use green energy. Therefore, individuals should take actions to stop the climate change. 

Meanwhile, it is though that people should fine a lotion to live with this situation. In other words, scientific developments and technologies can assist people to live these environmental issues, such as soil contamination and heat wave. To illustrate, if farmers cannot harvest crops because of poor quality of soil, scientists will produce them in the advanced laboratories. Furthermore, in order not to suffer from heat wave during summer months, governments can construct underground motorways and pathways for drivers and pedestrians. The suggested methods can serve people to live with climate change. 

In conclusion, although it is suggested several ways that may help people to live with climate issues, it is widely believed that individuals and governments should tackle the problems by taking certain effective measures. On balance, I think both people and governments collaborate, it is will be possible to improve the current situation of climate as well as to find ways to live with certain environmental issues, like heat wave, which takes much time and effort to be solved.

prompt: Some people think that robots are important for humankind's future development. Others think that robots have negative effects on society. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
In this age of technocracy, among many wonderous inventions, robots have proven to be the most promising of them all. Many deem it to be a worthy addition to our lives, but contrarians to this notion believe that, it can prove detrimental to our society. In this essay, I will ruminate on both sides, before making my statement.

Those  who consider robotics to be vital for the advancement of civilization, do so by observing several quality-of-life changes brought by it. Such as, the integration of rudimentary assembly line machines used for product manufacturing. Moreover, there exist self-driving cars, waiting to revolutionize methods of transportation. Additionally, there have been major strides in the development of life-like androids. All in all, the future seems bright indeed according to these supporters.

However, trepidatious ones vouching against this technological progress, do so by witnessing drawbacks brought by these gizmos. Like, mass lay-offs caused by the introduction of automatic tools in many factories around the world. Furthermore, these people do not look favourably at the idea of automation in vehicles, as they are wary of hazards associated with it. Also, they hold fast to the belief that, there will come a day when automatons will completely render human talent superficial. As an example, the advent of artificial intelligence art (AI art) has filled artists around the globe with dread, as they think that they will soon be replaced by their man-made counterparts.

To conclude, In my opinion, both views of this argument possess merit. Thus, to ensure a better tomorrow, moderation must be made in terms of the development of bots.

prompt: In many places women are taking jobs which are traditionally done by men. What do you think make these changes happen? What is your opinion about it?
essay:
Traditionally, Men and Women were trusted with a certain list of tasks based on their capabilities during the start of the human race. But we have come across thousand years of evolution and yet, we still have more reservations to make jobs to be gender-neutral . We will discuss  the facts of how the trend is changing and what are the factors contributing to the change.

The first and the most important feature impacting point in  today's world is money. Because of that, In ,families it is presumed that whoever earns will be assumed as leader of the family and due to that there are considered invincible and independent. Most of the oppression against women were staged pointing to them that they were not the breadwinner of the family. To be freed from this vicious cycle, the workforce in every other industry has been boosted by female employees. It empowers them with independence and helps make their own decisions rather than being dependent on men,

Second, the individuality of the people is often perceived based on the nature of their employment. Feminine was always considered as the weakest of all in terms of physical and mental strength. Because of this perception of communities around us, they were never allowed to pursue their dreams. On the contrary, this thinking has motivated females of all ages to prove everyone wrong and change the status quo.

In conclusion to the points listed, the jobs should never be based on  gender, it should rely on the abilities which should be tested rather than assumed. Our generation has kicked off this transition of breaking women into industries to support them and also reap the benefits out of it.

prompt:
Some people think that instead of preventing climate change, we need to find a way to live with it. To what extent do you agree or disagree?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay:
It is believed by certain people that in spite of reversing climatic effects,individuals should learn to get used to it.In my opinion,I completely disagree with this perspective as it can lead to detrimental effects upon ,both the environment and  society.

The predominant reason why folks need to work for the rejuvenation of  nature and prevent further damage is that it will not only safeguard the flora and fauna from the adverse effects of global warming but also ensure the safety of humans. In other words,living with the same conditions without making any efforts to reverse the damage that has been already done ,can significantly disturb the whole life cycle.For example, it is stated by Einstein that if bees die due to ever-increasing pollution, the survival of human beings is also not possible within the next five years ;therefore, the government has formulated various policies and intervented techniques to protect bees numbers from declining ;as a result, pollination has increased tremendously which help in lowering the earth's temperature.

Another reason why masses should not learn to adjust to the depleted environment conditions as it raises the risks of health ailments.According to the studies, cases of skin cancer has been inclined from the past due to depletion of the ozone layer and easier access to UV rays on the earth surface.In this context, resisting the use of fossil fuels and preventing deforestation cannot deteriorate conditions in the future.However, it is difficult for people to come out of their comfort zone and take responsibilities for the damage they had caused but working together to make the world a better place can have positive outcomes for them and for the coming generations.

In conclusion, I think that individuals should always keep checking and reforming the environment they are living in,in order to lead a healthy life and protect  all species from  extinction.

prompt: Some people think that climate change could have a negative effect on business. Other people think that climate change could create more business opportunities. Discuss both views give your own opinion.
essay:
Recently the Global Warming issue has been one of the most discussed topics and divided people into two groups based on their opinion about the damage done to the business by worldwide problems. Some individuals believe that global problems have a harmful impact on business and economics in general, while others think that they provide new opportunities for companies' development.

 

On the one hand, negative effects on the agriculture sector from atmosphere fluctuation can be observed nowadays. Heavy rain or no rain for any specific crop caused a bad effect on farming which results in a farmer being poorer. In addition to this, it also affects the nation where the demand is high for the food and the supply becomes low because of damage. For example, shortage of seafood in food malls. As a consequence, switching of weather affects business majorly.

On the other hand, such sector as tourism has beneficial consequences for global warming. Due to the fast climate change and melting glaciers in cold parts of the planet, people try to catch their last opportunities to visit cold countries hence it develops business. For example, travelling to Antarctica seemed to be an unaffordable vacation for the majority; however, its popularity had  significant growth in the last years with the help of people who are ready to give their last money to see ice blocks.

In conclusion, I believe that global issues have more cause a big loss to companies than bring positive effect to their evolvement, except for some specific sectors.

prompt: Some believe that younger family members should be legally responsible for supporting older family members when they become physically  financially and mentally unable to look after themselves.To what extent do you agree or disagree
essay:
Legally some experts argue that ,young people are obligated to care for the older folks when they are financially,physically and psychologically having challenges and cannot look after themselves.In this write up I strongly disagree with this position .

To begin with,those who are not in support of this argument believed that the Elderly should have an insurance policy against their old   age ,so that they can depend on this insurance each time they need it ,instead of the younger people using their expenses for that .For instance, as one get older they are prone to a lot of disease so this insurance can cater for them.

Moreover,the government is responsible in supporting the aged.This is because the burden of the aged if put on the younger members of the family will make it difficult for them to be financially free.The governments would raise fund to support the aged and employ people to cater for them. For example, Building of a geriatric home for the aged will relieve the burden from young family members.

Despite the fact that it is the responsibility of the young people to care for the aged those in support of this argue that,the elderly have invested in the younger people ,so showing love and support is what they need from the younger ones.This point is not sustainable because there are elderly ones who do not care or invested in their children and expect them to do so as they are physically psychologically and financially unable .

In conclusion,the aged should have an insurance policy and the governments should support them it should not be the legal responsibility of the younger ones to support them in their old age

prompt:
Many people today are choosing to travel to other countries.
Why is this happening?
Is this a positive or negative development?
essay:
Nowadays, people show more tendency to have a tour to other lands around the world. From my perspective, this advance has both positive and negative aspects.

Firstly, by virtue of airplane improvement and development, any destination abroad is accessible with affordable cost and lowest time. In addition, these days, holiday destinations have many advertisements and promotions to attract tourist globally; is that, the number of people choosing foreign countries has been increased significantly instead of local ones.  

Another reason for travel tendency to other countries is the people’s high demand of studying, working and living overseas these days generally. Not only there are many parents taking peril to support their children to study abroad, but also there are many teachers encouraging students to pursue their targets in other lands. Thanks to the global process, many hurdles such as culture, language and frontier have been narrowed and leads to society’s enthusiasm in travelling to other countries.

In my opinion, the reasons described above should be seen as a process with both advantages and disadvantages. On the one hand, holidaymaking provide high rate of wealth which promotes tourism industry dramatically. Furthermore, it boosts competition in jobs, culture adoption and conventions homogenization, which raise development in many social aspects. On the other hand, it will undermine rare languages and small cultures since many people attempt to adopt popular things.

In conclusion, I strongly agree that travel abroad is necessary incentive, which can cause positive and negative effects for aforementioned reasons.

For example, some people are heiresses, if they are curious about the history of the house they live in, they will understand how their ancestors set up with untiring efforts. On the other hand, citizens live in the fourth industrial revolution thus it is easy to access  technology such as online websites, Facebook, online newspapers or watch videos on Youtube. As a result, people just need a mobile phone with the wifi connected then they can find out the knowledge that they want to absorb. In addition, if citizens did not use technology devices, local people will tell them a wonderful narrative story. Another source to discover history is to go to the museum which persuades dwellers to be proud of their culture and liberty.

In conclusion, the more knowledge people learn, the more self-conscious people are. Although people live in a liberty and tranquil century, the paramount benefits of history knowledge that people enhance is a massive source.

prompt: some people believe that studying at university or college is the best route to a successful career, while others believe that it is better to get a job straight after school. discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
While it is considered by some people that getting a degree from a tertiary institution is the best way to a successful career, others are of the opinion that it is preferred to get a job immediately after school. Although there are convincing arguments on both sides, I believe that learning at the University is the best way to have a good profession.

On one hand, learning in the University qualifies one to have a better career. Having a bachelors degree at the University level increases the changes of employment in reputable companies because nowadays, an employer looks for workers who has the right qualifications. For instance, a medical director who wants to employ a doctor in a hospital will accept only those that graduated with a medical diploma.

On the other hand, opponents think that it is better to get a job after secondary school because it increases the years of experience. The earlier someone starts working the more the get accustomed to their profession. For example, some professions such as drivers and nail technicians require years of practice and experience in order to do well in their field. 

I am of the opinion that it is preferable to have a higher education so that one can earn an attractive salary. Most skilled workers earn more than the unskilled labourers. It is known that those who gets a higher education spends a huge sum of money in school. Therefore, it is reasonable that they should be paid well. To illustrate this, in developed countries, a banker's income is greater as opposed to a cleaner.

In conclusion, even though there are arguments on if people should get a certificate from an educational institution or start working after high school,  I reiterate my opinion that it is better to earn a degree because it gives better jobs and salaries. Therefore, people are advised to start considering entering college.
evaluation:
## Task Achievement:
- The essay addresses the task prompt and presents both views on the debate between university education and immediate employment after school.
- The ideas are presented clearly and coherently, with arguments supporting each side.
- However, the essay does not fully explore the advantages and disadvantages of each option and lacks a comprehensive analysis of the topic.
- Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 6.5

prompt: In many countries today, parents are able to choose to sent their children to single-sex schools or co-educational schools. Some people think that children going to single-sex schools have disadvantages later in life. To what extend do you agree?
essay:
Single-sex education is an aproach that is gaining popularity these days. Although there is no unified verdict on wheter it is beneficial or disadvantagtous to children today, I think, students being in same-gander schools may have difficulties later in life. In this essay I will explain my opinion.

      Some parents believe that by eliminating the distractions it becomes easier to retain the knowledge that teachers offer. That is why they do not want their children to be in co-educational schools, because, espesially at pubert period, students of the opossite sex can be a distraction. In addition, these students tend to not feel the preassures of gender roles and learn to pursue areas that interested them no matter what is considered socially acceptable for their biological sex. Despite this, I consider,  the average workspace does not make men and women work in separate corners. There is an expectation for everyone to work together.

   From my point of view,  the school environment is a place where young generation learns what life will be like when thay enter the the real world. Having both men and women in classes allow students of both sex to interact with a wider range of people and learn how to work with and talk to people of the opposite sex.  Same-gander classes limit this opportunitu.

  Taking everything into consideration, I cannot agree with the idea that one gander education is better for children, because they do not have an opportunity to learn communication skills with opposite sex.  Although, it may be easier for students to participate actively and do well academically at a one-sex institution, the real life is not single-sex.

prompt: Some people think that art is an essential subject for children at school while others think it is a waste of time. Discuss both views and give your opinion. Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay:
In the present age, many people believe that art plays a vital role in children's lives and should be mandatorily included in their subject at educational institutions while others think it's not necessary to include it as a subject. This essay will highlight the merits and demerits of art subject in kids life at school. In my opinion, I support the former statement.

On the one hand, individuals think that  art is an essential subject for teenagers as it helps them to express their views and emotions through colours and pencils. Moreover, art also helps them in improving their learning methodology. Meanwhile, with the help of sketching and paintings juveniles can show their creativity to the world. For example, Artist Tahsin Akhtar, painting got selected in the U.K animal welfare art gallery for showing the cruelty towards the animals.

On the other hand, the community think that children nowadays are fully loaded with their studies, and should more concentrate on subjects which will help them in future thus, wasting time on arts subjects. Eventually, making drawings and paintings consume a lot of time and kids gets tired and as a ,result teenagers are not able to focus more on studies. Such as, my nephew takes 5-6 hours in completing a drawing which not only makes him tired but after a time inactive also as as a result, he scored fewer marks in other subjects.

In conclusion, Art plays an important role in one's life, as they can share their emotions and unsaid words through paintings but on the other ,hand it takes a lot of time which impact juvenile study. In my opinion, art should be a necessary subject for children at school as it helps them to open up in a society with their art style.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement:**

- The candidate has adequately addressed the task by discussing both views on the inclusion of art in school curricula.
- The response presents ideas clearly and coherently, providing reasons and examples to support arguments.
- However, the essay does not fully cover all parts of the task as it does not explicitly give the candidate's opinion until the conclusion.
